results.description:
NewSpace NYC is proud to be affiliated with Columbia University Astro Club. Please join us at this event, hosted at Columbia University.

Speaker: Jillian Bellovary, AMNH Post-doctoral researcher
Pupin Hall, Room 301 (follow signs posted)

Lecture: 7:00-7:45 PM
Telescope Observation: 7:45-9:00 PM
Astronomy Q&A and/or Slideshow: 7:45-9:00 PM Abstract: Gravitational waves… what the heck are they? Predicted by Einstein in 1916, we have just directly observed these exotic ripples in space-time for the first time! I’ll discuss the ways to make gravitational waves (think giant explosions and merging black holes!), why they are so hard to measure, and the weird contraptions we have built (and plan to build) to prove their existence.

http://outreach.astro.columbia.edu
results.name: Lecture & Stargazing: Ripples in Spacetime: When Black Holes Merge

results.description:
I am so excited about this event I can barely contain myself!  :) We've turned our usual 'Cookies & Conversation' meetup theme up a notch in honor of our Valentine's inspired topic.  ;) 

Join us on Friday night, February 19th for a fun and lively discussion on the importance of savoring both your wins & your challenges, the essential role your sensuality plays in your business and the success that is truly available when you find your sweet spot.  

Needless to say there will be chocolate & wine offered by our sponsors and some surprise giveaways to be announced. 

BUY YOUR TICKETS HERE

Join this sisterhood of high vibe women ready to let in pleasure, joy, and abundance into all areas of their life. 


Who can attend?

Women Entrepreneurs and women starting or transitioning into their own biz - who are passionate about personal & professional development, and who want connect and be in community with other dynamic women in business.

What should I bring?

Business cards, a friend if you'd like, an open mind

How much does it cost?

$5 online and $10 at the door. Enjoy a glass of wine and chocolates from our sponsors PLUS surprise giveaways. RSVP and we'll see you there!

BUY YOUR TICKETS HERE

Want to be the first to know about our upcoming events & gatherings? Interested in doing a giveaway or sponsoring our next event? Contact Tracy for more information. 


Our Sponsors:  TBA


Your Hosts:

Tracy Robin

Who is Tracy Robin?

Tracy Robin is a Certified Life Coach & Business Mentor for entrepreneurs, an ERYT500, a Certified Kripalu Yoga Teacher, the co-owner & founder of Shine Yoga Center in Cliffside Park, New Jersey and the director of Shine Yoga Center’s Yoga Teacher Certification Program. An entrepreneur & business owner since 2000, she coaches clients globally and travels nationally & internationally leading classes, workshops & retreats. 

Who is Sam Popp? 

Sam Popp is the founder and owner of Teach + Learn Networking, an event and content platform for entrepreneurs and business owners in NJ and NYC. Drawing on a diverse background of social work and sales, Sam curates events and leads workshops with one focus in mind: professional relationship building can be easy (and fun!) once given the right tools. Sam is Jersey born and raised, but now lives in Manhattan. 



SPACE PARTNER 

Shine Yoga Center (@shineyogacenter) is a modern yoga studio and event space in Cliffside Park, NJ, only 10 mins from NYC via the GWB. Interested in our classes or hosting your next event at Shine? Learn more at http://shineyogacenter.com/main
results.name: Chocolate & Wine: How Savoring & Sensuality Leads to a Woman's Success

results.description:
A Family Constellation is a three-dimensional group process that has the power to shift generations of suffering and unhappiness. Entangled with unhappiness from the past, family members often continue patterns of anxiety, depression, anger, guilt, suicide, fear, chronic illness and unfulfilled relationships. It’s a common theme: sad mother, sad daughter... alcoholic father, alcoholic son... the relationship difficulties of the parents, mirrored by the children. We sometimes “take on” destructive familial patterns as a way of “belonging” in our families.

Family Constellations allow us to break these patterns so that we can live healthier, happier, more fulfilled lives. In a moment of insight, a new life course can be set in motion. The results can be life-changing. – Bert Hellinger

This will be an experimental meetup, during which time we will work with a family constellation or more depending on the time. My aim is to also integrate Ancestal Healing Techniques that we have been working with for serveral years now.

Unconscious family loyalties, unresolved family traumas and hidden dynamics are carried in the words we speak, the symptoms we express, and the body defenses we unknowingly construct. When we know how to navigate this unconscious territory, we can begin to shift long-standing patterns of suffering and unhappiness.

During this event we will endeavor to identify the unconscious loyalties, unresolved traumas and hidden dynamics that contribute to patterns of illness, unhappiness and dissatisfaction, clear them, gain insight and deepen the healing process.


If you feel like you could use healing of this nature and are also willing to help with another persons healing, please join me for this event. All that you require is an open mind and heart and the desire to be involved in a potentially powerful healing event. $5 donation.

**One of the issues being experienced by us are people who rsvp and do not show up.  Please be mindful that there is a limit to the amount of attendees.  Please do not rsvp and not arrive as you deprive someone else of the opportunity**

(For those of you driving in, please park at the Bank of America Parking lot, the entrance is between the Bank and State Farm Insurance.  For New Yorkers, NJ Transit Bus 190 from Port Authority, get off at the Rutherford Train Station and walk across the road.
results.name: Family Constellation and Ancestral Healing

results.description:
Our next exhibition is curated by artist Lehna Huie and myself. The show is a collection of contemporary Black artists from a wide spectrum of background and perspectives. The Opening will feature a panel of participating artists as they discuss social factors that shape their art.

Drinks and snacks will be served. Doors open at 6:30pm and artist panel will being at 7pm. Casual and engaging event.

---------------------------------

We take a hard look at the tumultuous dialogue on race, progress, and lack thereof through the visions of contemporary Black artists. Curated by artist and curator Lehna Huie and Puffin Cultural Forum’s Andrew Lee, Conversations presents a mosaic of expressions, ideas, and emotions embedded in the social issues, news headlines, and political movements of our time. Exhibition features many artworks newly created and exhibited for the first time. On view February 12 to March 31.
results.name: Exhibition Opening: Conversations, Puffin Celebrates Black History Month

Hey Super Moms!

I'm looking forward to meeting you all! I really hope you can join me for a cocktail or two (or three) at one of my favorite UES bar/lounges and they can't wait to host us. I was ready to do this sooner, but thought that if I gave a few weeks notice, that we could all arrange sitters or dads to be available for the little humans. We will definitely incorporate them in our next casual meetup (we could start setting something weekly if there is interest,) but I wanted this one to be just some time for us to enjoy a night and have some fun getting to know one another. 

Enjoy a cocktail or glass of wine on me and then feel free to set up a tab if you're having fun! They have great appetizers and things we can share. 

Please RSVP so I know how many to finalize our tables for. I'm really looking forward to creating another arsenal of support and make some new friends!

results.description:
The Good Life rests on three pillars: Rationality – realistic thinking; Love – compassion and social consciousness; and Intuitive Awareness – developing personal wisdom. And the three work in concert with one another. 

To help us to attain the good life, we will explore the practice of Erich Fromm’s “Self-Love” and Abraham Maslow’s “Self-Actualization.” With so much in life that is unknown, intuitive awareness is a precious quality in a humanist’s journey. So, we will discuss the important work done by the prominent psychoanalyst Ruth C. Cohn. Cohn attended our humanist meetings and learned the encounter process, in which sensitive dialogue can enable anyone to develop sharper intuition. 

Humanist Counselors Joseph and Alyson Ben-David will introduce the topic, followed by an interactive encounter session with all participants. All are welcome. Light refreshments. Voluntary contribution.Information:[masked]; www.HumanistFoundation.org
results.how_to_find_us: Please use 76th St. entrance (corner Central Park W). The doorman will direct you to our Meetup room.
results.name: Being and Becoming More Intuitive

BRING:


Acoustic guitar (or mandolin, ukelele, banjo, or just your voice), music stand, tuner, capo, extra strings (just in case), and 12-15 copies of lyrics/chords sheets for 2 songs of your choice. 

7:00PM-ish - We try to have the room open for early arrivals.

7:30 - 9:15PM - Our usual group play. Choose songs with simpler chords that will be fairly easy for the group to play (and won't require a lot explanation). Otherwise, your songs - your choice.

9:15 - 9:30PM - Time for anyone who wishes to perform a song for the group. You don't have to be a pro or a great singer. If you are working on a song (original or cover) and want to try it out, here's your chance. Strictly voluntary but it's a great low-key, supportive environment for the experienced and novice to perform.

9:30 - 10:30PM - After we pack up our gear and straighten up the room, those interested can adjourn to Larchmont Tavern a few doors down for some socializing.

results.description:
Most scary children's films are frightening in a conventional, highly confrontational manner. The Witches has these kind of moments, but it also has moments that are scary in a more subtle, sinister and disturbing manner, such as the sequence involving the child who disappeared into a painting. Nicolas Roeg has done an admirable job of keeping the macabre atmosphere of Roald Dahl's original book, softening it only by replacing the impressively mature ending of the original with a more directly happy (and therefore weaker) conclusion. He also creates a surreal visual quality for the film, aided greatly by Jim Henson's clever animatronic designs for the witches and mice. The cast is uniformly excellent. The coldly imposing Anjelica Huston is a fierce and determined Grand High Witch, creating one of the most memorable and delightfully frightening villainesses in the history of children's cinema. Mai Zetterlingis her perfect foil, capturing both the charm of the grandmother and her hidden formidableness. Jasen Fisher never hits a false note, and Jane Horrocks and Brenda Blethyn turn in valuable support. Inventive, entertaining and sprightly paced, Witches was initially a disappointment at the box office but has achieved a greater following in the years since.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d_ZyqaN_XNM

results.description:
How signing up works: There are 4 spots besides myself for this meetup. Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 4 people (excluding myself) signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 4 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. 

The Place: Casa Mono awarded three stars from The New York Times in 2015 and a Michelin Star in 2009 (and every year since), is a tapas bar-restaurant inspired by the cooking of Spain’s Costa Brava. 

Executive Chef Andy Nusser, who grew up in the fishing village of Cadaqués along Spain’s Costa Brava, has reimagined classic dishes with an affinity for adventurous proteins like sweetbreads, cockscombs, and pig’s feet. Dishes are various as Razor Clams a la Plancha and Bone Marrow with Tomato Jam and Pickled Sandía have garnered a cult following.

http://casamononyc.com

RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event. 

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Casa Mono - One Michelin Star

results.description:
February's Theme ~ Imbolc, the 1st cross-quarter earth holiday, is here.  We are invited to slowly begin awakening from our Winter slumber.  It’s a time of preparation and awareness.  Where are you in your being at this time?  Where will you be when Spring arrives?  What one puts forth during Imbolc will take full-form in the months of Summer.  With a Full Moon at our heels (2/22) we are fully supported to go within and expand so we may ready our selves for all the gifts of deep joy and light that await.

Our three Journeys will focus on ~ the Soul, the Warrior, and Integration ~

Remember to bring a notebook and pen (this is so important for documenting your work within the realms), sacred items to put on the altar, bandana/eye cover, and hand held instruments (If you have. We will have plenty.) Wear comfortable clothing.

Cost ~ $20 Adults (over 25 yrs), $5 Young Adults, Teens, and Children (over 10 yrs - 25 yrs) 

Seeing you on the 19th ~ 
Until then, deep shamanic magick to you ~
results.name: Experience, Grow, and Learn through Shamanic Journeying!

results.description:
Friday nights under the lights! Teams are 7v7, it's a  60min + game and coed friendly.


Pls aim to arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players must bring a white and black t-shirt. Pass the ball & have fun!


***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun & chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Emphasis on passing over dribbling.


4) If there are no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP w/ payment. This goes toward light rentals, field permits, equipment and fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

If you cannot attend, you'll need to update the RSVP 24 hours before the match, in order to receive a match credit. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.
results.name: Friday Soccer 7v7 COED @7:30pm | W. Village 60min+

results.description:
This is our Asia Business Network monthly meeting. We meet at a location near Grand Central in Midtown Manhattan for business networking. We are joined by English students from Asia, who are either working or studying as professionals in Banking, Business, Economics, and Finance. They are in America learning English and are interested in business relationships with Asians in America.

There are networking activities and a conversation topic is introduced to the group. There is a short lecture and there is discussion on the conversation topic. The conversation topic is always Asian Banking, Business, Economics, or Finance related!  Asian business current events are introduced to the group, and economic issues that are important to Asians in America are discussed. Social networking time is also given.

There is going to be an Asian language exchange and there is English language instruction offered at this event.

At the end of the meeting the group is invited to go to Karaoke, or an Asian club, bar, or pub. The location is usually in China Town or Korea Town.

The number of English students in the meetup is given to the right of the event organizers name as pluses to the meeting. The students include a large number of graduate students from Columbia and NYU.  Erik is the host of the event. Erik has had years of experience in hosting Asian events in New York. Erik is a established member of the Asian community in the area and he improves networking performance by encouraging social networking and giving coaching for relationship building.

Translation Services: There is a Chinese - English translator in the group, whose services are for members in need of them. There is a Vietnamese translator whose services are offered upon request. The group is planning on adding a Japanese - English and Korean - English translator also. Erik the organizer is also familiar with Indonesian and Mongolian. Indonesian and Mongolian translation services are also going to be offered upon request. Translation services are free.

When the monthly attendance for this event exceeds 30, it is going to be made a weekly event.

There is a $5.00 fee for attending this event.

Thank you,
Erik
The Asian Business Network Organizer

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Technical Overview of Amazon Echo

An ACGNJ Window Pains presentation by Barry Burd


Echo is Amazon's entry in the intelligent voice-enabled assistant market. Unlike Siri or Google Now, Echo isn't mobile. Echo stays plugged into an outlet in your home. But Echo is completely hands-free, so you can talk to Echo the way Captain Picard talks to his ship's computer. In this presentation, Barry will demonstrate the Echo's capabilities and show you how to develop new capabilities for the Echo device. For a preview, click here.

results.description:
For those of you who know Katie Pettit, you will appreciate seeing some of her great choreography in an unusual setting and with an unusual theme.  Here is a description in her own words:

I COULD NEVER LOVE ANYONE... ,a new dance theater piece illuminating the struggles of addiction, will be taking flight in February at Green Space in Astoria, NY! This incarnation takes our goal of raising awareness, and removing the stigma associated with addiction, leaps and bounds forward. We've been in rehearsals, conjuring a unique and accessible way to illustrate the consuming power addiction holds over the addict. From a four dancer piece to now seven artists sharing the stage, the addiction has grown into a Hydra Head! A necessary Voice to aid in a very difficult topic, I COULD NEVER LOVE ANYONE... strives to ignite conversation and relieve those who need support, whether they be addicts themselves or family and friends whose loved ones are in turmoil.


Price is a mere $17.  Pleases sign up on this the Red Hat site and also order your tickets in advance here:

http://www.greenspacestudio.org/Tickets.html

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

Join a fun group of NYSN members and friends as we take a step back in time in one of NYC's most exclusive nightspots; The Carnegie Club.  The Carnegie Club is a magnificent space that's both grand (25-foot ceilings with a mezzanine) and intimate. It provides a uniquely Gothic backdrop with a hand carved 18th century bookcases filled with a wide assortment of leather-bound titles and a stone fireplace all of which is offset by plush, contemporary  furnishings. Offering an elegant and stylish atmosphere.  We will have a special section reserved for our group for socializing then great live music from Barry Bryson and the Stan Rubin Quartet.  The Carnegie Club is also one of the select few clubs in NYC that you can still enjoy legal tobacco in. 

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at the door) Purchase tickets here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cigars-scotch-and-live-jazz-tickets-21293570643

What to expect:

-About a dozen members and friends casually gathering for cocktails and conversation.

-Some will smoke cigars, (other legal tobaccos okay too) . Carnegie is well ventilated.

-Food is available

-You will be responsible for only your food and drinks on separate checks. 2 drink minimum.

-You may bring your own cigars, no cutting fee.

-The $10 includes music and reservation charge only.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at door)  - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cigars-scotch-and-live-jazz-tickets-21293570643

Dress: Business casual/lounge

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will come on their own

What if I don't smoke and just want to enjoy the music? Not a problem

Once again, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com. There will be other people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Cigars, Scotch and Live Jazz

Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
November's caller is the beloved Donna Hunt and the band is JAM - with Joe DePaulo on percussion; Audrey Knuth on fiddle; and Mike Sokolovsky on guitar - a great combination.


Contra dancing is a great way to have fun, meet new people, burn a few calories and let loose all the stress of the week!

Beginners' Workshop begins at 6:30 pm.  Contra Dance is a traditional American folk dance which requires no prior dance training or experience—if you can walk, you can Contra Dance.  Traditional Contra Dancing is done with "Ladies and Gents" but at Gender Role-Free Dances we dance whichever role we like and with whomever we like!  Our monthly dances are open to everyone, regardless of sexual orientation, gender expression, dance experience and number of left feet.

Join us after the dance for socializing at the Village Den around the corner at 11th St. and Greenwich Ave.

Fr this dance only, check out the website at www.brooklyncontra.org or visit the Facebook page at Brooklyn Contra.


For more information, check out our website: www.villagecontra.org or our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/villagecontra/

results.description:
‘The Timeless Wonder’ is not a theory of how things are. It comes directly from the wonder of life’s simplicity and is beyond understanding. 'What is' - which is all there is - does not need any realization. In fact, it cannot be realized, because it already is realized. Of course, 'what is' is not dependent on you seeing it. 'What is' is not dependent on you understanding it. 'What is' is not dependent on you at all – it cannot, because there is no 'you'. 'What is' just is. No-thing appearing as this, just is. Simple. There is no need for anything else. In fact, nothing else is. In the meetings, the dilemma of the seeking self, the root of all suffering, is discussed and illuminated. This may end the perception of being separate from wholeness … and change everything … apparently.

results.description:
New to Blues dancing? Check out our FAQ. 


If you've never been to Friday Night Blues NYC before, it's a great idea to check out our policies on Blues etiquette and on harassment before coming.


****************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson (Musicality) w/ Shawn​ and Shoshi​
8:30pm-9:30pm - Extended Topics (Rock With It, Roll With it, Breathe With It) w/ special guest instructor Chris Carey​
9:30pm-1:00am - DJ’d Dance w/ Chris and Stephen York​ from Boston

$10 class / $12 dance / $20 both
Cash only


Stepping Out Studios is located at 37 West 26th St, 9th Floor. To get buzzed in, dial 9 and the green call button on the keypad to the right of the building entrance.

****************************************************************************

This week, we have special guest instructor Chris Carey teaching the Extended Topics class!


For many years Chris Carey led a dismal, danceless life. Then one fateful night in late 2008, he was dragged along to the University of Delaware Swing Club and he instantly fell in love! Now he’s organizing the Philadelphia blues scene and teaching and DJing blues every chance he gets! He's also been showing the world how awesome Philly is by bringing home those shiny (metaphorical) trophies from national events including 1st in the Advanced J&J Bambloozled 2014, 1st in the Open J&J Steel City 2015, and 2nd in the Invitational J&J at Bambloozled 2015!

****************************************************************************

EXTENDED TOPICS:


Series This Month: Close Embrace
This series will hone your close embrace skills.  Starting with how to create a comfortable embrace, we will work on how to create space in the embrace to enable both the graceful and traveling movement of the ballroomin' style as well as a more sharp and rhythmic movements of the jukin' style.

This Week: Rock With It, Roll With it, Breathe With It
So, you know the basics, but what's the secret ingredient to take your close embrace and make it truly magical? This class will look more deeply into how to use tone and relaxation to connect and communicate with your partner! Whether you're moving around the floor, groovin' in place, or transitioning in and out of close embrace, we'll explore how to work as individuals to create one single dancing body with your partner.


Read more about our classes at: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/learning

****************************************************************************

DETAILS:

No need to bring a partner! Friday Night Blues NYC is a social dance; we dance with strangers, we dance with our friends... we want to dance with you! Our crowd can typically bring in anywhere from 30 to 80 dancers on any given evening.

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $12 (sorry, cash only). Purchase both at the same time and pay only $20 for the night!

****************************************************************************


Volunteers get in for FREE!
Email [masked] to inquire about volunteer opportunities.

Stay informed: join our mailing list!

Friday Night Blues NYC is on Yelp! If you enjoy our event, please consider leaving us a review.
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/about/locations
results.name: Friday Night Blues NYC

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early!  DOORS CLOSE AT 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: TurnON Games

Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

You MUST RSVP to play. Message me on Meetup or text/call me (Dan) at[masked] if you have any questions or RSVP issues. If you're not on the 'going' list, it means you're not signed up.

Please note: If you sign up, we're expecting you to stay and play, not leave halfway through. We only do 12 players per court, so leaving early will leave a team with only 5 players. If you're not sure if you can stay the whole time, send me a message before signing up.

https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/11401142_1720823001478478_3682666258495805787_n.jpg?oh=6d3a52147bbb4787f69b1b492b283ec2&oe=56D0E6E4

Every Friday Night!
Salsa Dancing in Times Square is Back!
LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. We have a nice floor, great ventilation, fun willing dancers, and your total expense for a Friday Night is 12.00

Mention Salsa New York at the door and it will be $10


You do not know how to Dance Salsa? No problem. We offer a Free Salsa class at 9:30pm every Friday. So come alone or bring your friends,. Either way, you are guaranteed to learn and have a blast.
You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.
results.name: Salsa Dancing: La Fama Mention Salsa New York for the discount !

results.description:
Let's dance, let's practice, and let's meet and greet @ La Fama. We are here every Friday For those who like a beginner introductory Salsa class and those who want to dance after the class. The Free beginner class, after admission is also on. Admission: $10 to get in. Introductory class for beginners is given at no extra charge by teh instructor. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 2:30am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class: The Free class (after admission) at La Fama begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic step every Friday. If you like to take a formal Salsa dancing class that goes beyond the basics A new 12 weeks cycle will begin on February 18th. For details, join the facebook group and/or join the Class meetup group. Links below:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

http://www.meetup.com/Progressive-Salsa-Classes/events/228266520/

results.description:
Let's dance, let's practice, and let's meet and greet at La Fama; New York City's all new Salsa Dance Party in the heart of Manhattan's Time Square. 


We are here every Friday night from 9:30pm to 3am. If you're tired of being in a night club setting that plays more Reggaeton and Bachata then actual Salsa, then this event is for you.  We are located very conveniently in the Center of Manhattan.  Every Train/Bus stops here.  There is also no night club/bar/lounge hassle to deal with. 


A beautiful dance floor and great sound system with out the pesky hassle of a night club.  Dress as you like and feel free to bring your own drinks. 

Also, For those who like a beginner introductory Salsa class and those who want to dance after the class. The Free beginner class at 9:30pm, after admission is also on. 

Admission: $10 to get in. Introductory class for beginners is given at no extra charge by teh instructor. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 3:00am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class: The Free class (after admission) at La Fama begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic step every Friday. If you like to take a formal Salsa dancing class that goes beyond the basics A new 12 weeks cycle will begin on February 18th. For details, join the facebook group and/or join the Class meetup group. Links below:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

http://www.meetup.com/Progressive-Salsa-Classes/events/228266520/

results.description:
Greetings, snow lovers! Windham Mountain offers skiing, riding and winter fun for the whole family, just two hours from the New York metro area. With the Catskills’ highest vertical and 98% snowmaking coverage, Windham makes the most of Northeast winter. Our world-class snowmaking crew blankets 260 acres with a thick base of snow and grooms our natural snow for the best ski conditions in the East.

*** Trip plan email via Eventbrite will be sent out 2 days before the event providing the details. ***

Date: February 20th, 2016 Saturday. Please arrive 30 minutes earlier. 

Depart 5:45 AM from Brooklyn: (Pacific Branch Library) Southeast corner of 4th Ave. & Pacific St. Brooklyn, NY 11217 Brooklyn, NY 11217 (Map)

Depart 6:30 AM from NYC: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of 43rd St & 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Depart 7:10 AM from NJ: (NJ Transit Ramsey Route 17) 1 Spring St, Ramsey, NJ 07446 (Map)

Return: Depart from Windham at 4:30 PM and expect to arrive at NJ at 6:45 PM, NYC at 7:30 PM & Brooklyn at 8:00 PM.

Cost: Includes all mountain lift ticket + round trip bus transportation. 
This is $17 to 20 off comparing to other bus tours. 
Early birds $79 for first 27 spots; Regular $89 for last 27 spots.

Additional Cost:
* $30 to upgrade lift ticket to Beginner Package which include lower-mountain lift ticket, rental (skis or snowboard) & group lesson.
* $39 for Ski or Snowboard Rental Package. Ski Rental Package includes skis, boots, poles & helmet; Snowboard Rental Package includes snowboard, boots & helmet.

Buy Ticket Here: http://feb202016windham.eventbrite.com You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. When Quickpaying, please indicate boarding location. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) Your spot SVP is NOT confirmed unless your payment is received 

Maximum: 54

Refund Policy: 
* Full refund minus $20 processing fee if cancelled 14 days in advance.
* 50% refund if cancelled 7 days in advance. 
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show.
*100% refund if the event is cancelled.

Direction: http://www.windhammountain.com/destination-guide/directions/

Check out more at http://www.windhammountain.com/

Group Ski/Snowboard Video: http://youtu.be/WpBrYEgjH00

http://youtu.be/WpBrYEgjH00

results.description:
Welcome to Early Bird English, the fun and interesting way to improve your conversation skills early in the day -- without cutting into the rest of your weekend!

 Leader Eve will supply plenty to discuss, but feel free to bring along an English-language passage that you have enjoyed or found puzzling. We'll all take a look and discuss what it means.

 Early Bird English is founded on the idea that people learn best when they are enjoying themselves. Each session is quickly paced, friendly, and meant to challenge.

Eve charges a small, non-refundable fee for each session, which helps to cover the cost of the website as well as her preparation.   Please note that the $10 fee DOES NOT cover the cost of coffee!  Please also note that if only one person attends (in addition to Eve), the meeting will last one hour instead of 1.5.

http://thejoyofenglish.org/

When we learn with pleasure, we never forget.

-- Alfred Mercier

"Lenovo is one of a growing number of multinationals from the non-Anglophone world that have made English their official language."

-- The Economist, 2/15/14

"A strong vocabulary may be your ticket to side-stepping dementia," says a new study from researchers in Spain.  "...An ample vocab is an indication of robust cognitive reserves, a surplus of neurons that help the brain compensate for memory lapses..." 

-- Prevention, April 2015

"It might have been easier to learn a language years ago, but still, I'm having fun...I was heartened to see, just a month or so ago, a Penn State study suggesting that learning a new language can improve your brain function.  It can, in the researcher's words, 'lead to more graceful aging.'" 

-- Tina Hay, editor, The Penn Stater, March/April 2015

"The average American speaks one language.  Be more than average."

-- magazine ad for Rosetta Stone

Great tips for learning a language: http://markmanson.net/foreign-language
results.name: Let's talk!

results.description:
Hello! Who's interested in doing this fun winter race? I signed to fast hike/run.  Sign up on the official Febapple race website, and please RSVP / reply below in comments section -- in case people want to car-trainspool.  -- R

*****************************

Meet at: Trailhead Parking lot, across the street from the train station. 


Public transportation: NJ Transit. From NYC: Trailhead is an easy 45 min train ride from Penn Station. Take train from NY Penn Station to Maplewood, NJ. Then call taxi or GPS/walk through town to race start. ~$8 fare each way. View train schedule.  (Walk from Millburn train station is more scenic, through forest, but longer.)


Note:  Driving is possible from NYC. Traffic is usually not bad going out, but often heavy on way back into NYC on weekends. However, one may have to drive if starting early before train service starts.

What: Race on South Mountain reservation in a lovely local, little-known forest, on the Febapple trail race route.  10-mile to 50-mile options.

Highlights: forest, reservoir, low hills, rocky dirt trails, small, sometimes frozen water falls. 


Lunch: optional lunch to follow. Options: Take out from nearby Green Nectar, Thai house, or Goldberg's deli and eat in the park outside.

Snow or shine. Check race website for updates.

Weather:  Millburn, NJ

Comments? Want to carpool? Post in comments section below.

Happy trails!

Photo:  Shauger group, via West Orange Patch

 


____________

Note

This is not a Raw Trail organized run. It is just a notice of a race some members are planning to do that is sent out to those who might want to join them. By choosing to join them, you agree that you are solely responsible for yourself, your own race preparation, and for following trail etiquette<a href="http://www.trailrunner.com/news/trail_etiquette.htm"></a>, laws, race rules, park rules, and park safety guidelines. Thanks!
results.name: Febapple trail race!

results.description:
This will be a fast pace hike....the goal is to be done by noon

This hike will be 10.4 challenging miles. The first half of this hike is constant up or down, the second has more level areas. No beginners on this hike.. Several steep climbs are involved as well as one long descent that’s sure to leave your legs quivering from the exertion. We will climb and descend four mountains – Windbeam, Bear, Board, and Harrison – to take in views of the surrounding mountains as well as the Wanaque and Monksville Reservoirs. Also scramble over Tory Rocks

Parking: RT 287 to exit 55, take 511 N (Wanaque), continue through Wanaque for several miles. Make a left onto West Brook Rd. Continue across Reservoir. At the T-intersection, make a right onto Stonetown Rd. and turn left on Mary Roth Drive which ends at the Stonetown Recreation Area with a large parking lot.

Hike Directions: The entire loop follows RED TRIANGLE on WHITE.

Time:  6 hours

Elevation Gain:2370 ft


Difficulty: Strenuous


Gear: hiking boots, 2 liters water snack/lunch
results.name: Stonetown Circular last minute fast pace

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

results.description:
We will be ascending the Major Welch,  then descending on the AT. Bring a snack and beverage of choice to  enjoy during the break. this is a quick paced hike.

We will meet in the main large parking lot closest to the Inn. there may be an $8 parking fee if anyone is manning the booth. 

If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. Typically we meet at the parking lot and begin together. As we ascend, the group breaks off. We reconvene at the peak and begin our descent together.  You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of an evening event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. This is not mean, it is for your protection as well as the safety of the group. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

Distance: about 4 miles round trip

Gain: about 1200

Hike time: approx 2 hours

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

results.description:
Let's explore the ghost town Doodletown and then see some views atop West Mountain!

About 7 miles, this will take around 4 hours.

We'll meet at 9am in the parking lot on Seven Lakes Drive, about 0.5 miles off of the Palisade exit 19.

Taking the 1777 W Trail, we will first head to Doodletown to explore the abandoned settlement, with old house foundations, cemetaries, reservoir, and mine. We will be taking woods roads, not necessarily marked trails.

We will eventually head to the yellow SBM trail and start up to the peak of West Mountain to a shelter and fantastic Hudson River view. Then we will turn onto the blue Timp-Torne trail and stay on the ridge of West Mountain for more wonderful views.

Finally, we will head back to the parking lot on the red Fawn trail, then white AT trail.

Doodletown Walking Tour Sign:

Part of the ruins at Doodletown, with plaque explanation:

West Mountain Shelter:


---

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

results.description:
COME JOIN US FOR ULA'S CATSKILL 35ER FINISH! THIS WILL BE AN INTERMEDIATE WINTER CONDITION HIKE. WE WILL TRAVERSE THE BURROUGHS RANGE IN THE SOUTHERN REGION OF THE CATSKILLS INCLUDING SLIDE (VIA CURTIS-ORMSBEE), CORNELL AND WITTENBERG MOUNTAINS. YOU CAN EXPECT THIS TRIP TO BE ABOUT 11 MILES. PLEASE NOTE THAT THE TRAIL CONDITIONS MAY BE STEEP AND ICY AND MICROSPIKES WILL BE MANDATORY ON THIS HIKE!

FOR MORE INFO CHECK THESE LINKS:

http://www.catskill-3500-club.org/catskill-peaks/slide-mountain.htm

http://www.catskill-3500-club.org/catskill-peaks/cornell-mountain.htm

http://www.catskill-3500-club.org/catskill-peaks/wittenberg-mountain.htm

WE WILL MEET TO SPOT CARS AT 9:00am SHARP at the Trailhead Parking at the end of Woodland Valley Rd in Phoenicia, NY

WE WILL THEN CONTINUE TO OUR START POINT AT the Slide Mountain West Trailhead Parking Area off Oliverea Rd (47) in Phoenicia, NY

DISTANCE: Approximately 11 miles

HIKING PACE: up to 2 mph

ESTIMATED HIKE TIME: up to 6-8 hours

DIFFICULTY: Intermediate with winter conditions and icy trails

CURRENT WEATHER FORECAST: Cloudy with a high of 53 degrees


RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Microspikes (and Crampons as needed)

• Winter base layer, mid layer and outer shell (as needed)

• Gloves, Hat, Gaiters


• Headlamp with spare batteries - Lowe's has an Energizer 200 Lumen headlamp for only $19.97

• Shoes with good grip - preferably with ankle support

• A Medium Pack

• Related maps, a Compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, First Aid, etc.

• Hiking Poles



RELATED MAPS:

New York - New Jersey Trail Conference - Catskills Trails Map Set

Catskill Hiking maximum group size limitations.

• A group size limit of 12 people for day hiking off-trail or in wilderness areas is in place. Any group larger than 12 must split up (by no less than 1 mile) into smaller, self-sufficient groups that satisfy the size requirement. These groups shall not congregate into one large group at trail junctions, rest stops, lunch breaks, etc.

• In all other areas of the Catskills a group size limit of 20 is in place. Groups larger than 20 must split up (by no less than 1 mile) into smaller, self-sufficient groups that satisfy the size requirement. These groups shall not congregate into one large group at trail junctions, rest stops, lunch breaks, etc.


 NYC HIKING & OUTDOOR ADVENTURE GROUP LEGAL DISCLAIMER

results.description:
We'll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery for a run on the Old Croton Aqueduct. Afterward, whoever is interested can head to the Red Barn Bakery for breakfast. This is a good run for new runners because it is out and back - no set distance to cover but you will need to wear a watch. Feel free to turnaround at any point or walk/run at your own pace. 

Details about the Saturday run

Route: We’ll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St.) in Irvington and jog VERY casually together to the Old Croton Aqueduct trail. (If you are unfamiliar with the area and would prefer to walk rather than run to the trail, click here to see the trail on a map.) From there we’ll head south toward Dobbs Ferry. There is no set distance. Everyone will walk or run at their own pace for 25 minutes, and then turn around and come back. Please wear a watch so that you know when to turn around.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: In front of Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St, Irvington, NY 10533). Free parking is available on weekends in the MetroNorth lot next door.

</a>  <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1452433901730637/">Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.

venue.name: Stanley Isaacs Senior Center

results.description:
This volunteer opportunity helps a segment of the NYC population that is particularly vulnerable (our home-bound seniors) and is facing a steadily growing problem - hunger. As our city’s elderly grow older, they are more likely to have mobility limitations, while living at or below the poverty level. The elderly of East Harlem are particularly more vulnerable, residing in challenging living conditions alone, and who can no longer shop or cook for themselves.

Citymeals-on-Wheels (www.citymeals.org) raises private funds to ensure no homebound elderly New Yorker will ever go a day without food or human company. Citymeals funds 33 community-based agencies that bring weekend, holiday and emergency meals to homebound elderly New Yorkers - one of the agencies we'll be helping as volunteers.

How are we helping?

On Saturday, February 20th, we'll assist the Stanley Isaacs Senior Center Citymeals-on-Wheels program with delivery of meals to the elderly. Volunteers should wear weather appropriate clothes and comfortable shoes as deliveries are done on foot within walking distance from the meal center.  Although the weather may not always be favorable, the meals MUST be delivered as many, if not all, of the elderly in the program RELY on the meal delivery for the day.

Our Meetup

We'll meet at the Senior Center at 9:30am on Saturday for a short training, then break into small teams of 3 to 4 people to deliver the meals to the elderly. A light breakfast of juice, coffee, pastry and/or bagels will be offered.

If you RSVP, please try to be on time, or arrive no later than 9:30am, which is when we start delivery. The time commitment ends at 12pm and goes by very quickly. 

If you have any questions, running late, need more information on parking and etc., feel free to call/text Daniel at 774.275.3646.

Directions to the Union Settlement Senior Center

The Stanley Isaacs Senior Center is located at 415 East 93rd Street. The closest subway is the #6 train to 96th Street & Lexington Avenue, then walking east to 93rd street & 1st Avenue. The building is offset from the street (toward the FDR Drive), enter through sliding glass doors. The M15 bus line stops nearby, along 1st Avenue (uptown) or 2nd Avenue (downtown).

Thanks and see you there!

results.description:
Central High School and PBS Media presents an exciting celebration: KHEM COMIC FEST! This festival takes place in Central High School, Newark, NJ on February 20, 2016 from 10 am to 7 pm. 

KHEM COMIC FEST is a convention, festival and celebration. Our goal is to develop a youth literacy and expression through reading, writing, drawing or developing sequential art and related media. Hence, we created a festival that will feature and promote creators of comics, books, film, and other media with a focus on people of color; culture, concepts and interests. 

Our festival is for everyone and a diverse networking event for professionals as well as enthusiasts to aspire, inspire and appreciate people of color contributions as it relates to Popular Arts media. 

KHEM COMIC FEST is not limited to comics. Our events highlight other literary genres like speculative fiction, as well as video games, collectable toys and models, films/documentaries, and all other media related to the Popular Arts.

KHEM COMIC FEST will also provide relevant, engaging, informative entertainment and professional networking opportunities for the Newark community. Among the attractions provided are interactive activities which include; Comic Book Marketplace, Comic Book workshops, Comic Library, Panel Discussions, Screenings and Super Hero Training.

Khem Comic Book Fest is free and open to everyone! 


Want to become a sponsor or a participant? Please forward all inquiries to Festival Coordinator, Naseed Gifted (732)[masked]


For Tickets 

http://www.eventbrite.com/o/central-high-school-amp-pbs-media-7857628049


Programming Line Up for Khem Comic Fest 2016.


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


10:00AM - 7:00PM


KHEM COMIC BOOK FEST MARKETPLACE


Atrium


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


11:00AM - 11:15AM


WELCOME TO THE 2ND ANNUAL KHEM COMIC BOOK FEST


Auditorium

Co-founders: Naseed Gifted, PBS Media; Darrell Goza, Goza Creative/ScriptGraphics and Ayanna Camean, Central High School


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


11:15 AM – 11:55 AM


KHEMETIC SIGNS AND SYMBOLS 


Auditorium

The history of Khemet and how it influenced the world & our everyday lives. 

Dilettante Bass (Marketing Director, PBS Media)


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


12:00 PM – 12:55 PM


USING COMICS TO TEACH STEM


Auditorium 

With the advent of the 21st century sharing society, we are rapidly evolving into a hypervisual culture. Between all the major social media platforms, we are now sharing over 500 million pictures a day and that is expected to double every year. Comic books and graphic novels transform the way we see and teach STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics) addressing the needs of diverse learners. With the new emphasis on reading nonfiction text, academic vocabulary, comics are more relevant than ever. Join Educators and Comics Creators as we present strategies for teaching STEM topics.

Darrell Goza (ScriptGraphics) 


Naseed Gifted (Educator, Writer for P.B.Soldier scifi comic book series)


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


12:00 PM – 12:55 PM


DEVELOPING YOUR OWN VIDEO GAME


Room 111

Ever dreamed of making a video game? The next thought is usually something along the lines of ‘oh, but I can’t do that’. Truth is, you can make a game and start right now.

Jamal O’Garro (Code Crew) 


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


12:00 PM – 2:00 PM 


FACE PAINTING 


Atrium


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


1:00 PM – 1:55 PM


PROMOTING LITERACY THROUGH THE USE OF COMICS


Auditorium

Graphic novels are excellent resources for teaching visual rhetoric, they remain, at heart, stories with the characteristics of other literature. Discussions on development of theme through motifs and symbols, anthropomorphism and other figurative representation, juxtaposition (and the results of juxtaposition: paradox and irony), methods of characterization, impact of syntax, and tone.

Moderated by Daniel McNeal (Corsairs) 

Suliman Onque (On-Q Comics)


Rob Taylor (Super Human)


Sandra Richards (Wise Ink Creative Publishing) 


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


1:00 PM – 1:55 PM


MAKING SUPER POWERED MOVIES WITH YOUR IPHONE


Room 111

In this session, we will discuss the simplicity and possibility of creating your very own superpower sci-fi short film using just an iPhone. Using the Superpower FX app, iMovie apps, and a little imagination, you may very well become the next Stephen Spielberg or Michael Bay. Don’t miss this opportunity to transform your superhero imagination into reality. 

Abdul-Hakeem (Teacher)


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


1:00 PM – 4:00 PM


NERF CHALLENGE 


Cafeteria

FULL SPECTRUM: WHY COLOR IN COMICS MATTERS


Auditorium

One of the most basic traits of a hero, is to fight for humanity and impact the world around them. If the majority of our heroes are all from the same race, heritage, or ethnicity, it not only sends the message that only one group is capable of heroism, but it also leaves no room for other races to fight for humanity as well. Exploring the ideas behind diversity and talking about how we can help spread those changes, without excluding any race, is vital to the comic book discussion. Join us we delve into the heart of what multiculturalism really looks like in the universe of heroes.

results.description:
54° and Sunny this Saturday Feb 20! Dance Walk is calling. Bring your own ipod & earbuds--everybody listens to their own music as we dance walk around the park loop. What is "dance walking"? It's an improvised form of walking, with music, doing whatever movement comes naturally. It's walking and moving your arms. Or skipping, skitching, low-stepping, sideways running. It's responding to the rhythm, attitude, or story of the music you're hearing. In short, it's having a dance party in your living room, while walking through the park--hilarious and exhilarating. Check out this funny and smart article recently published about the Dance Walk in Prospect Park:

http://themomtropolis.com/dance-walk-you-know-you-want-to/

results.description:
Class cost is $75. Register here:

http://civicrm.fatcatfablab.org/civicrm/event/info?reset=1&id=29

Introduction to Arduino Class

10AM-Noon : Formal Class with hands on.
Noon-1:00: Lunch time break and socializing
( lunch not provided)
1:00-2:30: Hands on assisted practice.

Arduino is a family of very inexpensive small programmable devices that connect to the physical world. They input data from temperature, proximity, acceleration and hundreds of other types of sensors, and output to LEDs, motors, sound devices, LCD displays, and much more. Arduino is an open source platform supported by a large community of people sharing their knowledge and most importantly Arduino is very easy to use.

In this Introduction to Arduino class you will learn how to install the free Arduino Development Environment software onto your Mac or Windows laptop and hookup an Arduino to your laptop's USB port to program it. A very basic understanding of programming is recommended, but it does not matter which language. This course will be taught with two different Arduinos. For most people, we recommend the Arduino UNO that is general purpose and has a lot of memory and expansion capabilities. For students who wish to learn Arduino for wearable electronics, we recommend the Adafruit Flora which is optimized to be sewn into clothing with conductive thread and be powered by a battery. The software and principles to use these two devices are much the same.

The class will cover an introduction to Arduino programming, basic electrical circuits, how circuits are documented with electronic schematics, and a program called Fritzing. We will control some LEDs, and input some sensor data. This class will be using solderless breadboards to hookup components; there will be no soldering involved.

The instructor of this class will be Stewart Newfeld who has an Electrical Engineering degree from Rutger University, years of industrial experience, and loves to teach and share his enthusiasm for making things.

IMPORTANT: Students must bring their Mac or Windows laptop to class. No laptops will be provided.

MATERIALS CHARGES: Students may bring their own Arduinos and breadboards, or they can purchase the following on-site right before class.


Arduino Device $20.00 + Tax
Every student must either bring their own Arduino UNO or Adafruit Flora, or purchase one of these for $20 + tax.

Hardware Starter Kit $18.00 + Tax
Unless they bring something similar, every student must purchase a hardware starter kit consisting of

- solderless breadboard
- jumper wire assortment
- resistor assortment
- capacitor assortment
- diodes
- servo motor
- push buttons
- potentiometer
- LED assortment
- NEO Pixel LEDs
results.name: Introduction to Arduino Class

results.description:
Updated December 18th, 2015


WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 


[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

[img src="">

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

results.description:
**Catskill Winter 3500 Series - Balsam and Eagle Mountains**

Summit TWO Catskill 3500'+ High Peaks in one day and enjoy some lovely views from Balsam - We'll also be going over Haynes Mountain (a non-high peak) on the way to Eagle.  Note that Balsam Mountain is one of the four Catskill High Peaks that you are required to summit in winter in order to become a 35er (i.e. a member of the Catskill 3500 Club).

** BE SURE TO READ THE FULL DESCRIPTION BELOW BEFORE SIGNING UP FOR THIS HIKE **

* Do not sign up for this hike if you haven't read through the full event description *


------------------------

Moderate Pace (not slow) - You should have recent experience hiking multiple Catskill High Peak mountains (or their equivalent) in a single day to do this.  You should have previously (and recently) completed hikes of equivalent mileage and elevation gain to this hike, in winter, to do this.  You should be getting regular cardio exercise to do this.


Please note that there is likely going to be some snow and/or ice on the trails this time of year and trails will be slippery.

Please check the estimated mileage and elevation gain on this before RSVPing - and please read the description IN ITS ENTIRETY.

------------------------

HIKE SNAPSHOT:

Estimated distance:  Approximately 9 3/4 miles

Estimated elevation gain:  Approximately 3,000 feet

Estimated time:  Approximately 5 1/2 hours, total, including breaks

Sunrise:  6:48 a.m.  Sunset: 5:35 p.m.

-------------------------


** RSVP Note: All RSVPs are initially to the waiting list.  I reserve the right to save spots for people I know I can rely on to show up and to be prepared for this hike.  If there are spots left, I'll open the "going" list up a few days before the event and email everyone on the waiting list at that point telling them to change their RSVP to "Yes" if they still intend on going. 

Hiking groups are limited to 20 people in this area.

------------------------


Special Gear / Requirements:

Hiking boots; Layers of non-cotton wicking clothing suitable for winter hiking;  Enough food/water for the hike (if you don't know how much food and water you'll need for a hike like this, you should not be on it) WHEN PLANNING WHAT YOU'RE GOING TO BRING YOUR WATER IN, KEEP IN MIND THAT HYDRATION PACK TUBES ARE LIKELY TO FREEZE IF TEMPERATURES ARE BELOW FREEZING; Trekking poles;  Gaiters;  First aid;  Insulating shirt & rain jacket (just in case);  MICROSPIKES or HILLSOUND TRAIL CRAMPONS (things like Yaktrax or Stabilicers will NOT be enough); Possibly snow shoes depending on trail conditions;  Catskill Trails conference map # 142 and/or National Geographic Illustrated Map of Catskill Park trails (map # 755); HEAD LAMP WITH EXTRA BATTERIES in case we (or you) don't finish before dark (the sun sets early this time of year); camera!

** NOTE:  You are responsible for yourself and what equipment you bring, and it will be assumed and expected that you have all appropriate equipment, including the relevant topographic trail map and a compass, with you during this hike.


-------------------------


MEETUP TIMES AND LOCATIONS:

10:15 a.m. - start time from the parking area for the McKinley Hollow trailhead


The coordinates for that parking area are: [masked], [masked]

Please be early and give yourself time to find a spot in the parking area, park, get suited up in your hiking equipment, etc. - we leave on time.

 --------------------------

ROUTE DESCRIPTION:

Estimated distance:  approximately 9 3/4 miles, round trip

Estimated elevation gain:  approximately 3,000 feet

Estimated time:  approximately  5 1/2 hours

We will hike to Balsam Mountain first, and then do Eagle Mountain before heading back to the cars.

Starting from the McKinley Hollow trailhead, we will cross the bridge at the start of the trail and then take the RED marked trail for approximately 2 miles.

While the elevation grade on this trail is mild at first, it gets VERY STEEP in places.  Also, the RED trail crosses a stream/brook at two places and rock hopping across water may be the name of the game at those spots if the temperatures have not been low enough to freeze the water (it can be difficult there when water levels are high).

After that 2 miles on the RED trail, we will come to an intersection with the BLUE trail.   There, we will first take a right onto the BLUE trail and take that for approximately 0.8 mile up to the summit of Balsam Mountain. 


The summit of Balsam is not marked.  While there is no view from the summit itself, there is an overlook with a nice view along the trail just a bit past the summit and I plan on going there to take in the view for a few minutes.

After enjoying the view from that overlook (and a snack), we'll re-trace our steps on the BLUE trail and head back down Balsam the way we came until we reach the intersection with the red trail.  We will then head straight through that intersection, continuing on the BLUE trail up to Eagle Mountain (passing over Haynes Mountain on the way).

Approximately 2.1 miles from the intersection with the red trail, we will reach the summit of Eagle Mountain, which is just a bit west (to the right from our direction) off the BLUE trail and is marked by a cairn.  Note again that the BLUE trail we'll have been on at that point does not actually go to Eagle's summit - in order to get to the summit you have to follow a herd path that goes to the right off of the marked trail for a very short walk until coming to a clearing with a rock cairn.  There is no view from the summit of Eagle.

After summiting Eagle Mountain, we will then turn around and re-trace our steps on the BLUE trail until we again reach the intersection with the RED trail. At that intersection, we will take a right on the RED trail to head back - down a STEEP section of trail - to the McKinley Hollow parking area and our cars.

 -----------------------------

PACE AND TIME:

I'll be keeping a moderate pace.  Note that moderate does NOT mean slow - though I won't exactly be trail running either.  Everyone coming on this hike should feel comfortable with keeping a moderate pace (not especially fast, but certainly not slow, either) over the mileage AND elevation gain, involved here.  Looking at the estimated hike time, in conjunction with the mileage and elevation gain estimates, will give you an idea of my planned pace.

Best estimate of total hike time is about 5 1/2 hours, including breaks (from the time we actually start the hike).

** Be prepared to hike alone - and to find your way on your own - if you can't keep up or if you feel like hiking faster (or pick a hiking buddy who keeps a pace similar to yours and stick with them).  **

**FAMILIARIZE YOURSELF WITH MAPS OF THE RELEVANT TRAILS/AREA AS WELL AS ROUTE DESCRIPTIONS BEFORE DOING THIS HIKE.**

There will NOT be a sweep on this hike.  I will wait for people to regroup only TO A LIMITED EXTENT at trail junctions, and on the summit, but because of time constraints and likely cold weather will not be waiting more than 5 minutes or so at any given junction, or 10 minutes or so on the summits, so don't count on me waiting at junctions or on summits if you're too far behind.

Again, there will be NO SWEEP on this hike.

**** Everyone must come prepared to be responsible for themselves. ****

-------------------


POST-HIKE:

Afterwards, I'm planning on going to Brio's, at 68 Main St., Phoenecia, NY, for a post-hike celebratory meal - I hope you'll join me there.

NOTE:  once I'm done with this hike, I won't be waiting much past the predicted hiking time given in the event description above for others to finish before we leave for Brio's.  It's going to be cold, I'll have things to do (as will others on the hike) and those who have finished will be hungry.  If it takes you longer than about 5 1/2 hours to finish this hike, I may not be there when you finish as I may not be waiting at the trailhead longer than that.  So, if you plan on joining us out afterwards, make sure you have the address for where we're going and that you know how to get there.  Keep in mind that if you rely on a cell phone GPS that you may not have cell service at the trail head parking area, so plan ahead accordingly for that.


************************************

****BE SURE TO READ THE BELOW INFORMATION BEFORE DECIDING WHETHER TO ATTEND THIS EVENT****

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.


*** You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. ***

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
