results.description:
This will be a short ride (about 30 miles) for this group, and we will keep the group together, so unlike most of the more challenging rides we will employ a sweep. At the rides end, I'll let everyone know how much quicker or slower I think the actual pace will be that we are looking for in future rides. It's hard to just give a standard pace mph, I find those very inaccurate.
We're going to start this ride out at Essa-Bagel. If you want to get a bagel and coffee before the ride you better get there far ahead! Long lines there. We'll actual congregate at Greenacre Park, which is a little enclave park on 51st between 2nd and 3rd Ave, just around the corner from Essa Bagel. So go to the park first and check in. We take off no later than 10 minutes after 10:30AM! I mean that. I won't have my phone, so a message to this site that you are running behind won't do much good!

After getting together, we will head to Central Park, do 1/2 lap then over to the Greenway before dipping down to Broadway and over into the Bronx and Wave Hill. Then we head back the same way but veer east over to Arthur Avenue for a break, maybe an espresso and canolli and a bit of socializing or just to warm up! Then we head along the Bronx Queens route over the 59th bridge back into Manhattan and Columbus Circle. That's the short 31 mile version. After that a lap or however many for those who want some extra miles!

Here's the cue sheet.

results.description:
SDI DRY SUIT DIVER

The SDI Dry Suit Diver Course will open up a whole new world of diving to you. Many of the diving environments around the world are better experienced in a dry suit. Why? These areas have an abundance of marine life waiting to be seen and photographed – they just happen to be a little colder! Dry suits are also used in tropical water during the cooler months.This course allows the student to develop the knowledge and skills to properly use a dry suit. It will discuss the types of dry suits, accessories, maintenance and how to make basic repairs.

<a href="https://www.tdisdi.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/Student_Dry_Suit_Manual_Page_101_Image_0002.jpg"></a>

Who this course is for: The certified diver looking for advanced training in dry suit equipment, selection and diving techniques. This diver can extend their diving season, spend more time diving in cooler environments and/or enjoy enhancing their dive experience by staying warm and cozy in a dry suit.

Add forms here

results.description:
“The Twin Heart meditation technique was developed by Master Choa Kok Sui and is a powerful form of meditation, for it enhances your physical, mental, emotional and spiritual well-being. 

If practiced regularly, it brings about a deep inner transformation and expansion of consciousness so that you achieve illumination, self-realization, perfect harmony and oneness with God. It is called the Twin hearts because it refers to the heart chakra, the center of the emotional heart and the crown chakra the center of the divine heart. 

When you meditate on these twin hearts, divine energy flows into your crown chakra and is distributed to all parts of the body. The crown chakra can be activated only when the heart chakra is sufficiently activated. By using the heart and crown chakras for blessing the earth with loving kindness you activate the chakras. They become channels for the flow of spiritual energies. And by blessing the earth and all sentient being, you are in turn blessed many time. It is in giving that you receive – that is the law.” – V.C. Vishwanathan.

Meditation by led by Lee Van Zyl - pranic healer. We will be activating the heart and crown centers with the crystal singing bowls. 

Donation of $5

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

80% of this tour takes place under cover or inside! Enjoy a fresh and different way to enjoy a Sunday afternoon with others. Learn tons of cool things on the tour with a few dozen members and friends from several Meet Up Groups, then enjoy an optional post tour brunch party.

Our tours are designed for fun and friendly members of NYSN and our partner social networking groups.  This is not a tour for tourists but for people who live in and around NY or who are new to the area who want to learn more about the city they live in and the amazing things they are surrounded by every day!  Celebrate the 103 year anniversary of Grand Central with this fun and informative tour while socializing with members and friends from NYSN and other Social Networking Groups. 

Did you know that the current Grand Central building is actually the 3rd incarnation of the historic building on that site?  Learn about Secret platforms, top secret rooms and interesting facts and surprises during this adventure filled with exploring, socializing and learning.  Your tour guide will also share  photos from the late 1800’s and early 1900’s that will  amaze you and change your perspective on the building and the neighborhood surrounding it.

Following the tour (approx. 90 minutes) you are welcome to join the group at our Sunday Brunch Party at The St. Pat's Tavern.

Meet at The Pershing Square Cafe at 11:00 am

Cost: $15 Covers the tour Only (Please bring exact change to the event)

What to wear: Dress for the weather but you will only be outside for 15 minutes of the tour.

Can I come alone?  YES!  99% of those attending come on their own.

What to expect: 15-20 fun and friendly people looking to learn a little about the city and meet new people.

Once again, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and  www.newyorksocialnetwork.com
results.name: NY Tours For New Yorkers: Grand Central History Tour (Optional Brunch)

results.description:
We are making progress in our effort to understand the theoretical minimum about the Standard Model. And there is more to come, with upcoming discussion on Renormalization Theory, Faddeev-Popov Ghosts and the geometry of gauge fields. So stay tuned!

This week we will wrap up the introduction to Yang-Mills theories by examining the non-Abelian Field Strength tensor and showing how it transforms.  Then we will turn our attention to quantizing the gauge field and the problems inherent in the canonical prescription.  In what time remains, we will talk about irreducible representations of Lie algebras.

Some good readings

David Tong's Lectures....specifically lecture 13

https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=Ba7qKURdCjU


For those unfamiliar with the canonical quantization procedure, and are not faint of heart, Tong's earlier lectures an are good too...chapters 2 and 3 of these lecture notes are here...

http://www.damtp.cam.ac.uk/user/tong/qft.html


Other reading on gauge theories....

http://www.hep.phy.cam.ac.uk/~gripaios/gft_lecture_notes.pdf


http://www.damtp.cam.ac.uk/user/ch558/pdf/Gauge_theories.pdf


On Lie Groups...t'Hooft's notes....

http://www.staff.science.uu.nl/~hooft101/lectures/lieg07.pdf


http://www.staff.science.uu.nl/~hooft101/lectures/lieg07.pdf


Chapter 15 of Peskin and Schroeder.
results.name: Gauge Theories and the Standard Model of Particle Physics Part IV

Hey guys I saw this class online and it looks really cool! I would love to make some awesome gold jewelry, anyone want to join? 

Gold has captivated artisans – and wearers! – from its first discovery dating back to 5,600BC. It is an extremely soft metal – so ductile that an ounce can be stretched for miles into thread fine enough for embroidery and malleable enough to be hammered into a transparent sheet!

Create stunning earrings or a ring in this fun weekend workshop! You can choose to add a gem to your work as well. We will be working in Yellow 14 karat Gold – handcrafting the rings, earring wires and the bezels in this two day weekend workshop.

So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

results.description:
Calling all poets! Jersey City is now offering a weekly poetry workshop. 

This workshop will start with one 10 minute writing prompt (an idea to incorporate into a poem written on the spot). After the optional sharing of prompts, there will be a critique of 6 poems by 3 people (2 poems each) who have signed up in advance. Poets who sign up to be workshopped must bring printed copies of their poems for the group (recommended: 8 copies). To sign up for a workshop in advance, please contact Sarah Jewell at [masked]. 

While workshopping poems, we will “mind our P’s and Q’s” by Praising first what works in a poem, and then Questioning what might be improved. This helps to keep the feedback positive and constructive. If you are new to critiquing poetry, please see these guidelines:
http://triadwriters.org/inspiration/guidelines-critique-of-poem/ 

The workshop will be held in an upstairs room in the Brightside Tavern (upon arrival, go up the stairs to your left). On a final note, since Brightside Tavern is generously hosting our workshop, we request that workshop participants order brunch.

results.description:
Foundations of Mindfulness - Introduction

Everything we perceive comes to us either through the physical senses in our body or through our emotions and thoughts.  This week we will continue our discussions on the Foundations of Mindfulness and explore our relationship to experiences in the body.

In a culture that often prizes thinking over wisdom from direct experience, we can easily become detached from a relationship with our bodies. Even when we are aware of sensations in the body, such as when there is physical pain, we quickly imagine an embellished meaning and worst case outcome rather than simply be with what the body is actually telling us. 

As we have experienced when using the breath as an object of  meditation, we'll spend time Saturday being with the sensations and insights that arise in the body as simply as possible. This will require that we refrain from adding judgments, creating embellishments or clinging to our studied stories about what the sensations mean.  We'll make it our intention to just listen mindfully.

I hope you'll share your Saturday morning with us.

Class Structure:  

Each class begins with a very brief guided meditation of gathering and quieting followed by a topical teaching and an expanded guided mindfulness meditation. There is time for discussion and Q&A.  Please note that while there is benefit in participating in regular sittings and practice, you do not have to attend every class to find value. 

Fee by donation: Suggested starting donation is $10 and your generosity is greatly appreciated.  No one is ever turned away for lack of funds.  The donation box is on the sign-in table.

If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]


80% of this tour takes place under cover or inside! Enjoy a fresh and different way to enjoy a Sunday afternoon with others. Learn tons of cool things on the tour with a few dozen members and friends from several Meet Up Groups, then enjoy an optional post tour brunch party.

Our tours are designed for fun and friendly members of NYSN and our partner social networking groups.  This is not a tour for tourists but for people who live in and around NY or who are new to the area who want to learn more about the city they live in and the amazing things they are surrounded by every day!  Celebrate the 103 year anniversary of Grand Central with this fun and informative tour while socializing with members and friends from NYSN and other Social Networking Groups. 

Did you know that the current Grand Central building is actually the 3rd incarnation of the historic building on that site?  Learn about Secret platforms, top secret rooms and interesting facts and surprises during this adventure filled with exploring, socializing and learning.  Your tour guide will also share  photos from the late 1800’s and early 1900’s that will  amaze you and change your perspective on the building and the neighborhood surrounding it.

Following the tour (approx. 90 minutes) you are welcome to join the group at our Sunday Brunch Party at The St. Pat's Tavern.

Meet at The Pershing Square Cafe at 11:00 am

Cost: $15 Covers the tour Only (Please bring exact change to the event)

What to wear: Dress for the weather but you will only be outside for 15 minutes of the tour.

Can I come alone?  YES!  99% of those attending come on their own.

What to expect: 15-20 fun and friendly people looking to learn a little about the city and meet new people.

Once again, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and  www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

You remember Javascript? that little language that makes fancy animations on your blog?

$('body').append("I'm a little teapot")


Forget all of that. This is 2016, and Javascript's grown up.


In this class, we'll be walking you through modern Javascript programming and (if we've done our job right) convince you that it should be your dynamic language of choice for all tasks.


For this class you will need:

Worship Service Every Saturday:

Our regular gathering is diverse in themes, opinions, and expression. We come together for the sharing of praise, lament, discussion, song, dance, crafts, and wasting time with God on Sabbath. We also value a cross-generational character of our community and ask people to adjust to the needs of others. Our guest teachers, preachers, philosophers, scientists, performers, and facilitators are a diverse and profound individuals that make New York city so special. Feel free to connect and participate in your own way, with a healthy balance of comfort and challenge.

We have a simple breakfast (fresh bagels, juice, and, when we feel cool, hot drinks) at 10:45. Our service starts at 11:30. A number of us will be there at 10:30 so please come early for conversation. Once you come more than three times, you will have the privilege to sign up, once in a while to bring breakfast for everyone.


We have children's programming every Saturday. The second Saturday of every month we have a special kid's event, featuring music, art, and other activities. This gathering is not specifically religious and is open to any families that might want to join us. The other Saturdays we focus on a progressive Christian curriculum, that emphasizes diversity, peace, interfaith dialogue, and most importantly, fun!

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.

WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...

1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated

9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved

Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
MOMA PS1 AND ROOSEVELT ISLAND TRAM

About 5 miles and 5 hours, We will visit MoMA PS1 for the "Greater New York" exhibit, eat at a supermarket cafe, walk along some of the East River parks, then walk on to Roosevelt Island and take the tram to Manhattan.


The Greater New York exhibit takes place every five years to showcase the work of emerging artists living and working in the New York metropolitan area, the exhibition occupies MoMA PS1’s entire building with over 400 works by 157 artists, including programs of film and performance. Admission to MoMA is free for New York City residents (bring ID); $10 suggested admission for others.

Here is a link to the exhibit: <a>Greater New York</a>

Here is a link to a review: Greater New York review

After about one and a half hours in the museum, we will have lunch at the nearby Food Cellar market cafe at[masked]th Road, which has an eat-in cafe with hot and cold buffet bars, then visit the new Hunters Point South and Gantry Plaza parks along the East River, then walk north on Vernon Boulevard to the Roosevelt Island Bridge to take the tram to Manhattan, ending the walk at the N, Q, R and 4,5,6 trains at 59th Street and Lexington Avenue.


The 7, N, E, R and F trains are available at various stations along the walk in Queens if you do not want to take the tram to Manhattan.

Meet: 11:30 a.m. at Albert E. Short Triangle, at Jackson Avenue and 23rd Street, across from the Court Square Diner. Take the 7, E or G trains to the Court Square station. Check MTA Service Advisories for service changes.


Leader: Tom Bergen [masked][masked]

Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike. 

Free for paid annual Shorewalkers members, $3 for non-members, visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.

results.description:
RSVP'S BEGIN FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 5TH AT 1:00PM!  

Note no waiting list. If you don't make in the group of 25 send me a message and I will place you on a manual list in case someone cancels. (First come, first served).

In partnership with Untapped Cities I am pleased to present the   "Remnants of the Old Penn Station Tour". (see detailed description below).

Note cost is $30.00 - limit of 25 people.  Includes optional walking tour of the nearby Fashion/Garment District and earlier breakfast/brunch.  Part of the fashion district's evolution and success had to do with its proximity to the original Penn Station.

Penn Station Tour starts at 1:00pm.  Garment District Tour led by Hank starts at 11:45am. Optional breakfast/brunch meets at 10:30am at the very cool Gotham West Market, West 45th Street & 11th Avenue:

http://gothamwestmarket.com/

If meeting at 1pm for the Penn Station Tour only see below for the meetup location in Penn Station.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

This special tour of the remnants of Penn Station developed by Justin Rivers, author and playwright of The Eternal Space, an off Broadway play about the demolition of Penn Station.

Amtrak officially acknowledges only one physical remnant of the old Penn Station, but on this special tour, participants will be able to see, touch and experience well over a dozen remaining structural pieces of the grand McKim, Mead and White station.  

Weaving in never-before-published photographs of the station’s hey day and demolition, the tour will cover the past, present and future plans for the transportation hub, including an in-depth exploration of the surrounding buildings outside of the station. 

Also learn secret time saving hacks of the current Penn Station like the best ways to enter and exit the station and how to beat the boarding bum rush on the infamously crowded Amtrak concourse. 

Other Tour Highlights: 

Penn Station as Art: 

Identify and learn the stories behind the amazing art installations in the current station often ignored by commuters and life-long New Yorkers.

The Golden Ticket: 

Tour participants will be given their own ticket reproduction made from the very first ticket to Pennsylvania Station issued to an LIRR customer in 1910.

Penn’s Demolition:

 Learn why Pennsylvania Station was demolished and exactly how it was done. Watch the process unfold in pictures taken by renown architectural photographer, Norman McGrath.    

The Largest Penn Remnant:

 It’s huge and it’s just about as close to the original Penn Station as you can get. Virtually no one knows it exists but tour participants will know where it is, what it is and the story behind it.

Moynihan Station:

 Take a closer look at and learn the story behind the old station's sister building across the street including how its future may be the redemption of Penn Station’s past.  

Logistics: 

This tour meets inside Penn Station in front of the McDonald’s on the LIRR side of the concourse at 1:00 PM and runs roughly one hour and thirty minutes.
results.name: *Special Tour* The Remnants of the old Penn Station & Fashion District Tour

RULES OF THE GAME:

No power shots allowed.
If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.
If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.
Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.
Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12:00 PM on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

Sara D. Roosevelt Park, Nike Field
Take the F train to 2nd Avenue Lower East Side, and walk for about 3 minutes on Chrystie Street to the Nike Field between Stanton St & Rivington St
New York, NY 10002
Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.

What to bring with you:

A positive attitude, pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee:


You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for, permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled.
The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to Slánte for brunch and a Pint or Two:

                                                        Slánte

                                                  304 Bowery

                                           New York, NY 10012

                                               (212)[masked]

                                          www.slaintenyc.com

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Join DM Noah Anderson as he runs the first D&D 5E Module over two parts!

The Sword Coast is siege. In an audacious bid for power, the Cult of the Dragon, along with its dragon allies and the Red Wizards of Thay, seeks to free Tiamat from her prison in the Nine Hells to bring her to the Forgotten Realms. The cult's forces are sweeping from town to town, laying waste to all who oppose them and gathering a hoard of riches for their dread queen. The threat is so dire, factions as disparate as the Harpers and the Zhentarim are banding together to battle the cult. Never before has the need for heroes been as desperate.

This campaign follows the module of the same name, and will be broken into two parts with six sessions each.
results.name: D&D 5E: Hoard of the Dragon Queen, Part 1

results.description:
Trotting Crusaders are taking you further out into the world of nature with a new location, where we will be able to experience nature first hand. Get exposed, to the natural forests of green and rocky terrain that had been made with millennium of shifting earth and generations of vegetation growth. Now that that little bit of National Geographic is done, let’s get down to it!


This Trot is gonna be set in New Jersey, within the Watchung Reservation where the trails are set to be Easy to Moderate. Know that we are still in close proximity to many roadways that surround the reservation.

We are going to be doing the History Trail within the reservation (marked with the red outline). This route covers 6 miles of marked paths. We will get to experience a lot of the natural outdoor world and of the formation that are both naturally made and man made to accommodate for ease of traveling through nature's backyard! 

Afterwards we will go out for some nice Mexican Food (Split Checks) and then we will depart from there and head back to the Train station for those that need it.

Travel - Two options to get there

Carpooling people to the Reservation from Elizabeth Station We will be waiting at the station at 10:00AM through 11:00PM, plenty of time to arrive within the window period to join us for the ride to the area. $5 covers the ride from Elizabeth and back with the gas we expect to take on.

Driving to Location yourself The address is listed above and they do have parking lot that I have highlighted. How you get there is on your terms. Just know we will be most likely arriving in tow with the rest of the group at 12PM.

Getting to Elizabeth Station from NYC NYC Penn Station on 34st and 7th ave. From there, take "NJ transit" to "Elizabeth". Wait out in front of the clock tower by the umbrellas, we will be in the parking lot.

If you have any questions or concerns, please let us know in the comments below.
results.name: Trotting Crusaders - Watchung Reservation

Here's a video from our last performance; "Santa Baby"


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Eq5zNQPuFw

This Season we are playing The Beatles!

We have done Classic Rock, The Rolling Stones, Reggae, Motown, Summer Songs, Fleetwood Mac, Funk and Christmas ensembles, The Beatles is certainly due in our selection!

Acoustic guitars, bass and ukeleles welcome. If electric bring a portable amp:)


This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play! 

To join:

• RSVP before you attend the session.

• Choose your guitar part from TAB>MORE>FILES download/print and bring it to practice to follow. (check by 12/30) 

• Bring acoustic guitar or electric with a portable amp. 

• Have an amazing time!

Practice days are:

Every Saturday 12-2pm starting January 9th til April 23rd, the day before the performance, 16 practice sessions.

Season Pass

You can purchase the Season Pass (16 sessions at discount + $30 show fee) for $380  (you save $50 on practice sessions)

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=MWF56937BM6Q8


Show Day is Sunday, May 1st at 2pm

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village April 24th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

All you need is love and some Beatles!

Check out our website at http://edelage.wix.com/edge

Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

How many times have you walked through Grand Central and actually taken time to really appreciate how beautiful it is? With this Scavenger Hunt you will not only get to appreciate one of  New York's most iconic buildings, but you will get to meet dozens of interesting NYSN members and friends in a fun and casual way. 

Come alone or with a friend and we will team you up with others attending.  Enjoy a cocktail or cup of coffee with the group then we will send you out on your adventure.

Each team will have 75 minutes to complete the scavenger hunt with a list of questions, challenges, and puzzles.

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

Following the hunt you can stay at St. Pat's for our Sunday Brunch Party.

Cost: $10 (Please bring exact change to the event)

Level: No prior knowledge needed of anything… just have fun.

What to wear: dress for the weather but 98% of the clues are inside Grand Central

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  We will team you up with other fun people.

Once again, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and  www.newyorksocialnetwork.com
results.name: Grand Central Scavenger Hunt & Afternoon Party

Bollywood Funk NYC is excited to do a special Naach Xpress class dedicated to one of the best dancers in Bollywood Shahid Kapoor. You don't want to miss this one for sure. Its time to move and shake your body!!

What is Naach Xpress? NAACH XPRESS is high-energy, fitness fueled dance class to Bollywood beats. It's one big dance PARTY! Students sweat it out to the best of Bollywood Funk NYC's signature dance moves. With a mix of jazz, hip hop, contemporary, and other well known dance techniques, we bring to you our fast track class to sweating it out with some style. Make some friends and dance the night away in this amazing class! There are no worries, come to class tension free and get your weekly dose of fitness and cardio! Each class will focus on ONE hot and popular Bollywood dance song. With a new song featured every week. ALL levels are welcome! Not a dancer? DON'T YOU WORRY! This class is for all, anyone can do it!

Looking forward to seeing you all there!!

results.description:
Hello Neolyth community! Friends, family, students, visitors in passing, and all looking for Truth and God and Soul…

Thank you for joining us at the various groups and ceremonies at Neolyth. We opened the doors last February and since then the community has been growing and the word spreading. Neolyth has been serving as a hub for modern shamanism, holistic healing and living. We've been keeping our course steady in the direction of Interspirituality - a step ahead of the interfaith dialogue. The term Interspirituality means that each one of us can find the fulfillment of their life in communion with their Soul. We gather in faith that the Divine answers individual call in many unique ways. Each one can find Truth and Divinity, foraging for their spiritual food - just like in the Neolithic era, before the religions acquired their square walls - looking into many traditions, scriptures, sages and teachers…

We'll be celebrating our one year anniversary on SATURDAY, February 20th and you are invited! The program is open to a free flow of guests throughout the day. You may want to choose the events however you like. We will have a donation bucket going around before each event - small donations are ok, but it's important that you contribute - let's keep the abundance and the gratitude flowing! Good karma comes back to you.

You will find information about our classes, gatherings, training programs - ongoing and upcoming. There will be a small market open with arts and crafts, and shamanic supplies - possibly drums too!

You will also have an opportunity to experience Sound and Energy Healing sessions in the 'healing booth' set up at the back of the room. There will be a sign up list. Contact Karuna at [masked] with any questions.

Celebration means drinks and snacks and plenty of socializing time. We will even have coffee and home baked cake, well, probably from home like Trade Joe's or Whole Foods, unless I hear volunteers?

OPENING at 12:00pm Calling the Sacred Directions and Elemental Spirits for the day.

Art Show: Cheryl Ann Morse will present and speak about her art inspired by shamanic practice. Opportunity to enjoy and practice art!
Cheryl will also lead a healing event on Past Life Regression the next day (Sunday, February 21st).

NADA YOGA CLASS at 2:00pm

Yoga with chanting and sound healing with Kimberly Alvarado. Enjoy the class and find out about Neolyth ongoing yoga classes with sharon Kenney Rudy and the upcoming morning yoga with Kim Alvarado. VENUS BELLY DANCING CLASS at 3:00pm

Melania Jay will introduce her upcoming class - beginners welcome! After a short performance by Melania, learn the basics of belly dancing, the ancient art that allows the flow of Divine Feminine express through your body.

DRUM CIRCLE at 4:00pm

Bring your drum, rattle, shaker - let's make some awesome noise - Divine Hearbeat can be heard in the joyful beating of drums! We'll have drums available as well.

KIRTAN with at 6:00pm

Chanting together is a simple and powerful practice - calling the holy words in ancient languages. Guest kirtan singers and musicians.

SHAMANIC DANCE AND SOUND HEALING at 7:30pm

Our best night ever! Dance and journey for self-empowerment and the sheer joy of movement. Free yourself with free form dance, no matter the skill or the style!

Closing the Sacred Circle.

GOODNIGHT
results.name: NEOLYTH anniversary celebration!!!!

results.description:
Our blogging workshop is to learn and to share about what it means to be a blogger.  You may have something to teach.   Do you have a blog?  Do you want to build one? Discover the three reasons a writer should blog, and the three reasons not to blog. Share your insights about a blog you like and why you like it.   What hosting services are best?  What the heck is WordPress?  What do you look for in a blog?  What do you want your blog to say about you as a writer?   Why would someone want to read your blog?  How do you reach new readers?  

Bring your phone or lap top.   Karuta has free WiFi and delicious authentic Japanese food so enjoy lunch, conversation and a learning experience.  

RSVP by Friday, February 19 to attend.   Bring cash.

results.description: Power-hungry, ruthless political manipulator, military genius, statesman, defender of the people against oligarchs - all descriptors of the controversial figure Julius Caesar. Crossing the Riubicon with his army, Caesar provoked civil war and became dictator for life, putting the fate of the Republic at stake. Did he get what he deserved? We'll review his life as we continue our journey through the history of Rome as the end of the Republic approaches.
results.name: Caesar's Rome

results.description:
Acoustic Guitar for Beginners 101
Four 90-Minute Sessions Held on 4 consecutive Saturdays.
[FEBRUARY 6, 13, 20, 27] - MARCH - APRIL -- 12:30pm

WHO CAN ATTEND:
Beginning guitar students who have no prior knowledge of how to play guitar, or people who can play, but are unfamiliar with how to read and play from written notes.  NOTE:  Session #1 is MANDATORY for participation in the Series.


WHAT YOU WILL LEARN:
Learn to READ and PLAY NOTES, CHORDS and PLAY SONGS you know and love.  And what you learn is applicable to playing Rock, Blues, Folk, Country, Jazz, Classical or any other type of music the student is interested in playing.

MONTHLY, FOUR-WEEK CYCLES:
In this workshop, a specific set of concepts will be covered over a period of 4-week.  Each monthly, 4-week period will be closed to people who did not attend the 1st session of the month.  This allow the group to continue to progress through the lesson material and avoid the need to review all that came before each time a new person joins the group. There will be three to four monthly, 4-week cycles before the first cycle is repeated


WHAT TO BRING:
• Bring your own guitar for these lessons
• Also bring a three-ring binder and a pencil

results.description:
Come join us on Saturday for some good food, drinks and friendly conversation at REEF RESTAURANT in Forest Hills.  The weather promises to be in the low 50's which is perfect for our meetup.

The menu for REEF RESTAURANT is designed around the healthy Mediterranean diet of southern Europe. The "no butter policy" takes top precedence as the extra virgin olive oil has completely substituted butter and other unhealthy fats in the kitchen.

In addition, Reef's priority is that fish, shellfish, meats and other ingredients are always fresh and of the highest quality. Dishes are prepared with healthy Mediterranean portions in mind, with quality and taste as priorities and always light enough to leave room for desserts.

Prixe Fixe Brunch:  $19.99


Served with Home Fries or Salad AND Choice of TWO Mimosas, Bellinis, Bloody Marys, Sangrias OR a cold drink (alcohol or soda) and Coffee or Tea.


http://www.reef-restaurant.com/menu1.html


***You can also order off the DINNER MENU which includes fresh fish, steak, chicken, chops, pastas, risotto ($9.00 - $27.00).



***We will NOT be getting separate checks.  We will have 4 checks, 5 people on a check.

Please bring SMALL Bills AND a $20 bill so we can pay the check quickly and easily (1's, 5's, 10's).  (CASH ONLY)


---------------------------------------------------------------

DESSERT

If you would like something sweet after lunch, we can visit:

Pasticceria amore d'italia for some cannoli's, big chocolate chip cookies, red velvet cupcakes, gelato and more!

Violet's Bake Shoppe for homemade Asian and European baked goods. The cakes and puddings are recommended. Flavors vary from mango to coconut to coffee. There is a coconut pudding from India, baseball-sized green tea mochi from Japan, and egg tarts from Portugal. There are also American dessert additions such as chocolate cake and cheesecake.


Hope to see you there!

Ivy

------------------------------------------------------------------

Subway: mta.info/weekender (Please check subway times/changes PRIOR to Saturday since there is always construction on the weekend)

***E, F, R train to 71st/Continental Ave.  Walk to restaurant on 72nd Ave. 

Meetup Fee: $2.00 (Exact Change Please) in order to cover the cost of maintaining the group.

Perfume Allergy: Please REFRAIN from wearing perfume.  Thanks for understanding.




<a href="https://maps.google.com/maps?q=%20108-02%2072nd%20Avenue%2C%20Forest%20Hills%2C%20NY%2C%2011375%2C%20forest%20hills%2C%20NY"></a>
results.name: Let's Meet at Reef

results.description:
Waiting List: The day before an event we tend to have a lot of people drop out so do not be discouraged if you're on the waiting list--there's a good chance you'll be able to join.


Attending List: Please remember that the RSVP list closes at 5pm the day before an event. If you change your RSVP to NO after that time or are a no-show, someone on the waiting list could be left out. We take that very seriously.

Club Hours: C&B sets aside space for us from 12:30pm to 2:30pm so those are the official club hours. Everyone is free to stay longer if they wish.

First-Timers: If it is your first time at C&B, you will have to take a lesson from the range staff. If you are an experienced archer, you must at least stay for the safety portion (no exceptions, range rules). Lessons start at half past the hour so if you miss the 12:30pm, you may have to sit around and wait for the 1:30pm. Please be on time.

Public Transportation: LIRR to Hicksville and then a taxi from the station to C&B (make sure to tell them 11 Commercial St in Hicksville). The train from Penn gets into Hicksville at 11:55 am. The one-way cab rate as of 1/1/16 is roughly $6.30 (http://www.worldtaximeter.com/new-york/hicksville+train+station/440+jericho+turnpike%2C+hicksville) +$2 for each additional person. Those of you taking the train may wish to post a message to the group to share a cab.

Range Costs: Make sure to mention when you pay for range time you are shooting with the NYC Archery Group to get the CLUB ONLY rates:

$7.00 for the first hour, $5 each additional hour OR $15 to shoot all day
$1.00 for a target
$11 per hour for a rental bow and arrows
$5.00 for a lesson (includes first hour)

Visit the C&B website for the most up-to-date information.

See you on the shooting line!
results.name: Monthly Meetup at C&B Archery

results.description:
THIS TIME WE WILL BE AT A DIFFERENT LOCATION.  THIS LOCATION ACTUALLY HAS HALF-PRICED DRINKS DURING THE MARATHONS.

PLEASE RSVP RESPONSIBLY.  YOU WILL BE REQUIRED TO RE-CONFIRM YOUR RSVP WHEN WE GET CLOSER TO THE EVENT DAY.  THIS EVENT IS FOR MEMBERS ONLY. IF YOU WANT A FRIEND TO COME, THEY HAVE TO JOIN THE GROUP AND SIGN UP FOR THE EVENT.

YOU MUST BE 21 OR OLDER TO ATTEND THIS EVENT, AND YOU ABSOLUTELY MUST BRING YOUR ID. NO ID, AND YOU CANNOT JOIN THE EVENT.  

So, who wants to spend a Saturday afternoon at a full day, karaoke marathon?!?! Up to seven hours of fun, laughs and songs for only $14!! We will start at 1 pm, and can sing, non-stop until 8 pm.  Or until our voices give out. Whichever comes first.

We are allowed to bring in food (we can even order delivery).  However, you cannot bring in any outside drinks.  Not even water, but they provide free pitchers of water there.  And the drinks are half-priced. (including the non-alcoholic ones)

And don't say "I can't sing", because I can guarantee you that most people who come to these are not winning American Idol any time soon!  But, it's all about having fun and a few laughs!! Trust me, it's a lot of fun, and everyone usually ends up singing along, so you're not totally in the spotlight.  Maybe that's why they have the word "Duet" in the name of the place.

Please, go to www.karaokeduet.com and check out the song selection.  They have the song codes, so write down at least a few and come prepared to start singing right away!! But there are songs that they have in a book of "newly added" songs that aren't yet up on their website.  So if you don't see your favorite, it may still be available!  Past times we were there, the group sang approximately 100 songs in total!!

In order to make sure that everyone gets equal opportunity to sing, we will make sure to have people put in songs so that everyone gets a chance before your next song comes up.  It's only fair.  If needed, we will have one person put all the songs in to space them out for people.

REMEMBER, YOU MUST BRING YOUR ID TO  SHOW THAT YOU ARE OVER 21! NO ID, NO ENTRY.
results.name: Sing Your Heart Out - KARAOKE!!!

Come February 14, Gothamites snuggled up by one of the fireplaces at New York bars, splitting desserts at the city's romantic restaurants or watching one of the 100 best romantic movies.

This time, we are meeting at Papillon in Mid-Town, a Bi-level French brasserie with a popular brunch and vibrant bar scene.

Brunch deal is $22 and it includes everything (one entree + one drink +tax + Gratuity)   only for our group :)

I hope everyone can make it. Look forward to seeing all lovely ladies and having some wonderful moments.
results.name: ****Post-Valentine's­ Ladies Bruncheon****

results.description:
Technological Considerations: 

To some extent, we probably can’t even imagine our lives without our technological gadgets: our smart phones, i-pads, laptops, etc.; we can’t imagine life without the things that we can do with technology: talking to someone (“hands free”) while walking down the street, “surfing” the internet, texting, skyping, etc.  The world we live in today was radically different just thirty years ago—no cell phones, no commercial internet, no i-pads or laptops even.  If these technologies and their applications were magically taken away tomorrow, many people today would feel like a vital part of their lives would be missing as well. 


Would that be the case? 

Well, technology is here to stay (you can breathe a sigh of relief now!).  It has, for better and for worse perhaps, a significant impact on our lives and our understanding of how we are. 

We will discuss the positive and negative effects technology has had on us; we will consider how understandings these strengths and limitations might help improve our lives with technology.  We’ll consider the broad impact of technology on education, communication, relationships, society, etc. 

Questions to consider will include: Is technology making our relationships with others better or worse (or something else)?  Is it making us smarter or is it hindering our capacity to think (as Nicholas Carr has argued in The Shallows)?  Is there such a thing as over dependency on technology?  Is there a way to use technology but not have it use you?  To what extent is technology shaping our perceptions of reality, our understanding of identity, our conceptualization of meaning and purpose, etc.? 

For one day, we will put our smartphones away and discuss and debate this topic in the agora of Manhattan. 

About the Moderator:


Rolando is an educator of educators.  He works with teachers from the four major disciplines—Math, Science, English, and History—to craft, hone, and assess their pedagogical practices.  He has hosted other discussion groups on Meetup on reasoning and truth, self-understanding, self-deception, and how discussions affect our lives.  In his spare time, he enjoys reading, writing, and ruminating on the impact of technology on our lives. . .
results.how_to_find_us: Go the back of the deli, where there are stairs.  Walk up the stairs to the second floor, to the back.  You'll see me (Rolando).
results.name: Is Smart Technology Making Us Dumber? Hosted by Rolando

(This meetup will takes place at David's studio in Queens, not the Coffee Foundry in the West Village)  

Founder and principal of Axios, David Yepez is a designer and master fabricator. A graduate of the School of Visual Arts in New York, David leads a team that has completed projects for clients that include Macy's, Calvin Klein, Vince Camuto, Sebastian Errazuriz Studios and others.

Under his leadership, Axios has earned a reputation as an innovative problem solver among visual merchandisers, designers and producers.


Axios specializes in the design and production of display elements, props and sculptural installations for retail environments, window displays, photo shoots, film and television sets as well as for visual artists.

Utilizing techniques ranging from traditional carpentry to technologies such as 3D printing and CNC fabrication, Axios is able to construct designs or create designs to execute vision of the customer.

Axios is dedicated to innovation that enables to meet customers' creative needs.

Agenda:

This time, we are going to visit Axios's studio in Queens at 56-06 Cooper Ave, Unit D, Glendale, NY 11385, where you can see his fabrication space. David will show his projects, the story behind them, and his aesthetics. A roundtable discussion and woodworking workshop intro will follow.

• 1:00pm - 1:30pm:  Snacks, and Drinks + Networking

• 1:30pm - 2:00pm:  A talk by David

• 2:00pm - 2:30pm: A roundtable discussion

• 2:30pm - : A workshop (3D printing or Woodworking)

I look forward to seeing all of you!

All players must bring a white and black t-shirt. Pass the ball & have fun!

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes / molded cleats only. Wear proper Soccer attire.

results.description:
Artists living in the rapidly modernizing world of late 19th-century Europe wished not only to depict modern (for them, contemporary) everyday life, but also to reveal the emotional and psychological effects of living in a world in rapid flux. In this workshop we'll look at the beginnings of Modern Art, how artists like Henri Matisse, Pablo Picasso and Vincent Van Gogh continued to paint quite traditional subject matter—landscapes, portraits and still lifes—but they explored them in ways that shocked their contemporaries. Each artist will have their own panel to try out some of their radical techniques. No prior experience necessary!

The Museum of Modern Art (MoMa) will be at SAGE-Pride Center of Staten Island for a two part workshop series on "What is Modern Art?"

Come down on Saturday, February 6th and 20th from 1:00pm to 3:00pm and meet with Kerry, our visiting Art Educator and learn, create and expand your knowledge.

There will also be a guided tour of MoMa on Monday, February 22nd from 1:00pm to 3:00pm. To book a spot on the tour, please contact Paul at[masked] for details. Limited Space - preference will be given to those who attend the workshop series.

Seniors 50 and over are encouraged to attend and will be given priority for this program.
results.name: What is Modern Art? - A workshop with a MoMa Art Expert

Keith L has been trying to get us uptown for sometime, so last weekend, he, Rob, Michael and I finally did some research on bars in the Inwood area. There are a lot of great places but his favorite is Inwood Local and when we went there, we could tell immediately it was a "beer club" kind of place. With an excellent beer list and a cool back area with large tables, it's perfect for our group.

So come uptown, way uptown, and have some beer in Inwood. Easy access via the A or the 1 train, and you can also see some of the monstrous buildings Columbia University has heartlessly thrust upon the neighborhood.

There is a lunch menu with bar foods (chicken wings, etc) available or maybe come early and have lunch at one of the cool restaurants in the neighborhood.

Hope to see you there.

Keith and Bill

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.

WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...

1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated

9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved

Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

venue.name: Rosicrucian Cultural Center of New York City

results.description:
It is important for us as students of spirituality and mysticism to become aware and acquainted with the tremendous resources that are available to us to make our lives more harmonious.

Once we learn to tap these inner resources, living will be an invigorating affair continuing and picking up where we left off in previous life experiences and thereby advancing and expanding the consciousness.

We need to keep foremost in our consciousness certain principles, conditions and laws to gain access to spiritual tools and to arrive at permanent solutions to life's challenges.

Through lectures, participation in meditation, and visualization exercises, we will be given the opportunity to experience the value of discussing these principles in a group setting.

Facilitating the discussions will be Dr. Lonnie Edwards, Vice President of the EGL Board of Directors, and author of Spiritual Laws that Govern Humanity and the Universe.

(www.facebook.com/Spiritual.Laws)
results.name: Discuss Spiritual Laws with Dr. Lonnie Edwards

results.description: Starting Saturday February 13, we will be studying the book of Genesis, learning about our Creator and our beginning and how the story of the beginning foreshadows the story of our salvation. We'll be in Burger King every Saturday at 1pm. We would love to have you join us. Everyone is welcome!
results.name: Pelham Parkway Saturday Afternoon Genesis Study

results.description:
Learn to Salsa New York Style with Yrma Arias at El Taller! This style of Salsa, "On 2", has gained popularity over the last decade in NYC. The classes will focus on the look and feel of the dance - with an emphasis on timing, footwork and partner work. Classes will provide instruction and repetition of the steps ‘Shines’, introduce the importance of the leader/follower connection, and provide practical techniques for the Latin Motion. Particular attention is paid to rhythm and musicality. This is an enjoyable class designed for people of all ages. The most important lesson is to have fun! What to bring: A great attitude and comfortable clothes and shoes that allow you to move!


When you arrive at 215 E. 99th Street, press the El T button on the intercom and we'll buzz you right in!
results.name: Beginner Salsa Dancing

group.name: Spanish, Salsa, and Tango at El Taller!

results.description:
AAT in Victoria Falls Q&A Phone Conference 

I know.. despite the information that has already been presented $3,250 is a lot of money to commit to any one thing. You may still have questions that you want answered, concerns that you want addressed, or you just want to be able to talk to the person that is going to be organizing all of this. 

I understand, and I would like you to join us on one of our many conference calls.

         - What should I expect of AAT? 

         - What does AAT expect of me?

- What should I know about Zambia before going?

Please come prepared with any unanswered questions! 

If this conference call is full, please select another one!

results.description:
Join us tomorrow to put a little SALSA in your life. 

Each and every saturday we have a little salsa for all ages and all levels. 

• Latin Kids Ensemble: 1-2PM 

Kid's are welcome to join the "Latin Kids Ensemble" from 1-2pm.  In this class kids learn about Latin Culture and its rhythm.  We focus on teaching them the roots of music and how to feel it in their souls. 

• Salsa Level 1: 2-3PM

Two left feet? Never danced before? Want to learn how to salsa? Come join us.. No experience necessary, and no partner needed. Just bring your dancing shoes, and your positive energy y VAMOS A BAILAR!!! WHEPPA!!!

• Salsa Level 2: 3-4PM 

Salsa Level 2 requires you to have previous salsa experience. You should know the fundamentals of the basics, and an open mind to learn.  In this class we will cover footwork, partner-work, body movement, spinning, and styling techniques.  


***Note: Please wear comfy attire. WE WILL BE HAVING A NICE SALSA WORKOUT!!!

results.description:
As featured by ABC News and Time Out New York, explore what lies beneath the streets of the Big Apple for this warmer, wintertime edition of The Amazing New York Scavenger Hunt. 

This fast-paced three-hour event is a hybrid scavenger hunt-obstacle course where you'll experience the fun & excitement of being part of a team that solves clues & faces mental and (not-so) physical challenges in a race to the finish line. 


Each member of the winning group receives a New York City gift package, and the pictures you'll snap along the way will be priceless.

*GET TICKETS HERE ($25 early bird, price will go up to $35) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Feb-20-2016_at_0130PM

*No tickets sold at door. Must Prepay. 75+ members attended our last Scavenger Hunt! 


What to expect: 


• A fun day with with new friends 

• Knowledge about hidden parts of the city

• Mental and (not-so) physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

You can come alone and be placed in a group or you can sign up with friends.  

*BUY TICKETS HERE ($25, price goes up as date gets closer) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Feb-20-2016_at_0130PM


*Prepay only. No tickets sold at door. 

Who can attend? All are welcome. Not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 


What should I wear? Dress for the elements. Be prepared for to walk. Dress comfortable – Most teams wear running shoes.


What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged). The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Best to download that before you come to the event.

Where do we go? There’s no set course. Find your own way. It’s a ‘choose your own adventure’ race. You will go around the city.

What if it rains? It's underground so the race still goes on. 

How many members will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We usually have at least 40 members attend. 


Where do I get a ticket? Must prepay to attend. Tickets not sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so PREPAY ASAP here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Feb-20-2016_at_0130PM

results.description:
Come and join us for a Valentine's & Get Acquainted Brunch on Saturday, Feb. 20th at 1:30pm.

http://www.sarabeth.com/

http://sarabethsrestaurants.com/park-avenue-south/

Sarabeth's Park Avenue South Restaurant - New York, NY /sarabeths-park-avenue-

Rating: 4.3 - ‎624 reviews - ‎Price range: $30 and under We serve Breakfast, Lunch, Tea, Dinner and Brunch in this great space.

5 stars Trip Advisor “Best eggs benedict ever” Reviewed November 13, 2015 NEW

Amazing experience, fine food top quality ingredients staff were very attentive. Was busy but they had plenty of staff working so you never had to wait for anything, very nice prosecco. Would definitely come here every morning for breakfast also made me want to come back and try the rest of the menu.

5 stars Reviewed October 15, 2015

We loved the food and ambience here! The Salmon Eggs Benedict was delicious.  The portion is big enough for 2, and the side salad is a nice touch. The lemon ricotta pancakes were as divine as they sounded- light, fluffy, and very flavorful. We also enjoyed their coffee, which was bold, strong, and plentiful. My friend also loved her mochaccino. Our server provided great service.

5 stars Reviewed August 3, 2015

We had an amazing brunch this morning! We made an OpenTable reservation and walked right past the crazy line outside. Highly recommend a reservation. I had the lemon ricotta pancakes and the hubby had the waffles. Both were amazing! Our waitress was super kind and did not rush us at all. Service was attentive even with the place being packed. We will definitely be back!

Kindly pay the $3.00 event fee to Paypal before you RSVP -this is to maintain the monthly Meet Up Fee, the printing costs,  & group costs, Thank you. If you don't have Paypal, just scroll down to the prompt and pay with a credit or debit card.  Much appreciated.

SaraBeth's ListSign up for Sarabeth's List to get insider deals & Discount Specials  www.sarabeth.com

Sarabeth's: Legendary Preserves, Cookies, and Other ...www.sarabeth.com/

</a> SARABETH'S QUEST IS TO PROVIDE EVERY CUSTOMER WITH AN experience that reflects her devotion and passion to creating wholesome food.


<a href="http://goddessofbakedom.com/sb/sarabeth/2015/10/sarabeths-good-morning-cookbook.html">SARABETH'S GOOD MORNING COOKBOOK October 13, 2015  

<a href="http://goddessofbakedom.com/sb/sarabeth/images/Sarabeth_GoodMorningCookbook_Cover.jpg"></a>

 JUST A SHORT NOTE TO LET YOU KNOW THAT MY SECOND COOKBOOK WAS RELEASED TODAY!

I am thrilled to bring many of my favorite morning recipes that you have enjoyed over the years in our Sarabeth's restaurants—there are also many more new and exciting breakfast and brunch dishes that I have prepared for my family and friends. I won't tell you my favorites because I want you to find the ones you love and favorite your own. Check out our website sarabeth.com where you can order a signed copy. You might find a delicious treat while you are searching the site. Look forward to seeing you again on my blog.

results.description:
In this trip, we'll visit the Asia Society's new exhibition, "Kamakura: Realism and Spirituality in the Sculpture of Japan". From the museum's description:

The magnificent sculpture of the Kamakura period (1185–1333) has long been considered a high point in the history of Japanese art. Stylistic and technical innovations led to sculpture that displayed greater realism than ever before. Sculptors began signing their works, allowing us to trace the development of individual and workshop styles that influenced later generations for centuries. Religious developments—often combinations of traditional and new practices—brought devotees into closer proximity with the deities they worshiped.

***

After viewing the exhibition, we'll head to a nearby cafe for hot drinks and snacks.

We hope to see you there!
results.name: Field Trip: Kamakura Exhibition @ The Asia Society

venue.address_1: Tillary St and Cadman Plaza W
venue.name: Cadman Plaza (Turf Fields)

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe and is free for those who attended both training sessions with him the same day, $4 for all others.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE GAME!

• Update your RSVP by 11:30AM

• RSVPs close by 12 NOON

• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Williamsburg Soccer Training activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. CO-ED PICKUP SOCCER GAMES in Sara D. Roosevelt Park!

                       NO CLEATS or PLASTIC STUDS

                           See our page on Facebook!:

       facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qpt6QQ5MeQ8

Game description:
We'll play two simultaneous games of 7 on 7.
There will be 4 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team.

RULES OF THE GAME:
First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!
Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.
No power shots allowed.
If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.
If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.
Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.
Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12:00 PM on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

Sara D. Roosevelt Park, Nike Field
Take the F train to 2nd Avenue Lower East Side, and walk for about 3 minutes on Chrystie Street to the Nike Field between Stanton St & Rivington St
New York, NY 10002
Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.

What to bring with you:
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee:
You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for, permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:
Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled.
The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to Slánte for brunch and a Pint or Two:

                                                        Slánte

                                                  304 Bowery
