results.description:
Please join us for a screening of the incredible documentary, Merchants of Doubt. Free and open to the public. Amazingly, you have TWO opportunities to see this insightful movie in the same week! Sign up on Facebook.

MANHATTAN - A Saturday matinee viewing.
Sat. 2/20/2016 @ 1:30-3:30PM
Patagonia, 72 Greene St (@ Spring) Soho, New York
https://www.facebook.com/events/944802225610481/
Sponsored by 350NYC, climate education group

BROOKLYN - A Thursday night viewing.
Thur. 2/25/2016 @ 7-9PM
68 Jay Street #405, Brooklyn, 11201
https://www.facebook.com/events/546692475506682/
Co-sponsored by 350Brooklyn and N+1 https://nplusonemag.com/


MORE ABOUT THE MOVIE

"Merchants of Doubt” takes audiences on a satirically comedic, yet illuminating ride into the heart of conjuring American spin. The movie lifts the curtain on a secretive group of highly charismatic, silver-tongued pundits-for-hire who present themselves in the media as scientific authorities - yet have the contrary aim of spreading maximum confusion about well-studied public threats ranging from toxic chemicals to pharmaceuticals to climate change." (Inspired by the acclaimed book by Naomi Oreskes and Erik Conway. Filmmaker Robert Kenner).
Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j8ii9zGFDtc

After the screening, we will examine how these corporate tactics have played out in the case of Exxon Mobil and discuss actions we can take in NYC to challenge Exxon and “Big Oil” climate deniers. #ExxonKnew
results.name: Merchants of Doubt - Free Film Screening & Discussion

results.description:
After the screening, we will examine how these corporate tactics have played out in the case of Exxon Mobil with Lauren Kurtz. And we’ll discuss actions we can take in NYC to challenge Exxon and “Big Oil” climate deniers. #ExxonKnew.

Lauren Kurtz is the Executive Director of the Climate Science Legal Defense Fund (CSLDF). At CSLDF, Lauren works to protect climate scientists from legal attack by politically and ideologically motivated parties.  Previously, Lauren was a litigation associate at Dechert LLP and held legal and policy positions at the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency.  Lauren has a J.D. and a master's in Environmental Policy from the University of  Pennsylvania.

results.description:
Who wants to play some pool? Let's get together on Feb. 20th for the first meetup of 2016 and pocket some balls at Eastside Billiards! The fun officially starts at 2pm with UNLIMITED play until 8 pm for only $20! Pay at the front desk and tell whomever is working the desk you're there for the meet up and they'll point you in our direction. All skill levels are welcome! I hope to see you there! Basic 8-Ball rules:

To avoid confusion and debate, here are some good rules for playing 8-ball. These are not the APA league rules, They're not "Mike's Biker bar" rules, they are the BCA rules which govern most pro pool matches.

-- The table is open (free choice of group) after the break, no matter which ball(s) are pocketed.
-- A scratch or other foul results in cue-ball in hand ANYWHERE on the table for the opponent.
-- Hitting one of your opponent's balls before one of your own on a shot is a foul.
-- Missing or scratching on the 8-ball is NOT loss of game if the 8-ball is still on the table.
-- The ball and pocket must be called unless the shot is obvious.
-- The number of cushions (or other balls) the ball bounces off need NOT be called.
-- The cue-ball or ANY other ball must touch a cushion or be pocketed after a shot or it's a foul.
-- The 8 ball must always be called.

results.description:
"How to Win Friends and Influence People in the Digital Age" by Dale Carnegie and Associates 

"An adaptation of Dale Carnegie’s timeless prescriptions for the digital age.

Dale Carnegie’s time-tested advice has carried millions upon millions of readers for more than seventy-five years up the ladder of success in their business and personal lives. Now the first and best book of its kind has been rebooted to tame the complexities of modern times and will teach you how to communicate with diplomacy and tact, capitalize on a solid network, make people like you, project your message widely and clearly, be a more effective leader, increase your ability to get things done, and optimize the power of digital tools.

Dale Carnegie’s commonsense approach to communicating has endured for a century, touching millions and millions of readers. The only diploma that hangs in Warren Buffett’s office is his certificate from Dale Carnegie Training. Lee Iacocca credits Carnegie for giving him the courage to speak in public. Dilbert creator Scott Adams called Carnegie’s teachings “life-changing.” To demonstrate the lasting relevancy of his tools, Dale Carnegie & Associates, Inc., has reimagined his prescriptions and his advice for our difficult digital age. We may communicate today with different tools and with greater speed, but Carnegie’s advice on how to communicate, lead, and work efficiently remains priceless across the ages."   -From Amazon.com

You can also find a copy of this book at
http://www.amazon.com/How-Friends-Influence-People-Digital/dp/1451612591/ref=tmm_pap_swatch_0?_encoding=UTF8&qid=&sr=
results.name: "How to Win Friends and Influence People in the Digital Age" by Dale Carnegie

results.description:
Hi ladies,

It's time for another swap (this event is so much fun!) If you are like me, you have tons of great items in your closets that you've never worn or will never wear again. Instead of throwing them out or leaving them in your closet to take up space, why not trade them? We will be hosting another Swap event on Saturday February 20th. Bring all your fab unwanted clothing (shoes and bags also) and trade them with a fellow fashionista!

Details:

-Bring 10-25 items in great condition (clean, no holes, stains or button missing). We will be inspecting each item at the start of the event. Please note that if your item is not in great condition, it will be denied.

-For every item you bring, you are able to swap 1 for 1. We will be issuing tickets to make sure that the exchange is fair.

-Any item brought is up for grabs, so regardless what you bring, you can swap it for something you like regardless of price range or item (shoes can be swapped for a top, etc). No Jewelry please.

-Even though this is a free event, we are collecting donations for God's Love We Deliver (www.glwd.com) and we ask that everyone in attendance make a small donation that day...$5, $10, etc. Please note that you must make a donation in order to attend. All proceeds will be donated To God's Love We Deliver to help provide food for people who are too sick to shop or cook on their own. Donation will be collected at the start of the event. Cash only please.

Hope to see you all there :)

Sam

www.justusgirlfriendsny.com
results.name: Swap Til' You Drop/Fundraiser for God's Love We Deliver

results.description:
THIS EVENT IS SOLD OUT. IF YOU DIDN'T FOLLOW THE LINK TO BUY A TICKET ON EVENTBRITE, PLEASE DON'T COME.

OUT PROFESSIONALS OFFERS AN IN-DEPTH TOUR OF A MIDTOWN ARCHITECTURAL MARVEL.

On Saturday, February 20, you are invited to join Members and friends of Out Professionals for an encore presentation of one of the most popular offerings in our City Secrets Series: “Historic Grand Central: The Walking Tour and Mixer.” After your insider’s tour of this national historic landmark, you’re welcome to unwind among new friends under the vaulted ceilings of the venerated Grand Central Oyster Bar.

A majestic Beaux Arts rendition of a classical form, New York’s Grand Central Terminal rivaled the Eiffel Tower as one of the turn-of-the-century’s most dramatic architectural achievements. It symbolized the exploding intellectual and commercial reach of what was then the world’s second largest city.

Highlights of our tour include:

• A briefing on the tragedy that led to the terminal’s creation.

• An outline of the ingenious design scheme that moves people and possessions.

• The terminal’s history-making role in landmarking New York City's architectural heritage.

• A visit to the Campbell Apartment, once the salon of ’20s mogul John W. Campbell.

• The historic roles played by Commodore Vanderbilt, Whitney Warren and Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis.

• A visit to the Whispering Arch.

Out Professionals’ private Walking Tour/Mixer series is designed for us — and you — by Joyce Gold History Tours of New York. Joyce teaches Manhattan history at New York University and the New School.

WHAT’S UP
Tour begins at 2 p.m. sharp, rain or shine. We meet at 89 East 42nd Street, under the Park Avenue Viaduct and just inside the entrance to Grand Central Terminal. Subway: 4/5/6/7/S to 42nd Street/Grand Central. Open-ended mixer begins about 4 p.m. in the Grand Central Oyster Bar; refreshments on your own.

ADMISSION
Print and pocket a copy of your online receipt; thanks! The personalized nature of our tours requires us to limit the number of participants.
results.name: Let's Meetup and Tour Grand Central!

results.description:
"We have already been too long subject to British prejudices. I use no porter or cheese in my family, but such as is made in America; both these articles may now be purchased of an excellent quality." -- George Washington

“I am a firm believer in the people. If given the truth, they can be depended upon to meet any national crisis. The great point is to bring them the real facts, and beer.” -- Abraham Lincoln


George Washington and Abraham Lincoln: Great Americans, great presidents, and most importantly of all, great beer lovers!

Let us gather, therefore,  to raise a pint in honor of these men, and to enjoy a carefree afternoon in the company of our fellow Americans, at Zeppelin Hall Biergarten and Restaurant! Yes, let us drink and play at games, and discuss the great issues of our time, much as our forefathers did in days gone by!

Zeppelin Hall offers an extensive variety of on-tap craft beers, and a menu of hearty pub favorites to satisfy your appetite. They are located next to the Jersey Avenue light rail stop, and just a few blocks south of the Grove Street PATH station. There is also plentiful parking in the lot at the end of Jersey Avenue. Plentiful enough, even, to park a horse and carriage. 

You know...if that's your thing.

YFL

results.description:
The Leslie-Lohman Museum of Gay and Lesbian Art is the first dedicated LGBTQ art museum in the world with a mission to exhibit and preserve LGBTQ art, and foster the artists who create it. The Museum maintains a collection of over 24,000 works, and retains an artist archive that contains information on over 1,900 LGBTQ artists, both those represented in the collection and others of interest to LGBTQ audiences.

Admission to the museum is FREE. If we can guarantee a group of at least 10, we may ask the museum to provide a tour guide.

Mass transit: Each person is responsible for getting to the museum, but if you live near NJ Transit's Morris and Essex line a group will be getting on the train that departs Dover at 12:05 PM (Morristown @12:23 PM, Madison @12:31 PM, Orange @1:04 PM) arriving at NY Penn Station at 1:39 PM. Check NJTransit.com for fares. From NY Penn Station, we will take the A Train to Canal St, then walk 2-3 short blocks to the museum.

Hoofing it? Sherri Rase would like to help organize a group who would prefer to get a hearty walk in before arriving at the museum. Sherri is planning to walk the entire length of the High Line park, starting at 1:00 PM, then meander through Greenwich Village to the museum. Total walk is approximately 2 miles. Contact Sherri at [masked] if you'd like to join her.

Dinner plans: For each outing, there is usually a meal planned either before or after. This time, after the museum closes, or when the group decides, we will walk back to the "Canal St." subway stop which is actually located at 35 6th Avenue, and pop into the AOA Bar and Grill, roughly 20 feet from the "Canal St." subway entrance. They offer a small but diverse menu of salads, sides, soups, personal pizzas, sandwiches and complete dinners. Check out the menu at www.AOABarandGrillNYC.com.

Primary organizer for this GAAMC Outing is Nick from the 20-Somethings. If you cannot reach Nick, please contact Board Trustee Jay via email at [masked].
results.name: Leslie-Lohman Museum of Gay and Lesbian Art

results.description:
This Event: 

The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where Python developers and learners can come and ask questions or give help. 

Individuals of all programming skill levels are welcome. 

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

This event is free. 

This event is not a tutorial. Tutorials hosted by Learn Python NYC are labeled as tutorials.

Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.
results.how_to_find_us: Show ID at front desk, come up to 11th floor, we are in the Deerbrook conference room!
results.name: Saturday Python Study Group

results.description:
Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we chant and meditate together, together with the beautiful sounds of a gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can at all times.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm on Midchester Ave. -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we meet elsewhere and begin our meeting at 5 pm, followed by an informal potluck social starting about 7 pm.

(When you plan on staying for the potluck, see the log-in information posted at our monthly potluck page. That helps us get healthy, balanced meals.)

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.  We never have only a few members at a meeting. Twenty members more usually attend each meeting.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.
results.name: American Meditation Society - Weekly Saturday Meetup in White Plains

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 15 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
This is a casual hangout and open discussion at my place for fully automated trading.  It will be an open discussion but more in the context of people already knowing how to trade and program, so please keep that in mind (this is not a workshop or talk on learning how to trade).  

I personally will be working on a fully autonomous trading system I built called Tech Trader (http://www.techtrader.ai), which has been trading live without human intervention since 2012.  I'll be happy to share my progress and my experiences working on that.  It's traded for both myself and actual hedge funds since inception.

You are also more than welcome to bring your own stuff to work on or share.  I'm always interested to see if there are others out there working on fully automated trading algorithms, particularly those in the industry or trading at scale. 

As usual though, the event will be fairly casual and more hangout-oriented, so those looking for something more lecture or workshop oriented should look elsewhere.


Call[masked] to be let in.
results.name: Fully Automated Trading Discussion and Hangout

results.description:
Join us for our weekly Underwater Rugby (UWR) practice!

Underwater what? Underwater rugby is probably the most exciting activity you may have ever done. The only 3D sport (apart from Harry Potter’s Quidditch), great endurance, fast, strategic, and above all: extreme fun! Imagine a 13ft-deep pool, 2 baskets on the bottom of each side. Two teams, equipped with fins, mask&snorkel, and a salt-water filled ball. We hold our breath when playing at 3, 5, 13 feet below the surface and pass the ball standing on our heads, swimming sideways and swirling around. Yes, we can tackle the person who carries the ball. But no, no one ever drowned in the 60 years the sport has been around. Ladies and gents are equally welcome - we are co-ed :)

We have all the equipment you need if you want to try. Just let us know and jump with us into the water - we welcome all levels (though you should be able to swim and be comfortable with the idea of swimming under the water - but you don't need to be an expert diver). 

So just send us a quick line and new experiences await - we promise!

Contact Daniel or Rolexi at [masked]

And check out our Facebook profile www.facebook.com/NJ.UWH.UWR/

<a href="http://g.co/maps/ueppk"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: 226 Rome Street, Newark, NJ  Map: http://g.co/maps/ueppk

results.description:
Basic Ground Rules for Participation

Please wear either a blue/black or white shirt to make things easy (Preferably bring both in case we need to mix the teams more evenly).


no need to respond at all if you can't/don't want to play

• if you do respond IN, please come unless something really urgent comes up (hangovers or better offers from your cooler friends not accepted for absences!)


• If you suck at Ultimate... you are more than welcome. This is open to ALL skill levels, ages etc. If you're really good, please pretend you suck every once in a while for the benefit of the rest of us! We're just here to run around and have fun. We all want to score and win but if you want to win at all costs, this is not the game for you.

• The trick with this group is making sure we have enough to play, so those who do show up don't waste a trip, so please make the effort this year to be honest with yourself and us about if you can/want to come down so we can make the right call for GAME ON or GAME OFF. If you are a "maybe" please indicate that via the comment section with a brief explanation (ie 80% chance I'll be there...). If you RSVP and are then unable to attend, please update your RSVP as soon as possible.

What is Ultimate Frisbee? In a nutshell <borrowed from Wiki> :

Ultimate is a limited-contact team field sport played with a disc (frisbee). Points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone. Other basic rules are that players must not take steps while holding the disc (maintain a pivot), and interceptions and incomplete passes are turnovers.

Closest analogy I could come up with = a mix of basketball and football, but played with a frisbee. You do not need to be an expert frisbee player/thrower etc. - it's all about having fun.
results.name: NEW TIME - Saturday Ultimate Frisbee (Anderson Park)

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". THERE IS NO NEED TO POST WHY YOU CAN'T MAKE THE EVENT. 

I also scheduled this same walk on Sunday, February 21st.

HAVE EXTRA LAYERS OF CLOTHING. PLEASE DRESS PROPERLY FOR THE WINTER CONDITIONS.

This is a sociable walk along a very scenic route filled with interesting places. I will comment on some things (the architecture and social history of some of these splendid apartment buildings on the Upper West Side) along the way, but you will have plenty of time to socialize with others. We will be stopping at points of interest. (If you don't like this stopping, this walk is not good for you.) This walk is about 2 1/2 to 3 miles and moderate paced. 

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John (the Event Host) who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photo. 

Description: The Upper West Side has many architecturally distinctive and magnificent apartment buildings. We’ll go by some of these Upper West Side apartment buildings, built from about 1880 to 1932. We’ll see apartment buildings that have had a scandalous past; others that have had a spiritual beginning. We’ll look at apartment houses built for the wealthy; tenements built for the poor; studio buildings built for artists; and buildings that were not originally built as apartment houses.

We'll see how apartment buildings ward off those evil spirits; we'll see apartments buildings with Dirty Little Secrets; and we'll see apartment buildings with deceptive architecture.


Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer’s Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time/Place:  The meeting time is (after lunch) at 2:00 PM. The meeting place is outside the entrance to Barnes & Noble at 2289 Broadway, near 82nd St. Before the walk, restrooms are available on the second floor of Barnes & Noble. There will be limited places to stop for a restroom during the walk.

Transportation: Take the northbound No. 2 subway train (which is making local stops this weekend) to 79th Street/Broadway. The No. 2 train is replacing the No. 1 local train and will make northbound local stops, including 79th Street/Broadway.

http://web.mta.info/weekender/lineview.html?r=2

Finishing Time/Place:  The walk finishes between 4:30 PM and 4:45 PM at West 78th Street and Columbus Avenue.

Rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions will cancel this walk. Therefore, if it is rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions or the forecast is for rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice on Sunday morning. This walk will only happen in good weather conditions. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If I do cancel the walk, I will also post a cancellation notice on the Discussion Board.

Although the Ansonia on the Upper West Side is still decorated with impressively beautiful ornamentation, it originally had even more ornamentation. 

During 1942, the Ansonia’s copper cornices were removed and melted down for the war effort. Below were workmen removing a cartouche from the roof of the Ansonia Hotel. (Source Lorraine B. Diehl, 1942)

In addition to its beautiful architecture, the Ansonia is rich in history:

The Ansonia was once popular among athletes. On September, 21, 1919 a group of Chicago White Sox baseball players agreed in the room of first baseman Arnold “Chick” Gandil to lose the upcoming World Series for $10,000 a player. For all their plotting, the players didn’t practice to lose convincingly enough and after their 5-3 loss, they came under suspicion. (Source untappedcities.com) 

Many New York Yankees baseball players (they were not involved with the 1919 baseball scandal) also made the Ansonia their home, and Babe Ruth moved in after the Boston Red Sox sold his contract to the New York Yankees. Ruth’s apartment became a clubhouse for card games and parties. He was inspired to take up the saxophone while living at the Ansonia, and his squeaky bleatings were familiar up and down the hallways on his floor. (Source untappedcities.com) 

In 1968, the Continental Baths opened in the basement of the Ansonia Hotel. Bette Midler is known for starting her career at the Continental Baths singing to an audience clad only in towels. Barry Manilow was often accompanying her, clad only in a towel as well. The basement later became the location of the first straight sex club, Plato's Retreat. (Source Advocate.com)

results.description:
"GENES, COMPUTERS, AND MEDICINE" Multidisciplinary Roundtable at Helix Center

This event is organized by the New York Psychoanalytic Society & Institute at Helix Center.

It fits our multidisciplinary pursuits. It talks about “Developments in computational neuroscience, molecular biology, and genomics have opened up new ways of looking at disease. In a relatively short time span, these advances may lead to significant innovations in the understanding of various diseases, as well as in therapeutics designed to treat them. How might these changes affect our perceptions and experiences of illness and treatment? How might they also become useful in investigating the etiology of mental disorders and responding to them?

Check the link for more details: 
http://www.helixcenter.org/roundtables/genes-computers-and-medicine/

If you plan on attending please be there early; first come, first-seated. 

** Again, this event is not organized by our group, and we don't have control over seating or other aspects **

Please follow this link provided below to register and secure your ticket.
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/groundhog-day-free-group-healing-letting-go-of-repetitive-patterns-tickets-20572957269

Looking at the holidays in the holidays in the month of February you have a choice: Groundhog Day and Valentine's Day. Of the two, Groundhog Day tends to be the favorite. Groundhog Day in the United States is February 2nd. We don't know the history of the holiday, but it has come to represent a seeming choice point between staying with old stuck patterns, or breaking free for a transformative experience. With this theme in mind, come and celebrate a belated Groundhog Day with a free group healing. Join Lorraine Goldbloom as she facilitates a healing designed release the repetitive patterns that are hard to let go of, allowing for a new space and freedom to emerge.

VortexHealing® is an extraordinary healing modality that works through consciousness and matter. It focuses on healing and the acceleration of spiritual awakening. The event is free but registration is required. Please arrive on time.


This event is open to everyone and their guests, feel free to share this invitation.
The event is FREE of charge, but registration at Eventbrite.com is required as space is very limited. Once you have registered, you will receive an email from Eventbrite.com confirming your registration and ticket. You must print the ticket you receive in the confirmation email and bring it with you. THIS TICKET IS REQUIRED FOR ADMITTANCE.

Doors will open after 2:45 and Lorraine will start promptly
No admittance after 3:15pm

Looking forward to seeing you at the event.
Lorraine Goldbloom
VortexHealing® Teacher

You'll also have the chance to meet:

2 Powerful Creators from ""Self Empowerment NYC - Achieving Your Greatness""

1 Fans of Qigong from ""Qigong NYC (aka Chi Kung) - Energy Health Fitness""

1 Organic Lovers from ""Organic NYC - Food Garden Lifestyle""

11 Meditators from ""Meditation NYC""

5 Powerful Attractors from ""Law of Attraction NYC - Awaken Your Genie""

3 Fans of Wellness from ""Holistic Wellness NYC - Outdoor, Yoga, Hiking, Mind, Body""

4 Seekers of Truth from ""Cosmic Health NYC - Meditation, Breathe, Spirit, Light""

5 Yogis from ""Yoga Society NYC""

1 Explorers of Health from "Alternative Health NYC"

3 Artists of Touch from "Massage NYC - Explore-Touch-Connect"

2 Members from "Holistic and Spiritual Weight Loss Meetup - NY"

1 Explorers & Seekers from "Healers of Enlightenment & Transformation NYC"

3 Conquerers of Self-Doubt & Fear from "Gain Confidence NYC"

4 Radiant Energy Healers from "Energy Healers NYC"

1 MindBody Explorers from "Connecting Mind & Body NYC"

A total of 36 people are expected to attend!

We're having another volunteer meetup. This time the focus will be the python data work that Jesse's been leading, the grant-writing work that Diane's been leading, and anything new or existing volunteers bring up. At 6pm, we'll get some food and drinks and hang out.

Our monthly meetup to discuss two articles. If you would like to suggest an article, please do so in the comments below. RSVPs will open two weeks before day of meetup.  Priority on the waitlist will be given to individuals who have previously contributed to good discussion, posted a thoughtful comment or suggested an article.


Topic for this month's discussion is food. We'll ask and discuss: What is food? What do we like to eat? What are some of the norms and rituals we have surrounding food? What is healthy? How do restaurants sell and market their food? Why are some efforts more successful than others? 

Topic 1: 

The End of Food: Has a tech entrepreneur come up with a product to replace our meals?


http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2014/05/12/the-end-of-food

Topic 2: 

Freedom from Fries: Can fast food be good for you?

</a>

<a href="http://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2011/11/all-the-single-ladies/308654/">

http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2015/11/02/freedom-from-fries

Pre-meetup topic:

http://www.wnyc.org/story/re-tracing-millennia-hungry-humans/

results.description:
Please state what you'll be playing in your RSVP to make it easy to track.

Here's a list of some stuff we have been playing at the last several jams.

Big Boss Man

Bertha

Ramble on Rose

Sugaree

Cold Rain and Snow

GDTRFB

Beat It On Down the Line

Friend of the Devil

Sugar Magnolia

Brokedown Palace

What we haven't been doing is working on some of the bigger jam vehicle tunes. We should make a spot in the third hour just after the 'Safety Meeting in the Stairwell' jam to bust out an Eyes, Dark Star, ScarletFire, etc.

We should go through these until we devolve into the usual 'call something out clockwise setlist'

I'll sign up for drums. If another drummer signs up I will rent the congas and split the time. If two bass players sign up, we will look into another room.
results.name: Workingman's Monthly Electric Jam

results.description:
Every Saturday from 3:00 to 4:00 PM - Advanced level

$15 less than 3 - $10 from 3 to 6 people

You need to register prior coming.

This is an advanced meeting! You should be almost fluent. I'm here to propose a new subject of conversation every week, to manage the discussion and respect everyone's speech time as well as to correct mistakes (if you allow me to do so).

Au plaisir de faire votre connaissance!

Ingrid

www.facebook.com/thefrenchieonc
results.name: 1h French Conversation - Advanced Level

results.description:
This meeting is for both fiction and non-fiction writers. Depending on how many people sign up to come and to share their work at this meeting, we will divide the group into two tables. A "fiction writers" table and a "non-fiction writers" table.

Bring a piece to read and discuss, up to 1500 words, or simply bring yourself. If you bring a piece, please make copies for the others. How many copies? Check here the last day and you will find the answer.

All formats welcome: poems, short stories, flash fiction, novellas, novels, articles, blog entries, essays, children books, screen and theatrical plays, etc.

Here is how we will divide the tables if needed:

1) Fiction writers: Genres covered are literary/upscale/art fiction, poetry, all kinds of mysteries, speculative fiction (fantasy, urban fantasy, horror and sci-fi), chick lit, women fiction, romance (all kinds, including historical, regent, sexy and erotica), western.

2) Non-fiction writers: Genres covered are all kids of non-fiction, autobiographies and memoires, academic non-fiction, news articles, blogs, poetry, non-fiction screenplays etc.
results.how_to_find_us: You can't miss us :)
results.name: Hudson Writers Meeting

results.description:
'Paper Tigers' follows a year in the life of an alternative high school that radically changed its approach to disciplining its students, becoming a promising model for how to break the cycles of bullying, drug abuse, truancy, teen pregnancy, and low graduation rates.

Stressed brains can’t learn.

That was the nugget of neuroscience that Jim Sporleder, principal of this high school riddled with violence and failure, took away from an educational conference in 2010. Three years later, suspension days at his high school dropped from 796 to 135 and the graduation rate had increased five fold.

A FREE screening of this movie is being held on the 20th of February with a panel discussion and Q and A after!
It's guaranteed to be a fun and informative time!

You can reserve your FREE tickets at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-relationship-foundation-presents-paper-tigers-free-screening-tickets-20897443817?aff=es2
results.name: Let's meet up and watch 'PAPER TIGERS', a movie about a miracle school, FOR FREE

results.description:
The cost for each class is $20.00 which includes 3-6 hours of class time. Includes all the paper supplies needed to create your Make and Take copy of each project and a glass of wine while you learn fun ways to create beautiful handmade card & paper crafting projects. 

Just bring your favorite adhesive (tape runner, wet glue and/foam pop up tape.)

Each class will start with a look the samples and a quick rundown of the techniques used for each of the projects for the night. 

I will show you step by step how to construct each. In the process you get to "play" with Stampin’ Up! products and learn about many of the tools and supplies that are used in the world of card making and paper crafting.

You get a supplies sheet listing the sizes & dimensions of the project, stamp sets, dies and tools used during the class and an Exclusive YT web address to a video demo of the class' projects only class attendees can access (videos stay exclusive for 1 year).  

TENTATIVE THEMES FOR 2016

• January's Classes: Love(Valentine's Day) / Wet Embossing & Coloring

• February's Classes: Springtime(Easter) / Interactive Cards

• March's Classes: Birthdays & Special Days / Layers & Punches

• April's Classes: Just Because / Multi-Step Stamping & Backgrounds

• May's Classes: Congratulations(Graduations & Weddings) / Fancy Folds

• June's Classes: Thinking of You / Inking & Stencils

• July's Classes: Any Occasion / Dry Embossing

• August's Classes: Back to School / Non-traditional sizes & Easels

• September's Classes: Spooky Fun(Halloween) / Die Cutting

• October's Classes: Family Gatherings(Thanksgiving) / Using Punches

• November's Classes: Holiday Wishes(Christmas/Hanukkah) / Shakers

• December's Classes: Inspirational(New Year) / Monochromatic White

* Each Class (same theme/design) will be held 3 times a month.

** Class will be cancelled if there are less than 3 participants or for personal emergency.

*** Please make sure you are subscribed to organizer's messages.

Need more information or would like to suggest a theme or project... please feel free to send me a message.
results.how_to_find_us: See the description for a list of the months for 2016 & proposed theme and technique when the class. Verified once class is ANNOUNCED.
results.name: Well Wishes & Wine Classes 2016 - Saturday Class

results.description:
Feeling frazzled from the pressures of work, family and relationships? We were born pure, without the influence of others. We were taught what not to do and what we should do from our parents, our friends, our society, our religion....so much that we have forgotten who we are. This guided meditation and workshop will help you connect with who you truly are, your wants and needs and how to begin the process of finding authentic, genuine love. 

Bring all the questions you have about your love life because half of the session will include this unique Question & Answer session! It's time for you to go within take the first step to receiving the love you deserve.

results.description:
Today we will be focused and immersive in a specific theme we will work on together as a group.

In today's challenge we will be drawing from the theme of cultural futurism. Basically its a fancy word I made up for how past cultures would be like in the future if they were still around in a sci-fiesque style. For example like an Egyptian Sphinx can now be a giant tomb guarding robot, in the future samurai now use laser katanas and wear mechanical armor, or even Ancient Rome can now be a floating Metropolis. 

The meetup will be split into three parts: First a half hour of warm-up drawings followed by a break of conceptual discussion, then after an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others fully developed drawings and ideas as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! Also feel free to bring any reference material that will help out with the theme in addition to what will be provided.

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising, challenging, or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed!

Follow and join our facebook page for updates on the group, art relating to the theme, and more at https://www.facebook.com/groups/ImaginativeIllustratorsNYC/
results.name: Lets Draw Together! Theme: Cultural Futurism

results.description:
I would love for you to join me as we begin to use meditation and improvisational movement as a means to encourage a conversation and cohesion between our rational and everyday thinking with our intuitive, spiritual, and woman selves. I am continually inspired by the connection between this kind of work and a deeper dialogue with our body-minds.

Any woman with a calling to work in this way is welcome to attend! By just showing up with a willingness to be present in the work, you have already opened your heart and you are already a dancer.

I reserved the beautiful space Eden's Expressway through Movement Research, and I am charging $10 a person (No one will be turned away for lack of funds. Feel free to contact me.)

I can only accept a maximum of 15 women, so please RSVP as soon as you can! If you can't make it this time, I will be offering 3 more sessions through March.

I so look forward to meeting and moving with each of you!! If you have any questions/concerns/excitements/anything, please message me. I would love to hear from you!

--caitlin

"The unknown becomes a friend, absurdity is worn well, fear is gently smiled at. The making-a-fool quality is always present when you stand at the edge of the empty space and...willingly take the first step." -- Barbara Dilley

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

2/20: 4:45-6:45pm. Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Note: this isn't a support group for those sad or depressed as there are other domains set up for that purpose. Please do not attend if you feel others somehow have the responsibility of "making you happy."

Do you come from the opinion that happiness is "pursued," or do you maintain that that is far from the truth? Perhaps somewhere in the middle? Or both depending on how you look at it? Most importantly, why is it that you believe what you do?

"Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of Happiness"- arguably the most famous line in the Declaration of Independence. I recently watched the movie Pursuit of Happyness (featuring Will Smith and son) and was moved by its story and many messages. Got me thinking from across different time periods and what a "pursuit of happiness" looked like in one period and what its makeup would be if one subscribed to that philosophy. Let us explore through historical, cultural, and any all other lenses what is meant by this pursuit and how it pertains to our daily lives. Taking a couple of  hours to stream/watch Pursuit of Happyness will get you more excited for the conversation, though isn't necessary to attend.

The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

2/20: 4:45-6:45pm. Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Note: this isn't a support group for those sad or depressed as there are other domains set up for that purpose. Please do not attend if you feel others somehow have the responsibility of "making you happy."

Do you come from the opinion that happiness is "pursued," or do you maintain that that is far from the truth? Perhaps somewhere in the middle? Or both depending on how you look at it? Most importantly, why is it that you believe what you do?

"Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of Happiness"- arguably the most famous line in the Declaration of Independence. I recently watched the movie Pursuit of Happyness (featuring Will Smith and son) and was moved by its story and many messages. Got me thinking from across different time periods and what a "pursuit of happiness" looked like in one period and what its makeup would be if one subscribed to that philosophy. Let us explore through historical, cultural, and any all other lenses what is meant by this pursuit and how it pertains to our daily lives. Taking a couple of  hours to stream/watch Pursuit of Happyness will get you more excited for the conversation, though isn't necessary to attend.

The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions

results.description:
Looking to get more involved with YNA? Interested in helping organize naturist events and creating community?

Come join us for a YNA volunteer meeting on Saturday, February 20 at 5pm in Long Island City!

We are looking first and foremost for a team of dedicated people to help plan and organize different naturist events in the tri-state area. While our membership is growing, and so many local naturists (and newbies) are interested in events, it has become quite difficult for Jordan and I, Felicity, to keep up with it all!

Event-planning experience is great, but not required. If you are new to naturism, that’s okay too.

(We use the word “volunteer,” however there is a potential to earn money at this as we like to share the profit with those who’ve earned it.)

You MUST RSVP via email to attend this meeting and to receive the location / address – ynaevents [at] gmail .com or go to our contact page and submit an email there.

In your message please include:

– Your name

– Your background / experience with naturism, if any (How long you’ve been a naturist, if you go to events, resorts, etc)

– And tell us how and why you are interested in helping out.

Feel free to include or contact us with any questions.

While this meeting will focus on events, if you are interested in volunteering in some other capacity, you are still invited to attend. Just please specify this in your email to us!

Snacks and drinks will be provided. This meeting is clothing-optional. (BYOT – bring your own towel.)

One last NOTE: Please do not attend unless you seriously interested in volunteering and contributing some time and effort!

FAQ’s

Q: What is “young”? Do I have to be of a certain age to volunteer?
A: You must be over 18, but there is no upper age limit. While YNA is geared toward the 18-35 generation, we welcome the young as well as the young-at-heart.

Q: What type of events has YNA done in the past?
A: We have done many, many different kinds of events! For some examples: Indoor naked parties (Nude Night Out), body painting parties, fundraising events, naked bowling, shamanic journeying, gatherings at nudist clubs and resorts, nude hiking trips, nude beach meetups and more.

Q: Are events only in the spring / summer?
A: Typically we have events all year-round (this winter has been an exception). In the colder months, we’ve organized various indoor events in NYC, and in the warm season we travel to different clubs and outdoor recreation areas.

New to YNA? Learn more on our event FAQs page!
results.name: YNA Events Volunteer Meeting

group.name: Young Naturists / Nudists America (YNA) meetup group

results.description:
We're bringing back our popular format this month here at BFTVC: All Full Court Evening. We'll have 3 teams of 7, with two subs, and rotate the teams around to play full court games all evening.

And as usual:

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. 

Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! 

Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2014 as we're not a litigious group. 

If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Walls, and ceiling are out of bounds. 


3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. 

Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

results.description:
BlackLightBall, it's like regular indoor soccer but under the BlackLights and with music!! This is our Monthly BLB event (3rd Sat of the Month) at this location. 

This is a fun laid back social event. You can come later if that fits your schedule better, no problem.  We will have music playing, there will be healthy snacks and drinks, and we will be playing indoor soccer till the sun goes down. Once it's dark enough we will switch over to BlackLightBall for the rest of the evening. You can play as much or little as you like. When you get off the court and you would like to play again just get back into the line. Otherwise if you like, take a break, eat a snack, socialize, and watch others play a game. It's all for fun and to raise funds for Street Soccer USA.

WHITE T-SHIRT IS A MUST.  (Shorts, socks, shoes - the more white or fluorescent colors the better)
BRING INDOOR SHOES OR SNEAKERS.
PINNIES WILL BE PROVIDED but sometimes you will be wearing just the white shirt.

Street Soccer USA's unique court with walls and medium sized goals creates a very fast paced and exciting match! 

Rules:


8min games

Fun Play 

No Sliding 

Game restarts from goalie 

Kick-ins.. no throw ins

Corner kicks 

Directions:

By Car - Cross the RFK Bridge and take the I-278 exit towards Randalls Island. Turn right onto Central Rd until it turns into Hell Gate Circle. Turn Right crossing under the RFK Bridge onto Sunken Garden Loop.  Help SEC is across from Fields 90-91.  Use the comments section to arrange carpooling if you like. Typically there is at least a group doing a car pool from the Court Square/Murray Playground area in LIC.

By Bus - Take the M-35 bus which leaves from 125th St and Lexington Ave in front of the Duane Reade. It is the second to last stop on the bus route. 

By Train - Take the 4-5 train to 125th St. Transfer to the M-35 bus.

PS2G promotes clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.


The fee is  $10 via paypal, (includes insurance, permit, security guard) 100% of the proceeds go to Street Soccer USA. Learn more about our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Street Soccer USA is sports for social change. Using our entrepreneurial instinct as well as evidence based practices, we make a measurable difference in the lives of undeserved youth in urban areas and special needs populations, including homeless families, adults, people in recovery, among others.

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game. 


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? Go take jujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.


If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play. 

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers Help USA nor Street Soccer USA are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.
results.name: IndoorSoccer& BlackLightBall Fundraising Social 5:30pm - Ward's Island for SSUSA

results.description:
A Shamanic journey of ancient remembering. A healing ceremony of the Soul lead by Kevon Simpson.

What is Light Of Iris?

Love Includes Growing Heights Together of Integration Responsibility Intuition and Simplicity. Light of Iris is a Shamanic healing ceremony that uses meditation, journaling, dance, drawing, music, and .... more to help facilitate lasting emotional healing and a permanent expansion of consciousness. For some that means increased creativity, for others that can mean healing deeply repressed childhood wounds in a matter of hours, for some it can mean reawakening a connection to ones ancestors and their power. It is named after my late Great Grandmother Iris Palmer who came to me in a vision as pure light during a previous ceremony. I don't have the right words to describe the impact that had on me, but we do want to share that possibility with others. This is about remembering who you are and standing in that power. To honor the privacy of our participants. No further information regarding the nature of this healing experience will be posted here. Joining this invite does not guarantee your participation. Please send a message to find out more information, register and be added to the list.

We love you :-) ♥,
Team Iris
results.name: Light Of Iris Small Private Healing Ceremony

Our bate-papo this time will be in a churrascaria (Brazilian barbecue) in a "rodizio" style. Rodizio is a special way of serving savory cuts of fire-roasted meat presented on skewers and carved by your table side. And after a caipirinha everybody will speak Portuguese fluently!


This will be a great opportunity to practice your Portuguese language skills,  meet new people and also see again those who have already became friends. Everybody will be encouraged to speak Portuguese only.


NOTE: The restaurant takes CASH ONLY.  Barbecue with hot and salad buffet = $23.99 on weekends (drinks and desert not included). They also offer a vegetarian option.

See you there!

Aparecida Teixeira

results.description:
Let's face it! Come February NYC's "Winter Wonderland" has lost it's luster. Going on a Winter hike "challenging", a picnic in Central Park isn't exactly appetizing, etc.


Well here's something that is appetizing: A Vegan Winter Feast in Hell's Kitchen!

Here's the plan: Please bring a vegan food item to share (no meat, chicken, fish, eggs, dairy, or honey). Hot food is encouraged as my microwave can reheat things in a jiffy!  Enjoy viewing Jack Frost's work outside, while savoring great food and company inside! And remember, February's a short month, so... March will come soon, and with that: Spring will Finally arrive! (Yay!)


My apt is wheelchair accessible, close to A,C,E,1,2,3, and 7 trains, along with crosstown M34 and M42 buses.

Exact address given 24hrs before the Winter Vegan Feast.

results.description:
Making delicious French Macarons is a true art. The popularity of this French dessert has only exploded in the past few years. 

During this 2h 30min session, you will learn how to prepare, bake, and make this delightful and light pastry. Chef Simon will guide and teach you every step of the way in order for you to perfect the recipe behind this sophisticated delicacy. 

From whipping the meringue into the base to piping the shells onto a sheet and cooking an exquisite ganache, guests will acquire the essential techniques to be able to replicate the recipe at home. 

For more info & tickets: https://goo.gl/CvlSaS

results.description:
The February 20th Mixed Doubles Tennis Wine and Beer Social!

When: Saturday February 20th, 6:30 pm - 11:00 pm

Where:

TCR: The Club of Riverdale, 2600 Netherland Ave, Bronx, NY

What:

Join us for a FUN night of Mixed Doubles competition! Format will be timed rotations on 6 gorgeous indoor tennis courts in a 120,000 sq ft facility. Check-In at 6:30 pm and play time on the courts will consist of up to 3 hours from 7:00 pm - 10:00 pm.

From 10:00 pm - 11:00 pm, finish off the event with your new tennis friends and some final laughs over food, wine and beer (This has been a great highlight of the Tennis Social Event, not to be missed)

Dress:


Tennis Attire and Non-Marking Tennis Sneakers (Only)

Level of Play:

All levels of play are welcome

Beginners and Advanced Beginners will play with each other Advanced and Intermediate Players will play with each

Tennis Pros will participate with all players on the courts

Cost:

$95 Non-TCR Members: If you enroll on a Friday or Saturday before the event

$75 Non-TCR Members: If you enroll on a Thursday or prior for the event (Best Offer If Not A TCR Member)

$50 Non-TCR Member Guests: Guests can enjoy the Social and TCR facility (i.e pool, sauna, steam room, etc), but not play tennis

$50 TCR Members: Can participate in all aspects of the event

Structure:

Competition is limited to 36 Players Only

Men & Women

Singles & Couples

It will be fun, social environment that will have plenty of hitting and friendly mixed doubles competition

Itinerary of Event:

Check-In: 6:30 pm

Tennis Play: 7:00 pm - 10:00 pm

Wine & Beer: 10:00 pm - 11:00 pm

RSVP: Call[masked] or email [masked] The only way to confirm your reservation and to participate as one of the 36 players is to provide payment before the event. This event will sell out quickly, so don't delay.

The following information is needed to secure your reservation:

Name(s) of attendees:

TCR Member or Guest: Yes: $50 / No: $75 (Paying Thurs or Prior) / No: $95 (Paying Friday or Saturday) /

Credit Card Number:

CVV:Expiration:

Name as it Appears on Card:

Cardholder Address:

How to Arrive:


You may be able to get a FREE ride by sharing with another participant of the event or carpooling with others via UBER as another alternative. If so, please email, [masked] to see if there is any availability, otherwise these are the other options:

FREE Pick Up Via Car

If space is available you can meet on the North West corner (by the T-Mobile Store) at 96 Street and Broadway at 6:00 pm. Coordinate with Robert at[masked] if you would like this.

By Car on Your Own

Henry Hudson Southbound: Take Kappock Street exit 18 off Henry Hudson Pkwy, turn left 180° at stop sign onto Kappock St. At second light turn left onto Netherland Ave. TCR club is located in the Century building.

Henry Hudson Northbound: Take Kappock Street exit 18 of Henry Hudson Pkwy, continue off the exit onto Kappock St., then turn left onto Netherland Ave. TCR club is located in the Century building.

Manhattan East Side: Take Deegan 87 to 230th St Exit 10, left at light. Left onto Broadway under the elevated train. Make first right onto 230th st and at road end turn left onto Irwin Ave. Follow up hill and turn right onto Kappock St, first light make a right onto Netherland Ave.

By Bus from Manhattan

BxM1: Bus runs from East Midtown, Manhattan directly to the club. Manhattan pick ups start at 3 Ave/33rd St. and goes up 3rd Ave till 97s street before it goes off 3rd Avenue. Bus is scheduled to pickup every 12 to 30 minutes depending on time of day. Stops right next to club at Kappock St. and Knolls Crescent. Here goes the full bus schedule stops: http://bustime.mta.info/m/?q=BxM1

#1 Train:

Take the 1 train to 207th St. and take the 20 bus to Kappock and Knolls Crescent.

OR

Take the 1 train to 231st St. and take the 10 bus to Kappock and Knolls Crescent.

By Metro North Train

Metro-north stop at Spuytin Duyvul station, 5 minute walk to TCR.

Parking:
There is paid parking available in the Century building's garage, with TCR validation prices range from $8/2hrs, $9/3hrs, $14/over 3 hours. There is also FREE street parking available within 1 or 2 blocks of the club.

How to Enter:

TCR is located in the century building, one flight up from the parking garage. If you enter through the loading dock, it is located one flight down. If you enter through the main lobby of the building, TCR is two flights down.

Just Ring the Doorbell to allow entry.

Questions: Call[masked] and speak with your Host and Elite USPTA Certified Tennis Pro, Robert


SEE YOU ON THE COURTS...

results.description:
The Anti New Year's Resolution


Resolutions are hard to keep, we've all been there done that. They are usually based on the type of person we’re tired of being, rather than who we want to become. More often than not resolutions can be “broken,” leaving no room for achievable self growth. Perhaps our hopes for the year ahead could be centered instead on who we want to become, and the transformation that is possible.

It’s great to want to be a better you, and the New Year is a perfect time to proclaim that. So, how do we do it in a more committed way?
Choosing a power word replaces broken promises, it provides a simple vision for personal change. 

• Choice offers us clarity and focus, 

• An intentional move forward towards positive change, 

• The ability to see our selves with distance and tenderness.

• A move towards the future rather than revisiting the past.


This is a simple and powerful process, that allows us to commit to the change we want to be and to witness our own process when we own what we want and who we want to become. 

So how do we pick our power word, join in on this Meetup to find out!
results.name: Choose a Power Word for 2016!

Back in May of 2014, quite a few classical music fans on Meetup were wowed by talented violinist (and Meetup member) Nikita Morozov when he performed with his chamber ensemble Hausmusik. Well, he's even better now!

Come hear him, along with accomplished pianist Aaron Likness, as they play a program of Mozart, Debussy, Bach, Beethoven, and more.

(Read artist bios ---> HERE)

Mozart:            Sonata for Violin and Piano K. 305 in A major 
Debussy:         Preludes (selections) 
Bach:                Partita for Solo Violin in D minor - Chaconne

results.description:
Create pottery & mold clay together in this cutes couples pottery class!

In this class we will introduce you to how to make cups, vases, trays, containers and other functional objects by using various hand-building techniques of pinching, coiling and slabs.This is a terrific introductory class to working with clay, no prior experience is required. The pottery wheel is not used in this class as it requires more than one class to complete work. All pieces you make will be ready for pick up in about three weeks after the event.

For more info & tickets: https://goo.gl/9D3wGW
results.name: Couples Pottery Night at Mugi!

results.description:
If you're like most people, attraction is the missing piece to your dating life. It's one thing to have nice conversations, or to collect phone numbers, or even to go out on dates with people you like.

But without real sexual attraction, your results will be mixed at best.

How do you generate attraction? That's the topic of my talk.

I'll go over major points like:

*Communicating in a more attractive and sexually enticing way

*How your body language, fashion choices and fitness level impact your desirability

*Where attraction comes from, why two people who are otherwise the same can get very different reactions from the opposite sex

*And more...

Location:

Ripley-Grier Studios

520 Eighth Ave

Room 16P

See you there!

Justin

http://JustinAttraction.com

http://NaturalAttractionNYC.com

results.description:
Music Makers “Reserved”  jam sessions are a unique opportunity to get together for the enjoyment of playing music in a group setting.  We offer 5 to 7 jam room, each with a playing level, style of music and a Music Makers Jam Coordinator leading the way.  Each jam session accommodates 1 to 2 vocals, 3 guitars, 1 keyboard player, 1 bass, 1 drummer, percussion, miscellaneous wind instruments.  Jam sessions can include a combination of some or all of the listed instruments.  Every jam room has a limited number of participants, your slot is guaranteed, no instrument rotation therefore advance registration is required. If you'd like to register you can do so via our website, please click here for registration.

Music Makers extensive library of easy to follow charts make it easy for all level players to participate. Please click here to view a list of some of the songs you will find in our library.  You do not need to read music to participate in our jams .

Our jams are held in our professionally equipped studios conveniently located around the corner from Madison Square Garden at 251 West 30th Street, 3rd floor, Suite 3rw (btwn 7th & 8th Ave).   Please visit our website to learn about all of our events for recreational musicians.   Should you have any questions, please feel free to email [masked] or give us a call at[masked]-7054.

We welcome you to come join us.
results.how_to_find_us: 251 West 30th Street, 3rd floor, Suite 3RW, (btwn 7th & 8th Ave)
results.name: Rock & Blues Reserved Jam Sessions

3) Due to strict venue rules, no funds (cash or credit) can be accepted on site. Please purchase your seat in advance via one of the above methods.

4) The names of all attendees will be on a list at the door. There are no physical tickets.

5) Purchase deadline is 5:30 pm on the day of the concert or when the venue capacity is reached.

6) Please note the price increase on February 19. Securing your seat as early as possible is recommended.

7) RSVP without payment does NOT reserve your spot or lock in the price.

8) Sorry, refunds and exchanges are not available (unless the event is cancelled).  However, if you are unable to attend, you can send someone in your place. At check-in, simply have him or her mention the name under which you paid.


POST-CONCERT MEETING:

If there is interest, we will go someplace nearby for food, drinks and socializing.


See you there!

Milton

If you're like most people, attraction is the missing piece to your dating life. It's one thing to have nice conversations, or to collect phone numbers, or even to go out on dates with people you like.

But without real sexual attraction, your results will be mixed at best.

How do you generate attraction? That's the topic of my talk.

I'll go over major points like:

*Communicating in a more attractive and sexually enticing way

*How your body language, fashion choices and fitness level impact your desirability

*Where attraction comes from, why two people who are otherwise the same can get very different reactions from the opposite sex

*And more...

results.description:
Prudential Center to Welcome Comedy Legends for "The Comedy Get Down" on February 20

Through numerous motion picture appearances, countless television shows, sitcoms and standup specials, a talk show, three radio shows, and two books, Cedric ‘The Entertainer’, Eddie Griffin, D.L. Hughley, George Lopez and Charlie Murphy have been breaking ground in the comedy business and bringing the laughs for decades. The five popular entertainers will team up for “The Comedy Get Down,” taking the stage at Newark’s Prudential Center for the first time on Saturday, February 20 at 8 p.m.

Cedric "The Entertainer" is best known for crowd-pleasing performances in hit films such as Barbershop, Be Cool, The Original Kings of Comedy and the top-ranking Madagascar animated franchise, just to name a few. Cedric will be seen next on the big screen‎ in the much-anticipated comedy feature BARBERSHOP 3 slated for release in early 2016. He is executive producer and stars in the current hit comedy series THE SOUL MAN on TV Land. Cedric also stars in the buzzed about new reality series, CEDRIC'S BARBER BATTLE, which debuted on THE CW on June 29.

Eddie Griffin has received worldwide recognition through his numerous stand-up comedy specials, movies, television appearances, and music and comedy albums for not only acting, but writing and producing as well. Most notably, Def Comedy Jam, HBO One Night Stand, Malcolm & Eddie, for which he won the NAACP Image Award for Best Actor in a Comedy Series award, Undercover Brother, My Baby's Daddy, Dysfunktional Family, Norbit, Freedom Of Speech, A Fool And His Money Play, You Can Tell Em' I Said It and soon to be released Mucho Dinero and An American Hero. Comedy Central also honored Eddie as one of the Top 100 Greatest Stand-Up Comedians of all time.

D.L. Hughley, star of his namesake ABC television show The Hughleys, is also well known as one of the standout comedians on the hit comedy tour and docu-film The Original Kings of Comedy. D.L. can currently be heard nationwide as host of his own nationally syndicated afternoon radio show “The DL Hughley Show,” heard in over 60 markets across the country. Known for being astute and politically savvy in true comedian style, Hughley is a published author and was honored with a prestigious Peabody Award for his satirical documentary special D.L. Hughley: The Endangered List. He appeared in the TV drama Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip and will next star in the upcoming NBC drama Heartbreakers. D.L. is currently starring in his ninth stand-up comedy special Clear.  

George Lopez is a multi-talented entertainer whose career encompasses television, film, standup comedy and late-night television. Lopez hosted Lopez Tonight, a late-night television talk show on TBS for two seasons and starred in television’s groundbreaking hit sitcom George Lopez, which ran for six seasons on ABC. Lopez has risen to become one of the premier comedic talents in the entertainment industry known for his extensive charity work with various foundations. 

Charlie Murphy became a household name as a cast member of Chappelle’s Show when he recanted his True Hollywood Stories of celebrity and excess, however, he has spent the past two decades solidifying his position in Hollywood as a true acting and writing talent. He’s appeared in Lottery Ticket with Bow Wow and Ice Cube, Our Family Wedding with Forrest Whitaker and The Perfect Holiday with Queen Latifah and Terrence Howard. Charlie wrote cult classics like Vampire In Brooklyn and Norbit, and stars as ‘Vic’ in Adult Swim’s Black Jesus, currently in production on Season 2.
