results.description:
Lets' add a little "Arts & Entertainment" to the weekend!

MUSTANG
Year: 2015
Country: Turkey/France/Qatar/GermanyGenre: Foreign
                                            


</a>Five free-spirited sisters live with their grandparents in rural Turkey. After an innocent romp with boys on the beach, violating the harsh strictures of their society, they are imprisoned in the house. Instead of lessons at school, there are “wife lessons,” bars on the windows, and meetings with prospective husbands. The girls manage to sneak away, but the walls close in. Ultimately, their heroism lies simply in being themselves and in making noise against the confines of their culture. 2015, Turkey/France/Qatar/Germany, 97 minutes, in Turkish with English sub-titles

Official entry from France to the 2016 Academy Awards.

“It’s a moving portrait of sisterhood, a celebration of a fierce femininity and a damning indictment of patriarchal systems that seek to destroy and control this spirit.” – Katie Walsh, Los Angeles Times

“The story’s quiet power comes from its sensitive observation of the characters as normal, emancipated young modern women, with healthy desires and curiosities, whose supposed transgressions are imagined and then magnified in the judgmental minds of others.” –David Rooney, Hollywood Reporter

“Mustang is the début feature of Deniz Gamze Ergüven, and it’s quite something: a coming-of-age fable mapped onto a prison break, at once dream-hazed and sharp-edged with suspense.” – Anthony Lane, The New Yorker

- See more at: <a href="http://www.rivertownfilm.org/films/mustang/#sthash.KSJ7t7qN.dpuf">http://www.rivertownfilm.org/films/mustang/#sthash.KSJ7t7qN.dpuf

Buy tickets at door, or call[masked] or on line at http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2476564


If you wait to get your tickets at the door there is no guarantee they will not be sold out so you may want to call ahead to check. 

On Line: Rivertown Member-Senior or Member-Student $8, w fee $9.27

Rivertown Member Adult $9, w/ fee $10.31

General Public $12, w fee $13.41

Homemade delicacies and refreshments are usually available for purchase as are some trinkets and treasures!  A percentage of these sales goes to the Rivertown Film organization.


Meet us by the front doors of the Nyack center (corner of Broadway & Depew) BETWEEN 7:30-7:45 weather permitting or inside front doors.  Afterwards find us seated. EVERYONE IS WELCOME, NOT FOR SINGLES ONLY!


The MOVIE STARTS at 8:00. Come early to meet everyone and if you want to sit together. 

There is metered parking, near the center and free parking is also available, at several locations, such as on Depew, pass the Nyack center, or after turning rt, on Depew, take the next left and park behind the post office, or take Rt 59 (Main st) cross over Broadway and take the next left into a small street, where there is free parking. Metered parking during the weekdays is 11am- 6pm, then starts again at 11pm-6am. For more info go to: www.rivertownfilm.org or call[masked]-2568. Always check the day of an event, for any changes.

FOR DIRECTIONS TO THE NYACK CENTER SCROLL DOWN:

Directions

The Nyack Center is on the NW corner of Broadway and Depew Avenue, just north of the Nyack Post Office and Nyack Library. There is parking on surrounding streets (some streets have metered parking) and in a large metered parking lot two blocks away. Nyack parking meters are in effect 11:00 AM to 6:00 PM and 11:00 PM to 6:00 AM, Monday through Saturday. Parking is 75 cents per hour.

Driving from the east (Westchester) on the NY State Thruway

• Driving north on the NY State Thruway, take exit 11, the second exit after the Tappan Zee Bridge.
• The off ramp will end at a stop sign.
• Continue straight to a stop light at Route 9W.
• Make a right turn onto Route 9W.
• At the next traffic light turn left onto Main Street.
• Go down hill toward the Hudson River.
• At the third traffic light turn right onto South Broadway.
• The Nyack Center is at the next stoplight, Depew Ave, on the right.

Driving from the north (Orange) on the NY State Thruway or north (New Jersey) or South on the Palisades Parkway

• Driving South on the NY Thruway, take Exit 11
• From the Palisades Parkway, take Exit 9E to the NY State Thruway,
to Exit 11.
• Turn left onto Route 59.
• Route 59 becomes Main Street.
• Proceed down hill toward the Hudson River.
• At the third traffic light turn right onto South Broadway.
• The Nyack Center is at next stoplight, at the corner of Depew Avenue, on the right.

- See more at: http://www.rivertownfilm.org/directions/#sthash.v8sG830T.dpuf

results.description:
Donna Hunt will call a firey program of contras accompanied by the red hot 13th Street Demons! They are: 

Audrey Knuth on fiddle (of the Free Raisins), Ross Harriss on sax and guitar (of Last Exit), and Dave Cory on mandolin and banjo

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

Contra dance is a high energy American folk dance accompanied by live string music and taught by a caller.  No partner or experience required.  All dances are taught in advance and the figures are easy to learn.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the ACE, 1,2,3, L or F train to 14th St. We are on the northwest corner of 13th Street and 7th Avenue. Street address is 201 W. 13th.
results.name: Contra Dance with Donna Hunt and the 13th Street Demons!

Hi everyone!  Let's get drinks and see a live band in Morristown!  YES, it is my boyfriend's band, but I swear they're really good ;)  The singer has been compared to Adele, and all of the band members are current/former music teachers, so it's a very high quality show.  And they play anything from Janis Joplin to Meghan Trainor to Hanson.


I'm thinking we can get drinks beforehand (around 8) at Jockey Hollow.  Never been there, but seems nice and classy.  Address is 110 South Street.

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and over 15 of their partner social and singles groups. The number of RSVP listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually  attending.  If you have any questions, please contact the event organizer at [masked].

This event features the best elements of a Match Live Event, Speed Dating and an Ice Breaker Night.  Join over 150 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss. The World Bar has a cozy atmosphere that is casual, comfortable and relaxed so you can interact with others at the party without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene.  We will have games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people there in a fun, friendly and flirty way.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

-Drink specials till 9pm

-3 separate Ice Breaker games with prizes

-Complimentary Appetizers 8-9pm

-Music played at conversational levels.  Music is all in the background.  There will be no dancing (unless you want to!)

Can I come alone?Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You may also bring a non single wing person who will be identified by pairs of wings.

What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.

Dress code: No need for jackets or cocktail dresses but Keep it neat.

Admission:  $20  at the door.

group.name: I wanted to do that...Just not alone!!

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.
results.name: Music Open Jam @ Funkadelic Studios

group.name: Long Island + NYC Speed Dating to Meet New Singles

results.description:
Club 412's "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party

"Club 412" has three rooms of music (Hustle Room/WCSwing Room & Mixed Ballroom/Latin Room), great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at with the 8pm Pre-Party Dance Lesson or Mixed Social Dancing in an adjacent room. Then the DJ's take over at 9p and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

Hey you NEWBIES to dancing, come on down! The Pre-Party Class is your launch pad to an evening of FUN. It's a great opportunity to meet new people and expand your dancing skills.

For you EXPERIENCED DANCERS, there will be plenty of partners of all levels! People from Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut all flock to this event. There will be over 150 people, READY TO DANCE the night away.

Club 412 is located at 412 8th Ave, at 31st St., 4th floor
(1 block South of Penn Station/MSG)
$15 Admission includes pre-party class 8-9p.

*To enter building, Press 6 then 'CALL' on the intercom*
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be in the Mixed Ballroom Room dancing and greeting.
results.name: "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party at Club 412

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and over 15 of their partner social and singles groups. The number of RSVP listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually  attending.  If you have any questions, please contact the event organizer at [masked].

This event features the best elements of a Match Live Event, Speed Dating and an Ice Breaker Night.  Join over 150 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss. The World Bar has a cozy atmosphere that is casual, comfortable and relaxed so you can interact with others at the party without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene.  We will have games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people there in a fun, friendly and flirty way.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

-Drink specials till 9pm

-3 separate Ice Breaker games with prizes

-Complimentary Appetizers 8-9pm

-Music played at conversational levels.  Music is all in the background.  There will be no dancing (unless you want to!)

Can I come alone?Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You may also bring a non single wing person who will be identified by pairs of wings.

What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.

Dress code: No need for jackets or cocktail dresses but Keep it neat.

Admission:  $20  at the door.
results.name: Singles Mix Match & Mingle: NYC's Most Organized & Fun Singles Party

$15 prepay only

Pre-Pay here https://nysnmixmatch.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

This event is a combination of a Match Live event and Speed Dating.  Join over 100 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and number..

-You will also be given a sheet where you can keep track of everyone you meet.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night write down the names and the numbers of the people that you met and would like to see again.  You will then hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

-Drink specials -Ice Breaker games with prizes -Full menu is available -Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You may also bring a non single wing person who will be identified by pairs of wings.

What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

results.description:
NYC Lesbian Speeddaters: I've been asked by many members to bring back "YOU had me at HELLO ! Name Tag Party" ! It's a party to meet Single Amazing and Beautiful women like you ! But... guess what ?? Here's the TWIST--> One lucky lady will be wearing YOUR name tag and you need to find out WHO it is ! A funny-laugh out loud ice-breaker ! Single Women meet Single Women. 

And what better way than to introduce yourself by your: Name. It defines you and it's what people remember most ! It's a great feeling when someone new remembers your name ! 

Give a SHOUT OUT and say HELLO to a beautiful stranger... cause ya never know !! All it takes is just ONE HELLO... to change it all. 

<a>SATURDAY FEBRUARY 20TH 8PM</a> @ "THE PARK" <a>118 10th Ave</a> NY

**We will meet at the entrance by the bar/fireplace** 


**NOT a Speed dating**

Facebook Invite: https://www.facebook.com/events/1492812401026170/

Sunny

results.description:
Let's head back to Elements and do some Dancing!


************************   IMPORTANT   ***********************

I never thought that I would be saying this, but.....I do not recommend wearing any type of stiletto style of shoes with small heels being that the floor at Elements has half inch gaps.

But feel free to wear your stilettos everywhere else, thanks. *_*

***************************************************************


And feel free to get there early for something to eat downstairs.


Elements is a very trendy "Manhattan-esque" type bar.
We'll be dancing to The House DJ



There will be many other Meetup Groups joining us also

ALL ARE WELCOME, FEEL FREE TO INVITE FRIENDS!

And as always, please take care of the wait staff, thanks.


Looking forward to seeing everyone!

Bob

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Beautiful Turf Field - Friendly but competitive game. 

RSVP's open 6 Days before the Meetup at 8:00pm - Trying something new.


Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.

MultiGroup Event!

I would like to formally invite you to the Anniversary Party Of The NJ Friends & Singles Group And The NJ Salsa Dance Meetup Group!

We will be celebrating at the Beautiful Pure Lounge In Parsippany NJ. We'll be doing a meet & greet, lesson, and have a live DJ during the evening.

Doors Open At 8pm.

$5 Cover Til 10pm. May Be Higher Afterwards.


Admission Includes:

* Wristband To Get Reduced Pricing On Food/Drinks (Good Til 10pm)

* Access To Private Room As Well As Lounge & Dance Floor Area

* Dance Lesson At 9pm

* DJ Mixing Latin, Top 40, & More


Specials: $4 Beers, $5 Sangria, $6 Martinis & Select App Specials Ordered From The Bar.

If Your Having A Sit Down Dinner In The Dining Room You Will Receive 25% Off On Food Only. Show Your Wristband. Valid From 8pm To 10pm Only.

DJ Mix Of Latin Classics, Top 40, and more upbeat dance music to get you moving and grooving starting at about 10pm.

Free Parking In There Huge Lot.

Multiple Meetup Groups Will Be In Attendance.

Pure Lounge Is Located Off Route 46 East In Parsippany NJ.

results.description:
This Saturday should be a relatively warmer night. Weather permitting, we will meet by the entrance for Brooklyn Bridge Park (by the side of the "Ice cream factory" in 1 water street, Brooklyn, NY). to take long exposures of Manhattan Skyline, and to teach beginner photogs tips and techniques of long exposures.

The event will start at 9:30pm sharp.

Make sure you arrive on time and allow yourself enough time for traffic and transportation.

We will begin by moving together into the Brooklyn Bridge Park, set our equipment and start taking photos for about 2 hours.

Make sure you bring:

• A jacket and appropriate cloth: in case the weather becomes chilly.

• A DSLR (or mirroless) camera that can take pictures in Manual mode and allows you to set the time -shutter speed- of the photos.

• A tripod: required for taking long exposures unless blurry images are your style (please just bring it)

• Enough memory cards and fully-charged batteries)

• Remote, or shutter release cable (optional, unless you want to take photos that are more than 30seconds long).

Important rules:

• Arrive on time, as we will move to another spot after the gathering. You probably don't walk alone with your expensive equipment anyway.

• FOR YOUR SAFETY: DO NOT WANDER AROUND IN THE DARK BY YOURSELF WITH YOUR EXPENSIVE EQUIPMENT!  ALWAYS WALK WITH SOMEONE OR A SMALL GROUP!!!!

• If you have any questions, please feel free to send me messages to my inbox, or start a discussion in the comments section for this event.

• Disclaimer: Participation in these events requires that you assume all risks associated with these activities, and that the Organizer(s) and Event Hosts are in no way liable for any loss or injury as a result of your participation. In other words, you are attending these events at your own risk!!

results.description:

DESI SATURDAYS 

Presents 

BOLLYWOOD BEATS 

At New York City’s Mega Nightclub & Lounge 
L E X I C O N 
226 East 54th Street. NYC 

Special Guest : Featuring Delhi's Finest DJ AMIT 
Lexicon Resident : DJ HARSH 
Dhol Percussions By : RAVI BINDRA 

SPONSORED VIP OPEN BAR 9:30-10:30PM 
LADIES COMPLIMENTARY ADMISSION TIL 10:30PM 

Dress Code: Fashion Forward & Chic 
Strictly No T-shirts, No Boots, No sneakers. 
21 & Over - Proper ID Required For Admission 

For RSVP : www.DesiSaturdays.com 
For Large Groups :[masked]

Desi Saturdays is one high society DesiParty. Wow factor everywhere. Beautiful people, beautiful venue, beautiful ambiance, and did we mention beautiful people? High energy, amazing music and a packed house are just some of the traits of what you would expect at this weekly desiparty. 

This event is the talk of the town amongst young socialites. It's so exclusive it only takes place on Saturday Nights, and don't even try to dress down, because it is almost impossible to get in, but more importantly you would feel so out of place. So don your best, and you may just be lucky enough to party out on Saturdays Nights at Lexicon!!

results.description:
CASA DO SEMBA IS BACK SATURDAY FEB 20th
HOSTED by DAVID CAMPOS & GUIDA REI


DJ David Campos & Deejay Leo (NJKIZ) and TBOY peleve (FRANCE)


KIZOMBA, SEMBA, GHETTO ZOUK, ZOUK, TARRAXINHA, AND AFROHOUSE, with a Touch of Salsa and Bachata for our Latin dancers !!


10PM to 4AM


10pm - INTRO TO SEMBA CLASS BY David Campos11pm to 4am - PARTY


===========================================================

❀❀❀ SPECIAL AMATEUR KIZOMBA & SEMBA DANCE CONTEST ❀❀❀


Participation : $25/person
- 1st place winner get 70% of the jackpot
- 2nd place winner get 30% of the jackpot


For more info and subscription : [masked]

Date limit of subscription : February 15th 2016


Contest information :

This as a total and friendly contest.. Remember that the goal of this contest is just to have... FUN !!! No pressure required !!!!


There will be 2 rounds : 1 Kizomba, and 1 Semba (3mn each), chosen randomly . For the Kizomba, the participants will be able to chose just before their presentation between Kizomba, tarraxa, or Ghetto Zouk. The music will be selected in a range of beat rate : Between 90-95 Bpm for Kizomba and 110 -125 Bpm for the Semba.

The jury constituted by 4 persons chosen randomly amongst volunteer at the beginning of the night will be presided by TBOY. The criteria are, Technique (35pts), musicality (30pts), creativity (20pts), space occupation (10Pts), and presentation (5pts)


The participation fee is $25/pers ($50 couple). The amount collected, after deduction of $10/person (for the space hosting the event), will be split this way : 70% for the 1st place and 30% for the 2nd place.. All participant will receive a free pass for the next CASA DO SEMBA.


Please feel free to contact me if you have any more questions. And again let s just have fun !!!! ===========================================================


LOCATION : DISTRICT SOCIAL 252 WEST 37TH STNEW YORK, NY, 10018[7TH & 8TH AVENUE]


*** PRIVATE ENTRANCE DOWNSTAIRS AT THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE MAIN DOOR *** DRESS TO IMPRESS **** VALID ID REQUIRED ****


➽ $15 ( $10 for Tboy workshops attendees )


*** 1 DRINK or FOOD MINIMUM / PERS REQUIRED ***


Contact info :DAVID CAMPOS -[masked][masked]

I saw this meetup event and thought it would be fun if the ladies in the group went together: http://www.meetup.com/bestclubsinnyc/events/228781762/  

It's free ladies' night at Skyroom through Mike K's group BEST CLUBS in NYC. I've never been, but it sounds like fun! Guys can come too! (They'll just have to pay $20 --sorry). I've already RSVPed to the event and said a few others would be coming. 

Doors Open 10pm and it is located on 330 W 40th Street near 8th Avenue. Feel free to suggest meet up places beforehand for drinks, etc.

Music: hip-hop ,Top 40 & house

Dress code: no jeans, think business casual - I've never been here, but I'm planning to wear black pants, heels, and a nice top (hopefully that's good enough!)

Information about Sky Room:  http://skyroomnyc.com/
Message me if you have questions!

results.description:
https://www.facebook.com/events/1650216838577716/1651223421810391/
We are proud to announce a new party in Bushwick debuting at the Bushwick Public House. We believe that NYC needs a new party focused on blending and pushing the boundaries of Global Bass: Trappy trilly twerky funky tropical, Moombah, Zouk, Kuduro, Miami Bass, Jersey Club, Grime / UK Funky, Brega, Funkero...and list grows with every new dj set we do. It grows as we engage in uncovering our own identity within the style, our own source. Welcome to Paradigm. *** DJ Lineup ***

Dope Tendencies
This kid has been making waves. Dope Tendencies is the alias of 24 year old Daniel Maurrasse out of NY. Known for his Moombah, Trap, and Dubstep. He has been taking the scene by storm with heavy hitting bangers, that retain a sense of melody. Playing shows all over the US, and receiving support from one of his inspirations (I see you Munchi). Dope Tendencies is about to blow! Enjoy the fireworks!

https://soundcloud.com/dopetendencies


Vermillion Bird
Argentinian native producer/DJ based in Brooklyn, NY. Her music has been featured on Generation Bass, Moombah+ and others. Her sound is characterized by global/tropical influences mixed with creative, melodic twists. In the last few years she has been involved in the NYC electronic music scene as well as in the international Moombahton movement.

https://soundcloud.com/vermilionbirdofficial

Rasta-4 Eyes
Ukrainian-born deep American South-raised DJ / Producer Rasta 4-Eyes. His sets are steeped in new global culture hybrids with acoustic instrument / MC accompaniment. From the obscene to the sacred. Soul, Funk, Afrobeat, Instrumental Hip-Hop, Roots Reggae / new and old Dub, Twerk / Trap, Gypsy / Indian / Arabic, Tropical Bass, EDM Bass.

https://soundcloud.com/rasta_four_eyes

Catnip
With roots in the 90s rave movement, this DJ has been involved in the underground electronic scene for decades. His versatile style fluctuates from funky and upbeat to psychedelic. He currently DJs at parties in Brooklyn, NY. https://www.mixcloud.com/catnipNYC/

21+
$5 cover+ 1 free drink

group.name: * New York COOL Spot Hopping * World  Foods, Drinks & Music

results.description:
Hey guys I saw this class online and it looks really cool! I would love to make some awesome gold jewelry, anyone want to join? 

Gold has captivated artisans – and wearers! – from its first discovery dating back to 5,600BC. It is an extremely soft metal – so ductile that an ounce can be stretched for miles into thread fine enough for embroidery and malleable enough to be hammered into a transparent sheet!

Create stunning earrings or a ring in this fun weekend workshop! You can choose to add a gem to your work as well. We will be working in Yellow 14 karat Gold – handcrafting the rings, earring wires and the bezels in this two day weekend workshop.

For more info & tickets: https://goo.gl/zUkEb8
results.name: Gold Jewelry Workshop (Saturday + Sunday)

results.description: Okay, so after I get my laugh on, who wants to go straight home? Not me! So, if we, as a group, cannot come up with an idea, this is something to check out locally.

results.description:
Hey Fam let's go skiing!! A lot of people have expressed a desire to learn and get more time on the slopes so I'm stoked about this trip and I better see you on the mountain. Bring your friends too!


Windham mountain is one of my favorites, great for beginners, intermediates and pros. It's only ~2 hours from NY, has nice lush snow and also offers good food, a ski shop etc.

Windham Mountain, in New York’s beautiful Catskill Mountains offers the most skiing and riding you’ll find within 200 miles of NYC. Skiers and riders can find 285 skiable acres and 54 trails over two peaks, 6 terrain parks and 12 lifts. Trail Map Link

Purchase Tickets Here: BpLoveOutdoors Feb 21st Windham Tickets


RSVP is not confirmed until payment is received. Best pay early!

Ski/ Snowboard Packages:
1. Bus & All Mtn Lift ($99.00)
2. Bus, All Mtn Lift, & Rental ($134.00)
3. Bus, All Mtn Lift, (Rental & Lesson) ($169.00)
4. Bus,Beginner area (lower mountain lifts), Lesson & Rental Package ($129.00)
**Recommended for newbies! Option to upgrade (#4) to All Mountain Lift Ticket after 1 pm for $23** (Payable at mountain)
5. Bus & Equipt Rental ($94.00)
6. Bus Only ($49.00)  
7. Not listed. If you want to drive yourself which I personally don't recommend because you miss the bonding time, sleep/rest and laughs... you'll need to get your ticket from the mountain.

Trip Details: Please arrive 30 minutes early for bus.
Mountain departure time: 4:30PM
Transportation: Coach bus (Relax & be comfortable there & back)
Amenities: Music, bathroom, movies & some drinks.


Pickup Location and times:
1. (6:30 AM) Downtown Brooklyn/Barclay vicinity
Atlantic Ave. & 3rd Avenue
514 Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn New, York 11217 (map)
* In front of Rent Ride Return store *

2. (6:45 AM) Union Square - Manhattan
14th Street & 3rd Avenue
129 3rd Avenue, New York, New York 10003 (map)
* In front of Duane Reade *

3. (7:00 AM) Upper West Side - Manhattan
Amsterdam Ave. and 72 St.
2086 Broadway, New York, NY 10023 (map)
* In front of The Vitamin Shoppe *

Notes:
1. When you board the bus come to the back! More than likely we will all be on the same bus. The bus is not a charter but we will try to keep our group to the back of the bus.
2. This trip is at cost to everyone so I'm not acting as a babysitter...Just putting it out there, God knows I don tried. (Read the info, do a little bit of research, and come with a positive attitude).
3. While we don't anticipate any issues, note that you are participating in this activity at your own risk and liability.

Common Questions/ Complaints

1. I'll be cold - No you'll more than likely be sweating after you start moving.

2. I can't do it - There's 3 years olds & Grannies on the mountain. Signup for a lesson!

3. Black Ppl don't ski - Well maybe you should stay home then.

4. I have work Monday - The bus returns very early to NY, You'll have too much time on your hands! 

5. I don't know anyone, don't wanna come alone or I'll get kidnapped - Really?! A. No one want's to kidnap your ass B. Most ppl come alone..that's the point. This group is about breaking outside your comfort zone & being great :-)

Come Through Fam!! Let's Live a little

Possible Dinner or Drinks if we're up to it later.

Important Tips:
1. Start working on your squats/ Legs. 
2. Wear Proper ski pants. And a proper jacket (Marshalls, Models, REI)
3. Purchase Ski goggles ~$20 @ a Sports store (More $ @ the mountain).
4. Wear Thermals under your ski pants and coat.
5. Wear proper weatherproof gloves!!
6. A long hat or face mask is recommended.
7. Thick Socks
8. I will have some hand and leg warmers for sale on the bus. ($3 for the set/$1.50ea)

9. Bring Snacks banana etc - food is a bit pricey at the mountain.

www.facebook.com/BpLoveOutdoors (Chat with the group on fb)

Refunds:
Cancellations must be made at least 72 hours before your trip departure time in order to receive a full refund. Cancellations made up to 48 hours before your trip departure time will receive a 50% refund. Cancellations made within 48 hours or your trip departure time will receive no refund. No refunds will be issued for missed buses. See nycsnowbus/ terms for more info.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

group.name: NYC PICKUP SOCCER (MANHATTAN CO-ED SOCCER GROUP)

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.name: Club Meeting 5

results.description:
Note details on this trip regarding public trans may change, be sure to double check the week of the event.

Join us for this, the second hike in the September 11th National Memorial Trail series. The main trail route uses the water taxi, but alternates exist where the entire thing can be walked. For this hike, we will meet in NY Penn Station and take the subway north from 34th Street Station under 8th Avenue to 175th Street.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-prn2/v/t1.0-9/1236927_634249753261725_392018949_n.jpg?oh=a25b2245a26d9edc440254991a25fc6c&oe=5705E918


The hike will take us from the subway station up and across the George Washington Bridge into New Jersey. The bridge offers unparalleled views of the Hudson River down toward the city, a site everyone simply must see. We then follow the waterfront heading south.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xap1/v/t1.0-9/11737991_924030524300153_7944947061695539532_n.jpg?oh=e9dc4cc29e73daf7ecb3db5d8970816c&oe=56D7E2AB

The route will take us on a few back roads, including through a section of strip mall, but for the most part we will be on continuous waterfront walkways.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfa1/v/t1.0-9/1923160_73136956776_8241083_n.jpg?oh=6d3750a007bf0138d6202b1fdb76adb6&oe=57175C5D

There are constant amazing views of the waterfront as we head south. Unlike the NY side, the NJ side has many back and forth sections on piers and docks that can be cut short if need be.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xap1/v/t1.0-9/264666_10150241114181777_6911092_n.jpg?oh=0d04dfd2b6412c4f988bec8eb334837c&oe=57127CE3

It's also very interesting in that the kinds of walkways we will be on differ from place to place. There is no consistency with how exactly the Hudson River Waterfront Walkway looks, and that adds to the interest of the whole thing.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xaf1/v/t1.0-9/263874_10150241113796777_3985674_n.jpg?oh=d9767442e1a84160b080256bdddfe4e8&oe=570B61F3

There should also be places to purchase food along the entire way, so it won't be as necessary to carry extra food or water. Just be aware that there will likely be a large group, and stopping at one place can take a very long time with a lot of people.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfa1/v/t1.0-9/263846_10150241113671777_1231503_n.jpg?oh=77e5846e9e758083df1d1af21a667b61&oe=570BEFD2

The following section of my NJ Perimeter hike guide details the section between Hoboken Station and the George Washington Bridge vicinity. You may use this guide, oriented in opposite direction, for this hike.


56.20 Hudson River Waterfront Walkway enters area of Hoboken Station. Metrotrails has not scouted this entire newer section yet. More detail needed.
The pathway skirts the light rail station terminus, then makes it's way around and through Hoboken Station.
56.50 Reach road on the other side, Hudson Place at the old Lackawanna Railroad terminal.
Continue north through Erie Lackawanna Park. Reach waterfront and turn left, then right passing Sam Sloan statue parallel with Sinatra Drive. Post office is on the left. Turn right out onto another pier area and skirt it's outside. This is called Pier A Park. It is possible to skip this along Sinatra Drive.
56.90 End of the pier. Continue north along the walkway.
57.04 Near 3rd Avenue, turn right onto a curving bridge into Pier C Park, an abstract looking island park.
57.08 Turn right on the island and skirt the right side
57.17 A small pier juts out onto the Hudson to the right. Turn left and cross a bridge back to the waterfront walkway.
57.22 Turn right on the walkway north and pass the Hoboken World War II Memorial. Stevens Park is across the street to the left.
57.25 The pathway enters an open amphitheater and enters Sinatra Park. Continue along the water. The pathway is supposed to go around Sinatra Park, but may be redeveloped due to storm damage or improvment/repair. Continue around the ball field area and return to the road. It may be necessary to continue north on Frank Sinatra Drive.
57.60 Frank Sinatra Drive and the HRW Walkway are right next to each other along the water.
57.70 A dock extends to the right of the trail. To the left of here is Sybil's Cave, in the past and once again a tourist attraction along the Palisade Cliffs. It is also in this area that the Palisades become more pronounced. The formation, made of igneus intrusive basalt, extends from NY west of High Tor south into NJ and Bayonne, where it is known as Bergen Hill.
Just ahead, a piece of the walkway extends and stops parallel with the Castle Point Skate Park. It is necessary to turn onto Frank Sinatra Drive and head north along the road here. The area to the right of the road is actively used industrially.
57.92 Turn right on Sinatra Drive North briefly, across from the lawn at Maxwell Place, then immediaetely right on the walkway. The walkway will skirt the perimeter of Maxwell Place Park.
58.20 The walkway nears to Sinatra Drive North again. There is a new public pier off to the right.
Continue north with Hoboken Ship Yard to the right.
58.30 Ship Yard Dog Run is on the right.
58.40 Hoboken 14th Street Pier, now a public park, is on the right with fantastic views at the end.
Continue north.
58.46 Abandoned pier on the right. The pathway turns to the left.
58.51 Bernard McFeely Shipyard Lane. Turn right here on the sidewalk, then at 58.55 turn right again along the walkway beside a building.
58.60 Turn left, heading west along the walkway
58.76 Harborside Park is on the left. The walkway turns right, heading north once again along the Hudson.
58.82 Square overlook area to the right. The pathway once again turns left heading inland a bit, then right to the north.
58.92 Walkway turns right
58.97 Now out on the water, the walkway turns left again, north.
59.03 Path intersection. A little park extends to the right along Harbor Blvd. The walkway turns right.
59.10 Large parking area to the right. Continue along the waterfront, east at first, then north.
59.28 Lincoln Harbor and ferry along the right of the walkway. Continue north. Giant condos extend out onto the water to the right.
59.33 Just beyond the condos, giant boat area in Lincoln Harbor is passed on the right.
59.50 Parking lot pier to the right. Continue north. Harbor Blvd turns off to the left.
59.63 Turn left heading west again. Head all the way out to Port Imperial Blvd.
59.72 Turn right on Port Imperial Blvd sidewalk.
59.78 Turn right into Weehawken Waterfront Park and Recreation Center. Keep to the sidewalk on the right hand side of the lot.
59.85 Reach a paved pathway that turns right away from the sidewalk and follow it. Keep to the right.
59.93 Back along the Hudson River, continue north on the walkway within the park.
60.15 The walkway leaves Weehawken Waterfront Park. Continue ahead remaining on the waterfront. Trail parallels Henley Place.
60.27 Reach the intersection with Cambridge Way off to the left. It was just up hill, within view, beyond this point where Aaron Burr and Alexander Hamilton had their famous duel that mortally wounded Hamilton.
60.37 The pathway turns left again, then soon turns right continuing north with apartment buildings off to the left.
60.50 Access path between buildings comes in from left.
60.56 The walkway turns hard to the right and then left.
60.60 Reach Carlyl Court. The pathway crosses here, then diagonally crosses Pershing Park before resuming along the Hudson. Boats docked to the right.
60.78 Pass a memorial that look like standing tuning forks. The pathway zig zags back and forth on the waterfront as it has.
61.16 Pass Port Imperial ferry terminal on the right. Continue along the Hudson.
61.25 The walkway turns ninety degrees to the right
61.31 The walkway turns ninety degrees to the left with parking area to left.
61.42 Access path between apartment buildings to left.
61.57 Abandoned pier to the right
61.63 Walkway turns ninety degrees right
61.68 Walways turns ninety degrees left at Riverwalk Place with circular patterned walkway to the left next to buildings.
61.83 Walway turns ninety degrees to the right, then to the left again. In the area ahead, there is an old pier stuck to the right. This was not here when we first scouted it, so it must have broken off of another location and floated here during a storm.
62.06 An abandoned wooden pier is off to the right, closed to public (I managed to get out to the end of it years ago, before it was in such a bad state of repair).
62.14 Small abandoned pier to right.
62.25 The walkway crosses a bridge over a basin. Continue north.
62.33 Cross another bridge over a basin.
62.48 The walkway turns ninety degrees left in a section with shrubs planted in it.
62.58 Reach River Road and turn right on the sidewalk.
62.67 Turn right back along the HRWF Walkway.
62.75 Side path to the right and viewing area. The trail continues north on the waterfront.
62.87 Turn right on paved pathway with a parking lot to the left. This is Palisades Medical Center.
63.12 The walkway turns ninety degrees left after Medical CCenter area. The pathway soon disappears. Continue past a building.
63.21 Turn left to Marine Road, then right immediately onto the walkway north.
63.31 The walkway extends along the water ahead, but soon dead ends. Check it out, but then return to here, to a paved path that departs to the left. Follow it to Riverview Circle, then continue straight toward Roc Harbour Drive.
63.38 Reach Roc Harbour Drive. Cross, and follow a path on the other side which will lead to the waterfront walkway. Turn left when you reach it.
63.50 Turn left on the walkway heading west.
63.63 Reach River Road. Turn right on the sidewalk heading north.
63.77 Traffic light at Bulls Ferry Road. Continue north on River Road.
63.67 Some sort of industrial entrance to the right. Continue on River Rd.
64.00 Diner on the right. Ahead is a four way traffic light at Old River Road. Continue straight on River Road heading north.
64.22 Traffic light at Gorge Road, River Rd and City Place. Continue to the right from the light heading east into a parking lot.
64.30 Reach a parking lot. Continue diagonally across it to the southeast side.
64.40 Resume the waterfront walkway
64.58 Cross an entrance lane with a circle to the left from a pier. Continue on the walkway as it turns left, then right back to the waterfront.
64.70 Water on the right, large parking lot and Edgewater Multiplex Cinima movie theater on the left.
64.77 A path to the left leads back to River Road. Continue right, then left along the waterfront.
64.87 Pass cul de sac of Independence Way on the left. Continue on the walkway to the east, right.
64.97 Walkway turns ninety degrees north with high end homes along the left.
65.06 Walkway turns ninety degrees left once more
65.16 The walkway turns right again, near the north end of Independence Way cul de sac. The walkway parallels Harbor View Terrace and continues.
65.34 Two old piers to the right>
65.40 Pass a retention pond on the left
65.51 A pier to the right leads to a crab restaurant. Continue ahead along the Hudson.
65.59 A pathway to the left leads back to River Road. Continue ahead with the high nets of the Edgewater Driving Range skirting the side of the pathway.
65.70 Depart from the driving range border and continue north past buildings.
65.80 Reach Archer Street and turn left back toward River Road as the walkway has ended again.
65.92 Turn right on River Road north on the sidewalks
66.10 Turn right into a strip mall area to the right. Follow the store fronts.Remain on the right heading around the building until the Hudson waterfront is regained.
66.25 Reach more waterfront walkway and turn left.
66.30 The pathway leaves the retail area. Soon, it skirts high end condos and apartment areas on the left. NOTE: This section was not completed or open when scouted by Metrotrails. More info needed.
66.58 Trail seems to pass through a building
66.63 Access path to the left and skirt a large parking lot on the left. This is a Whole Foods Market. Continue along the waterfront.
66.90 After passing more condos, turn ninety degrees left once more, then soon another ninety right.
66.98 Grand Cove Marina and Edgewater Ferry Landing is on the right. The walkway ends here. Continue out to River Road.
67.08 Continue north on River Road
NOTE: There is a park that used to have loop trails, but is now undeveloped and inaccessible. We assume this will be re-opened, and include it in mileage as if it were not an issue. In the meantime, hikers should remain on River Road and avoid this section until mile 67.96.
67.96 The pathway meets River Road again. Turn right and follow River Road.
68.48 Turn right onto Annett Ave, Fort Lee
68.58 Turn left on Colony Road.
68.82 Intersection with Henry Hudson Drive.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xaf1/v/t1.0-9/269509_10150241103181777_3720283_n.jpg?oh=96e9fcd55b0d0a5202aa4b6692cc4492&oe=5719D164

Anyone can cut out early at any time they like to do abbreviated versions of this hike. It is almost entirely flat, as the walkway remains at the bottom of the Palisades formation. It's still quite lovely, as the cliffs known as the Palisades continue south to Bergen Hill, part of the same igneous intrusive basalt formation as the rest of the cliffs, only not as high.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfa1/v/t1.0-9/263829_10150241101866777_6517630_n.jpg?oh=3885fbdcd4b363ef4030f86936a6fc19&oe=5710B36A

The hike will end at the Hoboken Terminal where trains can be taken back to pretty much any location, either by tubes to Manhattan, Exchange Place, or Hudson Bergen Light Rail.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xap1/v/t1.0-9/265132_10150241113106777_3291251_n.jpg?oh=4cc1fd2a06f059ba6dcd3a7440758f5a&oe=5708ED5A

If anyone coming from my area would like to join me on the train to the city, I will be departing from Short Hills train station for the 7:47 am train to NY Penn Station, arriving at 8:39.
If anyone needs to get in touch with me, my cell is[masked]
results.how_to_find_us: There is an enlarged area in the station with many stores (where Christmas tree us usually is in Winter) with Hudson News and Taco Bell nearby. Meet here.

results.description:
Many thanks to the winter warriors that came out to play with us this past Sunday. Cold be damn as it turned out to be two competitive and close games. A couple of members were a bit foolishly brave (to put it nicely) to come out without jackets, only to scamper back home realizing a jacket is a necessity when there's an arctic blast.

This weekend will be nicer, around the 50's. Will the geese flock back? No but maybe some of our temperate weather members will. Either way, it should be good games. 

And lastly, glad the games were back to being fun again. No drama!

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned,permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first three games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year.

By attending our games you agree to assume any and all risks involved in these games.

results.description:
RSVP required


What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must:
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store. 
</a>Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/sdi_forms_03_general_liability_release.pdf">SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks the  "Instructors": F. Ventura & C.K. Scharf, the "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA",  the  Agency is" SDI" and Others": (fill in at pool), then, Sign and date at bottom

SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session. Students who do not RSVP may not get on the roster.No shows are subject to a $29 rescheduling fee.

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave.

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
This run starts at the "Wild Duck Pond" area of the Saddle River County Park in Ridgewood. We will start at the beginning of the mile markers which is near the exit, not near the entrance. There's parking close to the beginning of the path. If you cannot park in the lot nearest the beginning of the path, you'll need to reenter the park and park in the next closest lot. The driving area of the park is U-shaped so to get to the parking lot closest to the start of the run, you essentially drive around the "U" and approach the exit to the last lot on the right (by the dog park).


We will start at the "Wild Duck Pond Area" and will turn around at the 2 mile marker. If you'd like to run more or less, you are certainly welcome to do so as the mile markers make it simple to track your distance. If you wish to run at a slower pace, I am more than happy to run with you at your preferred pace. Nobody gets left in the dust. This is a fun run, not a competition.

If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time. With the cold weather, we will get rolling on time so that our runners don't get too cold waiting for others to show. 

If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me.

results.description:
Who's Hosting:  Chris Fisher[masked]

Estimated : 7 miles

Estimated Elevation Gain: 2000 ft

Winter 3500 hike up Windham and Burnt Knob.  We will meet at the lot at the end up Big Hollow Road and shuttle vehicles to the starting point at the end of Peck Road.  We take the Yellow trail up to the junction with the Escarpment trail.  We turn right and start the climb to the summit of Windham.  After the summit we continue on the Escarpment trail descending some before ascending Burnt Knob.  Lots of views along the way.

Space is limited due to DEC regs and in agreement with LNT guidelines.  Some spots are reserved for those who are attending the tour of Columbia County Arts/beer/wine/distillery event the day before.

Arriving Late:  We leave at 10:00am.  Should you be late you may catch us at Peck Road at 10:15am.

NOTE:

NY/NJ trail Conference  141 Catskill topographic map

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. Micro spikes are a must! You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
“…to be successful in life you need values, you need integrity, you need a vision, you need energy, and you need dynamism. And spirituality is the one thing that gives it all to you. If you are healthy, you can see better, you can eat better, you can speak better, you can hear better and you can run better. All this depends on just one thing. Similarly that which enriches your spirit is so essential to enrich all other aspects of life.” -Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder, Art of Living Foundation

Whatever we do in life, it is all directed towards being happy. Why do we even do some service to somebody? It is because it gives some happiness to us. So anything we do in our life is directed towards achieving happiness, greater happiness, and even greater happiness. That’s how the mind goes. Yet, are we happy? Yes, some times. But often not!

This free seminar examines what comes in the way of our happiness. There will be a discussion on tools that can lead us to happiness – tools that every human being is privileged to learn and use. Come, relax, refresh and smile.

results.description:
Reiki I Training & Certification Class

Reiki is a Japanese technique for stress reduction and relaxation that also promotes healing. It is spiritually guided life-force energy that is transferred through the practitioner to the client via gentle laying of hands on or off the body. Reiki treats the whole person including body, emotions, mind and spirit creating many beneficial effects that include relaxation and feelings of peace, security and well-being. Reiki is a simple, natural and safe method of spiritual healing and self-improvement that everyone can use and enhances the body's natural ability to heal itself. It has been effective in helping virtually every known illness and always creates a beneficial effect. It also works in conjunction with all other medical or therapeutic techniques to relieve side effects and promote recovery.

Reiki I training will cover:
- What is Reiki
- How does it work
- What are the benefits
- History of Reiki (both Japanese and Western history)
- Ethics in Reiki
- Reiki I attunement and meditation
- Learning hand positions for self-treatment and for others
- Plenty of time to practice with each other
- How to conduct a Reiki session with a client
- Best business practices

* We will have a 45 min lunch break. Please feel free to pack one and bring with you.
* You will receive a certificate as a Reiki I Practitioner upon successful completion of the class. Cost is $150 including manual and certificate. Please email Sarah to register, and reserve your space by sending a $50 deposit via PayPal (to Family/Friends) to [masked] by February 1

I look forward to seeing you! :)

Sarah Milligan
Psychic Medium, Reiki Master-Teacher, Health & Fitness Coach

RESOBOX Japanese Cooking Workshop Series : Daishi (Japanese Soup Stock)

Instructor: Mitsuru Kita

Date & Time: Sunday, Feburary 21, 2016 ◆ 10:00am – 12:00pm

Class Fee: $30 (all materials included!)

*Seats are limited so make sure to reserve your spot by purchasing your ticket on our website (http://resobox.com/the-heavenly-broth-dashi-japanese-soup-stock-cooking-class/) 

Location: Resobox Gallery 
[masked]th Street, Long Island City, NY 11101 
(Between Queens Plaza North and 41st Avenue) 

Dashi (Japanese soup stock) is simple and savory broth that is essential to many Japanese dishes. Made with a combination of dried bonito flakes and dried kelp, these natural ingredients create a delicious umami flavor to your favorite Japanese dishes.


In this workshop led by instructor Mitsuru Kita, you will learn how to make delicious dashi. After learning the basic dashi recipe, you will use the dashi to help make miso soup and green pea rice. Miso Soup and Green Pea Rice are popular dishes that are staple in Japanese homes. With this easy-to-learn meal, you can bring the taste of Japan to your home!

Workshop Agenda:

• Introduction to Workshop

• What is Dashi (Japanese Soup Stock)

• Ingredients

• How to make

• What to use for

• Umami

• Let’s try to make Dashi

• Use Dashi to make Miso Soup and Green Pea Rice

• Taste Miso Soup and Green Pea Rice 

Check out our website: 

http://resobox.com/the-heavenly-broth-dashi-japanese-soup-stock-cooking-class/

RVSP at our Facebook event page:

COME JOIN US FOR AN ICY UNDERGROUND ADVENTURE AS WE EXPLORE AN ABANDONED LIMESTONE MINE. ICE FORMATIONS MAY VARY FROM LAST YEAR BUT YOU'RE SURE TO HAVE A BLAST EITHER WAY! HEADLAMPS, HELMETS AND MICROSPIKES ARE REQUIRED! PLEASE READ THROUGH THE DESCRIPTION FOR OTHER RECOMMENDATIONS.  

WHAT TO EXPECT:

Unlike our caving trips, this venue will be much larger with little to no crawling. You will be mostly walking, climbing and rock scrambling. Expect surfaces to be ICY, WET and SLIPPERY or have LOOSE DIRT and ROCK. You can expect temperatures in the 40's to 50's below ground. You will want to dress in clothes you don't mind getting dirty.

WHAT WILL YOU NEED?

• A Helmet

• A headlamp with backup batteries and 2 extra spare sources of light


• Clothes that you can layer to keep you warm in 40-50 degree weather that you don't mind getting dirty.

• Boots with good traction and ankle support that also can get muddy.

• Gardening gloves or similar lightweight gloves preferably with rubberized grip.

• Camera

• Gaiters (optional)

• Your Last Will and Testament



WHERE TO MEET?

Keegan Ales‎ Brewery

20 Saint James Street

Kingston, NY 12401

(845)[masked]

http://www.keeganales.com/

[masked],[masked]

Once at the meeting spot we will consolidate vehicles and carpool to our location.

results.description:
The heart of our work at New York Zen Center for Contemplative Care is based on the practice of meditation, contemplation, and Zen precepts. To care for the world, we care for ourselves. In caring for ourselves, we care for the whole world.

Meditation has been clinically proven to benefit one’s health and well-being. This often is the initial motivation to begin practice. The promise of a continuous meditation practice is freedom from suffering caused by the many layers of conditioning we foster, in our attempt to maintain a fixed sense of self. The practice of meditation allows us to experience the ease and joy of being: we are fresh and new in each moment.

Meditation is a practice that we do everyday; we gather together as community in support of one another. Our community is made up of Jewish, Catholic, Episcopal, Tibetan and Zen Buddhists and those who don’t identify with any particular tradition.

All are welcome, from those curious about meditation to those who have been meditating for decades. Chairs and cushions are available.

Uncover the power of a quieter mind and ensure the renewal of a healthier you through movement, breath, and meditation. I welcome each student to come escape the bustle of the city to experience above and find their inner guru in my  class!

WELCOME 2016! 

As we welcome 2016, let's plant the seed and watch it grow together!  While the air is (finally) crisping and the wind is whispering coming of the snowy tides, it's a perfect opportunity to recuperate, hibernate, and seek introspection.  Come slow and quiet down with us in a weekly cozy practice to balance the Vata (movement/air) dosha and learn how you can best take care of yourself in order to blossom in the Spring...  


Since March 2013, this donation based Meet Up group has aimed to provide a light-hearted and non-competitive space.  One can expect clear instructions, demonstration, gentle hands-on assistance, and achieve greater flexibility, strength, balance, focus, and sense of ease with regular attendance.  

Extra mats and blocks are limited, kindly bring yours if you have them.

results.description:
This is our indoor circuit Training session to prepare NJDBC members for the 16th Annual indoor paddle regatta competition on Saturday April 2nd 2016 as well as for the 2016 Dragon Boat season on water and any competitive regatta races from April to October.


The circuit training session will be conducted by our team captain Dave L. OPEN TO ANY GUY OR GAL in good physical condition who would be interested in paddling, meeting new people, and joining NJDBC.


Circuit training will include several workout stations such as burpees, weights, push-ups, planks, paddling, etc. A couple of the circuit stations will be a paddle machine. This will allow you to get a taste of paddling in a Dragon Boat, outrigger, or canoe! The workout will conclude with a fun 2000 meter Paddle Erg team relay race.


Please have a light breakfast well before the workout and bring a drink & towel. We will provide introductions and demonstrate proper form before we start.


We work hard together, paddle hard together, eat together, & have fun together!

Disclaimer:


Consult your physician before starting this or any other fitness program. You should be in good physical condition and be able to participate in exercise. Though we practice proper form, safety, and caution, you the user, will assume all risks of injury. If you engage in this exercise program, you agree that you do so at your own risk, are voluntarily participating in these activities, assume all risk of injury to yourself, and agree to release and discharge NJDBC and LPPOA from any and all claims or causes of action, negligence, known or unknown.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description: No dogs. Let’s have some fun this Sun., and go hiking within NYC as we go hiking in the Staten Island green belt. The hike will be about 5-8 miles over varied terrain (some paved, some dirt trails), and have a few climbs at a brisk moderate pace. We are out to have a fun time, so if you want to run or stroll this is the wrong trip. We might even see deer. There are buses from the SI ferry that go right to the nature center (s62 and S61 to Bradley and transfer for the S57). Take the 9:30 S.I. ferry to S. I., and then take either the S-61 or S-62 bus to Bradley. At Bradley take the s-57 to the nature center. The plan is to meet at the nature center at 11:00 AM. We will start on Blue trail the Red trail, and then take the yellow trail to Moses Mountain, and to it ends at Willow Swamp. We then go back to the nature center. Bring lunch, water, and hiking boots. After the hike we may go out for food and drinks. Let me know if you are coming, and whether you are driving, and how many passengers you can take., or using public transit. Rain, snow, ice storms, and canceled bus and trains cancel. L: Joe Nigro[masked] (7:30-9:30 PM) [masked] .

results.description:
Quietly, peacefully mend and meld mind and spirit as prescribed by the  Master Messengers throughout the Ages —  Jesus, Siddhārtha Gautama, Mohammad, Confucius, Handsome Lake, Lao Tzu, White Buffalo Calf Woman, The Peacemaker, Zoroaster, Mahavira, Mani, to name a few.

We do not defend, or offend, any particular religion or belief system, or anthropomorphize any deity.  

Instead, we aim to personify the Mind-Spirit connection through the words of the Masters, and make it our way of life in order to:

  • Build and maintain excellent character, as is our birthright.

  • Embody active compassion as a celebration of life and living.

  • Clarify and awaken the God within as both a journey and a destination.

  • Reunite the positive (Spirit) with the powerful (Mind) in us all to actualize our awesome potential.

That's the goal of our 11:00 a.m. Sunday Gathering.  (See below for location.)


At 12:00 p.m., leave refreshed, renewed, and re-energized, and in control of what comes next.

Speaking of what comes next, we sometimes commune afterward  by way of food, drink, and conversation.  It would be great if you joined us!

Consider it.

We look forward to your company. 


Respectfully,


Rev. Alexander
