results.description:
THE HATTIE CARTHAN COMMUNITY MARKET INVITES YOU TO ATTEND OUR 6th ANNUAL DISCHARGING RACISM COUNCIL 

FACILITATED BY : Yonnette Fleming(15th growing season at HCCG )


DATE : FEBRUARY 21st 2016 - 11AM TO 5PM

West African drumming 4pm to 5pm 

PLACE: MAGNOLIA TREE AND EARTH CENTER
677 LAFAYETTE AVE BET MARCY & TOMPKINS) GG- BEDFORD/NOSTRAND B38 TO MARCY

PLEASE BRING A DISH FOR OUR COMMUNITY POTLUCK 

Questions? [masked] or <a>[masked]</a>

Communities are rising up each day with burning questions about the effects of Racism on human health. People from dominant groups silence others and speak for entire communities through codified systems. Please join us as we examine the Roots of Racism , its impacts on our personal lives and food system and develop basic awareness for community resilience and inclusion. THIS WORKDAY INCLUDES A DOCUMENTARY, TALKING COUNCIL, AND SOUND HEALING CIRCLE. PLEASE BRING: YOUR HIGHEST SELF, NOTEBOOKS, WATER, TISSUES DONATIONS TO UNDERWRITE EXPENSES FOR OUR WORKDAY ARE GRATEFULLY ACCEPTED!About the facilitator:Farmer Yon is a plant and medicine practitioner working as a food justice farmer in NYC as a plant and sound medicine practitioner. She is the founder of the Hattie Carthan herb farm and its markets who has been working to mitigate the impacts of colonization by cultivating culturally appropriate relationship with food and land. Farmer Yon has facilitated healing circles for over 15 years in various communities and has participated in over a thousand healing conversations about Race and Class internationally.


Supporters: Hattie Carthan community market, Just Food

results.description:
* Visit our NYC Dads Group website for more events, news and tales from the dad side! *

I've taken my little guy to the Rock & Roll Playhouse (RRPH) at Brooklyn Bowl a few times recently, its my favorite new family activity.

Every week they perform music from a specific artist, time period, or music genre and teach the kids a little bit about each song while incorporating dance, parachute, bubbles, etc. Maybe best of all, while the kids are having fun, you can eat brunch from Brooklyn Bowl's awesome menu of Blue Ribbon food & even sneak in an adult beverage!

On February 21st, RRPH is doing a tribute to the late, great David Bowie. Your kids can even get their face painted in true David Bowie style!

I've managed to get our group a $2 discount on tickets, be sure to use promo code NYCDAD. Tickets are normal $10, but we'll pay $8.

Doors for Brooklyn Bowl open at 11am (they also have family bowling going on starting at 11am)
Show starts at 11:15am & generally runs a little over an hour.

There is limited table seating and its first come/first served so if you want a table to eat, come at 11.

If you are driving, I've never had a problem finding parking right out front or around the corner.

They suggest that the shows are for kids 7 & under but, you are welcome to bring older siblings too. Of course, your partners are invited to join us as well.

I'm hoping to make this a regular or semi regular activity for our group, it is so cool & so much fun!


Link to buy tickets:

results.description:
After all the excitement of Ponycon 2016, it's high time we return to our regular gaming haunt: the Uncommons Gaming Cafe in Manhattan!


For those new to the group or looking to join in for their first time, the Uncommons is NYC's very own "Gaming Cafe" - a unique blend between a gaming store and a coffee shop which offers the best of both worlds. We frequently meet here for fun, games, and ponies galore.

The Uncommons offers a wide variety of games to play for just about anybody's tastes - from eurogames, to family games, to card games, to war games, to just about any game you can think of. SO MANY GAMES!

So what does this meetup cost? The Uncommons charges a $10 rental fee for the whole afternoon - this cost covers your seat and any and all games we play until closing at 11 PM, which we frequently stay until. Be sure to show up on time/early however, as space is limited and we cannot guarantee you a seat at the table if the Uncommons is full!

How to get here:

The Uncommons is right by the West 4th St. Subway stop, which can be reached via the A, C, E, B, D, F, and M trains, and is also near the Christopher St/Sheridan Sq. Station via the 1 train. The store is on Thompson St. which is just a few blocks downtown from Washington Square Park.
results.name: Board Games at the Uncommons

results.description:
EVENT TYPE: Dining

DESCRIPTION: Let's do a Chinatown Food Crawl to celebrate Chinese New Year. We will be making multiple stops at several small restaurants and vendors in Chinatown to try specific snack food items originated from Cantonese, Fuzhounese, Northern Chinese, Taiwanese, and Vietnamese cuisines.  

First Stop: Shu Jiao Fu Zhou Cuisine, 118 Eldridge St, New York, NY 10002

We will meet and make our first stop at Shu Jiao Fu Zhou Cuisine. The recommended items to try are Fuzhounese Peanut Butter Noodles and Fish Ball Soup. We will be doing individual style at this restaurant.

Second Stop: Vanessa’s Dumpling House, 118A Eldridge St, New York, NY 10002

We will make our second stop at Vanessa’s Dumpling House. The recommended items to try are Pan Fried Dumplings and Sesame Pancakes. We will be doing individual style at this restaurant.

Third Stop: Super Taste, 26 Eldridge St, New York, NY 10002

We will continue our food adventure into Super Taste. We will be trying Taiwanese Pork Belly Buns (割包). They offer an amazing deal of three buns for $5.75. We will make one single order and share the buns among the group.

Fourth Stop: Taste of Northern China, 88 E Broadway, Suite 106, New York, NY 10002

We will continue our food adventure into Taste of Northern China. The recommended items to try are meat skewers and Rou Jia Mo (肉夾饃). We will be doing individual style at this restaurant.

Fifth Stop: Bread Talk, 47 Catherine St, New York, NY 10002

We will continue into Bread Talk to try Hong Kong style egg tarts. We will make one single order and share the tarts among the group.

Sixth Stop: Egg Cake Food Cart, Corner of Pell Street and Bowery, New York, NY 10013

We will make our sixth stop at the Egg Cake Food cart to try Hong Kong style egg cakes.

Last Stop: Banh Mi Saigon, 198 Grand St, New York, NY 10013

We will make our last stop at Banh Mi Saigon. The recommended items to try are Bánh mì (Vietnamese Sandwich) and Vietnamese Iced Coffee. We will be doing individual style at this restaurant.

Path of Food Crawl:

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.

WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...

1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated

9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved

Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

Details: One of the projects that the Ethical Culture movement helped to create was the Encampment for Citizenship, first implemented in the 1940s after the end of World War II to foster a sense of global citizenship and responsibility in young people.

Jon Kerner of the Encampment for Citizenship will address us and talk about the Encampment today — its successes and plans for the future, and how it affects the lives of those who’ve attended.

Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $11 Saturday and Sunday runs.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

The A/B & B/C breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.

results.description:
What's in a Character? (Part 1)

This is the first of two workshops that will focus on character work. You will learn techniques that will enable you to discover the voice, body, emotional life and history of a character with ease. You will learn to "get out of the way" of the character so you can discover, rather than contrive, who the character is.

A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.


Suggested Donation: $15* 

*free drink with $15 donation

*most improv classes in NYC cost $35-$50 per session or more. 

_____________________________________________________________________

THE BENEFITS OF IMPROV


Improv can help you reduce stage fright, perform with more ease, increase your emotional range, build rapport with your scene partners, and have more fun on stage.


Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.
results.name: What's in a Character? (Part 1)

results.description:
The winter is coming to an end and we want to celebrate!

Well, we really just want an excuse to hang out, make friends, and have fun times. 

Do you want to join us? You can come to one event or all. It's up to you. 

This Sunday we'll be taking a little walk in Gramercy Park, a NYC historic district that I know a bit about, so it'll be a casual walking tour. (Free of course)

Following that is Zoolander 2 in Union Square. It's a funny movie and has a lot of awesome actors in it like Ben Stiller, Benedict Cumberbatch, Penélope Cruz, Owen Wilson, and Will Ferrell. If you are learning English, it'll be a fun way to do so, and we can translate anything you don't understand. (Around $16 a ticket)

After that, if you're hungry, we can check out a nearby restaurant. There are Japanese spots in St.Mark's Place, a few Hispanic spots, and also tasty Chinese restaurants that we like to eat at. We can decide after the movie. (Pay for what you eat)

This is going to be a super fun hangout. If you're not having a great time, I'll do my best to make sure you do. 

Questions? Let me know!

results.description:
A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.
results.name: The Artist's Way

results.description:
Do you have yarn left over from a project, or maybe yarn you purchased in hopes of making something but never got around to it?, or have a project for which you didn't get enough yarn to finish up?. Are you looking for "new" yarn to inspire you? If you answered yes to any of the above...this meet up is for you! Bring that extra yarn and swap for other yarn with someone at the group! Bring that project you are looking to finish and need some " new yarn" to make a combo and hopefully you find the perfect yarn at this swap!

I have plenty to swap! I'm excited to see what all of you will bring to the table! See you there :)
Cynthia

results.description:
Click the link below to purchase tickets to this event:

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/ny-adventure-club-behind-the-scenes-staten-island-zoo-winter-edition-tickets-21580041485?aff=meetup

Join New York Adventure Club or an exclusive, interactive experience at Staten Island Zoo as we get up close and personal with some of its most celebrated animals including sloths, porcupines, snakes, and more!

This special access tour, led by the zoo's education department staff, will take us behind-the-scenes throughout the following facilities:

Baby Animal Nursery - A special opportunity to see pet, feed, and photograph baby animals including arctic foxes, cavies, sloth, groundhog, kangaroo, and tamandua.

Hospital - A walkthrough of the hospital facility to learn about the surgery, radiography, and darting equipment used to treat injured animals. Current inhabitants in this wing include giant anteaters.

Commissary - A rare look at the daily operations of diet preparation for the animals.

Educational Animal Wing - The chance to see some of the other ambassador animals including snakes, lizards, and small raptors. We will also take an up close look at our spider and insect collection.

As a special Winter treat, we'll have a chance to play with winter-themed animals!

After the tour, we'll head to the local zoo cafe for some food and drinks!

Click here to see pictures from our last visit!
results.name: NY Adventure Club: Behind-the-Scenes @ Staten Island Zoo, Winter Edition

results.description:
Photographer & Model Photoshoot Society Presents:

"Bikini, Lingerie & Implied Shoot w/Neesy & Marisol - Feb. 21"

With Spring and warmer weather on its way sooner (thanks Mr. Groundhog)..what better way to get in the spirit than with a Spring inspired bikini & lingerie shoot with none other than Neesy Rizzo and Marisol Brisman! These two beauties were amazing together at our last shoot back in July and it's time for Round 2!

About the Shoot:

We have three looks planned and a possible 4th with both models if there is time. First, we will shoot a bikini look as I know we're all looking forward to some swimwear shoots this summer. Second, we will have a lingerie look, Victoria Secret style. Last look will be an implied look.

RSVP:

Please take a moment to read the new Deposit info below in the Policy and Disclaimers section. We have setup a deposit system to hold a spot for a shoot. So, please only sign up when you are sure of your attendance and ready to make the deposit to hold your spot. (This also lets anyone on a waitlist able to join the shoot if you are not sure of your attendance yet.) Your spot is not held till the deposit is received and I'll send you a confirmation message or confirm your spot on the Meetup page. All deposits need to be received immediately upon signup or within 5 days of the shoot or we will have to fill the unconfirmed spot/s ASAP or cancel the shoot (existing deposits returned) if the minimum RSVP is not met. (No, deposit is needed if you are on the waitlist but check back to see if your waitlist status has been updated to "Yes".)

Total Cost: $80

Deposit: $20 (Paypal)

(Don't mark the checkbox on the PayPal page as that adds the surcharge automatically. If we have to return a deposit for any reason, it will be less than originally deposited.)

Balance due at time of shoot: $60, Cash preferred, Credit Cards/Paypal ok with $5 added for surcharge.

Non-Commercial Release PDF will be emailed to you at the email address given on the sign in sheet.

Models: 

Neesy Rizzo: Instagram and Facebook

(PhotoCredits: NandoPro)

Marisol: Instagram and Website

(Photo Credits: NandoPro)

Policy and Disclaimers:

One-on-One: The model will be available for one half hour one on one shoot after the first two hours in the Meetup. If you want to pre-book time before the shoot, send me a message.

Shared One-on-Ones: We are also implementing a system that has been working for the past few Meetups. It's the sharing of a half hour one on one with a fellow photographer. It can be shared together for the whole half hour or 15 minutes each photographer. 

____________________________________________________________________

About the Studio:

The studios is a beautiful 3,000 sq. ft., climate controlled,  fully functional studio. (Professional in-house lights, props, various seamless backdrops, actual commercial photography sets, kitchen, waiting room, meeting/presentation room, the works!) It's conveniently located to major highways and a 20-30 minute public transportation ride to and from NY.

About The Meetup Format:

We will keep the group small although we have the space to accommodate a big group. This keeps things from feeling rushed and overwhelming. Each photographer will have a set amount of time per look. This will allow you to  shoot as you would in an actual client shoot and not have to worry about the number of shots you are taking. (This proved to be ideal in our previous shoots as far as being able to get "the shot" and enough time to do so. Think of it as a mini one-on-one time with the model.) During the shoot we may opt to give a theme a direction to shoot for. As it would be for an actual client. (Ex: If the setup calls for a "cover shot" then it will give you a direction to aim for and to consider what equipment to use or what mood to capture.) No worries, bring what lens or lenses you have, you'll learn to use what you have for best results. We strive to bring forth real world conditions and parameters so there is a methodology to a setup or theme.

Check-in Procedure and Disclaimers:

Check-in - When you arrive, there will be a quick check-in. This will mostly be so you can read and adhere to the studio/group shoot guidelines and make payment for the shoot before we start. This will also let us send you the release forms in PDF format if we don't have physical copies available.

Releases - We will have one non-commercial release signed by the model through the studio only. (No additional releases will be signed.) If you need a commercial release signed, you can make arrangements with the model directly. Additional compensation for this is between the model and photographer.

Right to Refuse - We have the right to refuse a member's RSVP to the Meetup. It's a small community and models keep detailed info on photographers also. If we feel there is justifiable reason to refuse a RSVP, we will exercise that right.

Signups - Please signup when you know you will attend. If the signup passes the point to book another model and then we get no shows it's not fair to your fellow photographers who would be on a waiting list. It also puts the organizers in a tough spot, financially after booking an additional model to compensate for a bigger group. In case of no show, we will have to remove you from the group. When emergencies come up, followup with an email and we can make exceptions on a case by case basis. 

Deposit - We have implemented a deposit system to insure that the minimum RSVP is met to hold the shoot. (Which varies from shoot to shoot.) This will ensure that the financials are or will be in place for the model/s beforehand. This deposit will be non-refundable, so make sure you sign up and pay the deposit when you are sure you will be able to attend. Signing up to the Meetup page does not ensure your spot until the deposit is made at the Paypal link provided on each event page. As the shoot date comes closer, if you have not paid the deposit, we will fill the unconfirmed spot immediately. You will receive a confirmation message or a confirmation comment on the Meetup page you are signing up for. Two days before the shoot, if the minimum RSVP has not been met then we will opt to cancel the shoot and refund any deposits already sent. This will give the model some time to book another gig if possible. But as usual, always check the Meetup page up to the date of the shoot for any updates.

Model Cancellation - If a model cancels/no show or a last minute model change occurs, you will have the option to cancel beforehand or not attend the Meetup on the day of, if it happens upon arrival to the Meetup. (Any refunds will be given or credit toward a future Meetup as per your request.)

Waitlist - When you are on a waitlist, please be mindful as this is also considered a RSVP of availability. So, if we add another model or someone cancels, your wait list status may upgrade to a "Yes" automatically. Please be on the lookout for updates on the Meetup page as Meetup sometimes takes longer to notify of a status change.

Updates - Updates will be made on this page up to the date of the Meetup or the night before. Emails will also be sent but Meetup emails are not always reliable to be sent to a receiver right away. (I've heard of emails arriving 3 hours later if at all.)

Postponements - Weather considerations will be made the night before a shoot or on the day of and the Meetup page will be updated as well as emails sent if a postponement occurs due to inclement weather or some other emergency. Lack of minimum RSVP to hold the event will also cause postponement of the shoot. The night before we would make the call wether to postpone so be on the look out for our email and Meetup page updates.

Any questions please email me at [masked]

results.description:
Updated December 18th, 2015

WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 

[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

[img src="">

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

results.description:
Are you looking for a complementary training to ENHANCE your overall well being on and off the track, to be more FLEXIBLE and RELEASE physical, mental and emotional tensions?

Are you looking for RELIEF from joint wear, tightness, pain, and/or discomfort?

_________________________________________________

About Yin Yang Yoga...A typical Yoga class is ‘Yang’ in style and focuses on active heating and muscular contraction - by starting with ‘Yin’, a more passive, nourishing, and cooling practice, this uniquely designed class WILL enhance your alignment, performance, and overall sense of balance!


Why For Runners/Athletes? - Lengthening and releasing effect from repetitive movements on sheets of connective tissue can overtime shorten and tighten it in ingrained patterns around the muscles. This fascia restriction can make one more prone to having injuries, abnormal posture, and inefficiency, as well as asymmetrical weakening. By targeting rotated key areas in weekly Yin Yang Yoga For Runners class, one can experience tension release, fluid movement, and benefit from improved posture, circulation, injury prevention, as well as increased respiratory control and mental focus...

Each Yin Yang Yoga for Runners class begins with a series of held Yin/floor postures. While surrendering into the edge of each pose (for 2-5 minutes), students are guided to experience the discomforting stagnant energy and its release around the hips, thighs, and lower back, and be connected to the present moment. The Yang flow sequence designed to follow will allow students to integrate the newly released energy, joint spaces for greater circulation and achieve new level of flexibility and energy.  Guided Relaxation provided at the end will promise to be YUMMY!

__________________________________________________

Testimonies x3: "Jennifer is an awesome instructor. Her sessions are informative and her teaching style is patient, clear and inspires me to attain increased fitness. I look forward to attending her class. The very next day I was able to push through my usual 3-4 miles to complete a 6 mile run." Sandra

"I ran my best time running a 18 mile course the day after..." Lori

“ I started taking Jennifer's Yin/Yang Yoga for Runner's Class over the summer, and it was fantastic. I had never practiced yoga regularly before, and was pleasantly surprised at how it helped to improve my flexibility, running, and overall fitness. Jennifer is a great, hands-on teacher, and really knows how the body works. I highly recommend this class! ” Theresa

________________________________________________________

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 12:30-2:30pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
Nurture Nature Mini-Retreat

Sunday February 21, 2016

12:30 p.m. - 2 p.m.

The Parsonage

(of the Community Unitarian Universalist Congregation)

466 Rosedale Avenue

White Plains, NY

Helping each other grow into our full potential as natural nurturers and naturers by letting the beauty we are be what we do.

Nurturer:  One who nurtures any aspect of the biotic community, nurturing oneself as one’s neighbors

Naturer:One who cherishes nature and seeks opportunities to understand, experience, and be nourished by nature

This free mini-retreat is for anyone who desires a better world for themselves and for others. It is part of One Earth Conservation's Nurture Nature Program which aims to inspire, motivate, educate, and support people to take care of themselves, their organizations, other individuals of all species, and the biotic community as a whole by developing their awareness and understanding of nature, especially human nature as it relates to all of nature. Rev. Dr. Joyner, wildlife veterinarian, multispecies minister, and Co-Director of One Earth, will facilitate this retreat. To find out more about One Earth go to:  www.oneearthconservation.org.

During Our Time Together:

We will slow down and connect with each other and the world of nature by:

·  Nurturing ourselves with a light snack and beverages (provided by host One Earth Conservation)

·  Nurturing each other with discussion and listening

·  Experiencing a multi-media presentation

·  Going deeper with nature meditations (both silent and guided meditations)

·  Enjoying brief outdoor nature experiences

·  Sharing what a Nurture Nature practice might look like

·  Contributing to how the Nurture Nature Program can support those who wish to develop their practice

Logistics:

·  Please RSVP through the Nature as Spiritual Practice or The Conservationist's Way Meetup group, or by emailing [masked]. Space is limited

·  Wear comfortable clothing that will suffice for brief outdoor excursions

·  We are not charging because your participation contributes to this growing program. Donations are gladly accepted to help One Earth's work in the world

For more information, contact Rev. Dr. LoraKim Joyner (amoloros
results.name: Nurture Nature Mini-Retreat

MANA Contemporary это не только выставочный зал но и студии современных художников, скульпторов а так же хранилище произведений искусства. Нас ждёт редкое событие, Open House. MANA Contemporary будет открыт в воскресенье. Кроме 3х специальных выставок Вашему вниманию будут представлены постоянные экспозиции.

http://www.manacontemporary.com/exhibitions-events/

Особый интерес вызывают работы мастеров hyperreality: скульптора Carole Feuerman и художника Yigal Ozeri, рабочие е студии которых находятся в MANA.

http://www.carolefeuerman.com/bmviplgwyal65dehd1gsffvkg2l208

http://www.yigalozeriartist.com/

Некоторые в начале декабря воспользовались возможностью познакомится с работой Sam Jinks, мастера hyperreality


Ваши замечания, дополнения и знания в области искусства будут очень полезны. Также если Вы были на выставке, рекомендации и отзывы будут кстати.

 Address: 888 Newark Avenue Jersey City, NJ 07306 http://www.manacontemporary.com/visit/

DIRECTIONS By PATH train from Manhattan:

The PATH train runs along 6th Avenue with stations at 33rd Street, 23rd Street, 14th Street, 9th Street, and Christopher Street. A separate PATH train station is located at World Trade Center. From any Manhattan PATH station, take the Journal Square- or Newark-bound line to Journal Square. Exit the Journal Square PATH Station and walk north along John F. Kennedy Boulevard. Turn left onto Newark Avenue;

Mana is located at 888 Newark Avenue on the right-hand side of the street.

By car from the Holland Tunnel: Keep to the left and follow signs for Kennedy Boulevard. Continue until the end, which will be Kennedy Boulevard. Turn left onto Kennedy Boulevard, then right onto Newark Avenue. Drive through the next traffic light and down the hill. Mana is located at 888 Newark Avenue on the right-hand side of the street. By car from the Lincoln Tunnel: Merge onto 3 East toward 1 and 9 South/US 9 South. Continue on 1 and 9. Take the ramp toward Route 7 West /US 1 and 9 Truck/Tonnelle Avenue–Jersey City. Turn right onto Tonnelle Avenue, then right onto Newark Avenue.

Mana is located at 888 Newark Avenue on the right-hand side of the street. By car from the New Jersey Turnpike: Take Exit 15E and keep to the right for the Jersey City exit. results.description:
Please join your pals from ArtForward and Wired NY Meetup groups, for our first ever official visit to Mana Contemporary, in Jersey City, NJ. They are having an Open House on this day. It's easy to get there via mass transit (Path train from Manhattan), to the Journal Square station. It's a quick walk from there to Mana. If you have a vehicle, there's free parking in the Mana lot. There's info below for the Mana shuttle bus, which departs from West 15th Street. Many of us will meet at the 14th Street (& Sixth Ave) Path station, and ride out together.


Mana is a huge place. We all may get separated while touring the various floors & galleries. I'll set a time for us all to reassemble, and we can then go to an Indian restaurant in the area. The "Little India" neighborhood of Jersey City is right nearby, and it's fun and very reasonable.


The weather will be perfect, as it always is for us. More details will be posted prior to the event. Yay!


From Mana Press Release:


New exhibitions include:


Made in California: Selections from the Frederick R. Weisman Art Foundation, covering two floors of gallery space, presents a star-studded selection of contemporary West Coast art from the 1950s to the present. In the first floor gallery, The T’ang Horse: The Passions of Anthony Quinn, curated by Ysabel Pinyol, offers an intimate look at the late actor’s legacy through the lens of his own art works and art collection. The ICP gallery on Mana’s sixth floor presents Sudden Impact: Photography on the Printed Page, presents an international selection of early 20th century magazine covers, prints, and posters, illustrating that period's energizing and urbane shift towards image-heavy media. The Florence Academy of Art at Mana presents Scandinavian Artists of The Florence Academy of Art, a select group of figurative paintings by their Scandinavian alumni, including work from current students and instructors from their Swedish location.


Ongoing exhibitions include:


Ayn Foundation continues its year-long solo exhibition, Ayn Foundation Presents: Arnulf Rainer, in a 5,000-square-foot gallery on the first floor. The Austrian artist (b. 1929) is considered one of the most inventive abstract painters of the 20th century. In the fifth floor gallery, curator Saul Ostrow presents Here’s Looking Back at You: Images of Woman from the ESKFF Collection, a selection of works from the Eileen S. Kaminsky Family Foundation (ESKFF) that examine the boundaries of understanding female representation in art. On the first floor, Galerie Ernst Hilger presents Oliver Dorfer & Cameron Platter: Far Relations, featuring two artists from opposite ends of the globe whose work addresses deep-seated political and historical themes with pop culture imagery.


Public reception: Sunday, January 24, 2016, 1PM to 6PM. A complimentary shuttle service will depart every half hour from Milk Studios (450 West 15th Street, New York, NY 10011) starting at 12:30PM., and returning every half hour from Mana starting at 2PM.
results.name: 1st Ever Meetup Group Visit to Mana Contemporary!

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY  (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Theme for February: "Buildings"

Have a cool building you've created? Bring it along for show and tell. Or, bring a set you think would be fun to build together. Don't have anything to bring? No problem, just bring yourself and play!

In addition, we'll layout a couple Lego road plates and work together to create a unique Lego community from the bricks on hand. A city with a castle at one end, a wacky house in the middle and an igloo or space lander at the end? Sure, why not?! We'll vote on the best contribution to our town and the lucky winner will be awarded a small Lego set prize.

As always, there will be a big pile of bricks for free building throughout the afternoon.

Location TBD in Midtown Manhattan.

Note on Fees: 
We're charging a small fee so that we can get a better handle on attendance. We want to make sure that we have plenty of table space for everyone to build, but also hate to waste money on larger rooms for no-shows.  

Otherwise, we have an optional pay-what-you-can policy. Feel free to contribute (or not) via credit card here on Meetup or in cash at events. Lego can be an expensive hobby and we want this group to remain accessible to everyone. We welcome casual fans,  serious AFOLs, and newbies alike.

Fees go towards snacks, room costs, Lego prizes, and meetup fees.
results.name: February NYC Lego Meetup for AFOL "Buildings"

results.description:
Wow! I took a walk today and the weather was amazing with temps in the 50's and Sunday is supposed to be nearly as warm!

I know this is totally last minute, but I would love to invite the group to go out and take a walk Sunday afternoon. the temp is supposed to be 52.


Join us for a walk around Hoboken. We will start by Pier A park (at the flag pole pictured below). This is a great way to get some healthy exercise and meet some new people at the same time.

We will walk up the waterfront to the north end of Hoboken and then back down Washington street. The walk should be for about an hour.

Be sure to wear comfortable walking shoes and bring some water.

This is a casual walk at a casual pace. We can also get some lunch at the end of the walk if in the mood.


Please RSVP if you plan on joining us.


-Mike

February 21, 2016

Chanting & Sacred Sounds

Chanting and Singing

Hands on training with Pagan songs for all occasions

Raising energy in ritual

BRING DRUMS OR OTHER INSTRUMENTS IF YOU HAVE IT

Come ready to learn how to chant and sing with some drumming to keep the circle's energy on high.

$30 in person/$33 via paypal - If you paid online PLEASE bring your receipt to class.

WFT Academy of Pagan Studies (WFTAPS) offers the most comprehensive, well-planned and affordable training available anywhere. We have a very interactive community based program. We provide many sources of learning that go into each and every class, which surpasses others when learning about Wicca / WitchCraft in New York City. We offer First through Third Degree training. Additionally we have many other Witch Crafting Classes & Workshops including: Herbal Intensive Series, Making A BOS, Tarot Classes, Besom Making, Candle SpellCrafting and much more.
What is wonderfully unique about WFT Academy of Pagan Studies is that it allows you to set the pace of your learning experience and provides you with an affordable way to grow within a structured Wiccan learning environment. You will be challenged and we do invite those who welcome this challenge to our Academy. We take your education very seriously, and in turn you should be serious about your education and training in the Path of Wicca / WitchCraft. Before considering enrollment and training at WFT Academy of Pagan Studies keep in mind that it is a life-path commitment.
Within our Academy there is an enormous amount of Community Interaction through the use of meetups, myspace, groups and now NEW! launching in 2013 online classes which will have our newly formed blog and forum etc., further enabling you to increase your knowledge and learning as well as providing you the ability to network with other like-minded individuals in a safe and supportive environment. Students can join this blog as long as they have registered at WFTAPS for classes
The Academy is truly a Spiritual Home and we welcome you to make it your own!
We have Degree-specific Study to discuss challenging lessons, facilitate rituals celebrating the Sabbats and Esbats as well as for healing and self-empowerment, all in a friendly and open atmosphere. We also hold Wiccan Degree dedications marking the stages of your training as you move through the Academy. We have found that many of our Students find it wonderful to be in a group learning environment that they can consider a Community Home.
We are all very proud of our Academy and what we have accomplished thus far. But ever mindful that it is each and every one of the Students that make it what it is. If you are reading this, we are confident that you would make a wonderful addition to our Academy and do hope that after reading this, you will decide to join us as at the Academy as a Student and member of The Wiccan Family Temple.
We welcome you to begin your studies by going to our ADMISSION AND PRICES (where you will find applications) page and submit your enrollment to the Academy today. We look forward to having you join us as a new Student of the WFT Academy of Pagan Studies.

WE ARE ALWAYS IMPROVING UPON WHAT WE OFFER STRIVING AND PROMISING TO ALWAYS KEEP RAISING THE BAR ON WHAT WE OFFER.

FOR MORE INFORMATION ON CLASSES, EVENTS ETC. PLEASE VISIT US AT:
www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.webs.com
www.wiccanfamilytemple.org
www.thenycpagancouncil.webs.com
www.romanctichandfastings.webs.com
www.charmedbystarr.com for all your ritual and pagan items.

results.description:
Volunteers are needed to help sort and pack food pantry donations for local senior citizens.  Bread of Life provides food to families and over 17 church & government food pantries and shelters throughout southern Westchester County.  Come be a part of this great organization for the day!

About Bread of Life:

Bread of Life is a Rye, NY based not-for-profit organization committed to serving our neighborhood. It is the only food rescue organization, which also has its own on-site food pantry. We pick up locally and deliver free of charge to neighborhood food pantries, soup kitchens and shelters, serving over 9,000 hungry weekly. Bread of Life receives its food supplies from various sources, but one unique source is donations by local businesses of excess food that would otherwise be discarded as waste.  Bread of Life’s beneficiaries are not only physically hungry, but are also in need of assurance that their lives are matter.

**If you plan on volunteering with your child please include them in your rsvp as a +1 and let me know their name and age in the comments section.  All minors must be accompanied by a parent or guardian.  Thanks!**

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.

WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...

1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated

9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved

Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Hello Fellow Photographers,

We are posting an upcoming Seminar on Lightroom. It will be hosted by Robert Feiner who is a  Freelance Event and Headshot Photographer


This one is all about what to do with your images AFTER they're shot.  I encourage you all to consider this seminar  to learn more about sorting huge amounts of digital photos and editing them so they look their best!

                                                                 -----

This is a cross-promotional notice for an event produced by the: 
Manhattan Figure Study & Lighting Workshop Group 

To sign up, please follow the link to their EVENTBRITE page where you can sign up and prepay. Signup at: https://lightroom-workflow-editing-seminar.eventbrite.com 

                             Lightroom Workflow and Editing Workshop


                                  (with a bit of Photoshop thrown in)

Sunday, February 21

1:30 - 3:00pm

Studio 303, 150 W28th Street. Manhattan

Open to All Levels of Photographers

Signup at: https://lightroom-workflow-editing-seminar.eventbrite.com 

NOTE: You MUST sign up via the Eventbrite link to reserve your spot. RSVPing on Meetup DOES NOT COUNT!

You've participated in a shoot and have several hundred images on your memory card. Now you need to download, organize, select the best ones and edit them. 


This 90-minute workshop will take you through an efficient process for organizing your images, and demonstrate how to use the powerful editing tools in Lightroom to do most, if not all, of your editing. 

This workshop will include: 

• Why use Lightroom to organize and edit your images. 

• Downloading your images and creating an effective method of organizing images so you can easily access them now and in the future. 

• Identifying your best images for editing and showcasing.

• Tips and tricks to save a ton of time by batch processing all your images.

• The best tools in Lightroom to use for editing figure study images and portraits. 

• When — and why — to take an image into Photoshop to finish your editing process. 

• Options for outputting your finished images into jpegs for the web/social media and formats for printing. 

Go from This (straight out of the camera):  



To This!

Signup at: https://lightroom-workflow-editing-seminar.eventbrite.com    

 Be sure to sign up via the Eventbrite link to reserve your spot. 

RSVPing on Meetup DOES NOT COUNT

Your instructor: Rob Feiner 

Rob Feiner is a professional photographer, one of the event organizers for the Manhattan Figure Study & Lighting Workshop Group and an Associate Director of NiNPAH. Rob is also an accomplished headshot and event photographer. 

Specific participation levels must be met or the event will be canceled due to lack of photographer interest.

Please note: Some figure study (i.e., nude model) images may be used as part of this class to demonstrate editing techniques.

REFUND TERMS: There are no refunds. Your slot is transferable to a different photographer over the age of 18 for this event only. There will be no exceptions to these terms.

 Be sure to sign up early and take advantage of the Advanced Discounted Registration Tickets. 

Seating is limited. 

This seminar will improve both your workflow skills for your images and will help improve your photo editing skills. 

 Signup at: https://lightroom-workflow-editing-seminar.eventbrite.com    

Sign up via the Eventbrite link to reserve your spot.

RSVPing on Meetup DOES NOT COUNT

SIGN UP NOW!

Before Seats are Sold Out!

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

Our first 1-day Tournament of the season is here!! RSVP while there are spots available!!

Get plenty of touches on the ball and a chance to win 1st. place championship medals!

See details below:

How long will the Tournament last?

Approximately 3.5  hours depending on the amount of teams registered.

What are the rules and level of play?

- 7vs7 (includes the goalkeeper). All teams will have 2 to 3 substitutes.

- CO-ED (no minimum girls required on field)

- 6'x12' size goals.

- Level is intermediate to advance. If you played at a college level or similar, you would be considered Advanced.

- No slide tackles.

-Only turf shoes, indoor shoes or running sneakers.

-3 points for a win, 1 for a tie and 0 for a loss. The teams in the Final Round games are decided by points, goal difference then goals scored.

-We'll keep track of scores. The goals are full size, so if you are a goalkeeper please let us know. Otherwise, teammates will rotate being goalkeeper.

-Everyone will be randomly placed on a team. If you would like to be placed with a particular team, please let us know in the comment section when you rsvp on the top right corner; we will try to accommodate everyone. Also, if you would like to bring your own team, please RSVP for you+9 and pay the total via paypal.

How do I join?
There are 2 ways to join:

1. The first way to join is as a free agent. To join as a free agent please rsvp on this page and we will place you on a team. If you would like to be placed with a friend on the same team, please let us know. We will try to accommodate everyone :)

2. The second way to join is as a team. If you would like to register your team please rsvp on this page for you+ 9 guests and pay the total amount via paypal.

How will the tourney work?

- We are looking to register 3 to 4 teams. The format varies depending on the amount of teams registered. See this link for the format: Tournament Formats

What's included?
- Hired referees
- Permit fees
- Tournament and website administration

- Medals for 1st place winners

What are the prizes?

- Easch player in the winning team receives medals and gains bragging rights :)

What should you bring?


-Please use cleats or turf shoes and lots of water.

-A white t-shirt, a red t-shirt and a blue t-shirt.

What is the refund policy?


-if the tournament is cancelled you will receive a refund.

-if you change your RSVP 48 hours before kickoff, you will receive a refund

If you have any questions about getting there please e-mail or all us at[masked]

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Fee:Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Cancellations/Refunds: If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for the next game. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :).

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Let's meet at the Manhattan Bridge bike path entrance on the Brooklyn side. If that's way out of your way we can meetup along the ride.

This will be a simple loop, trading 5th Ave for Broadway. We'll pick up the bike path on the Manhattan side at Allen St -> 1st Ave and then charge North up to 85th St. There we'll bank West over to 5th Ave, head south to pick up 59th, and then over to Columbus Circle to pick up Broadway, weaving through the traffic along the way. For now I'll plan on going back to Brooklyn via the Williamsburg Bridge and taking the Kent path South, but we can tweak that.

The route is simple, but this ride is for those comfortable and experienced riding through tight traffic. You should have decent handling skills and a helmet!

results.description:
Ben Grosscup., an Overview of Contemporary Political Folk Music Performance-Talk

Note, an RSVP does not reserve your seat! For reservations, contact Steve:   [masked] or call[masked]


Ben Grosscup will present a selection of contemporary songs by himself and others that are especially powerful visionary statements emerging from today’s radical social movements.

Some would say that there has been nothing like this on the folk scene since the 1960s! Recent years have seen an explosion of new songs coming out of the Occupy Wall Street, Black Lives Matter, environmental, labor, anti-war, human rights, economic justice, and other progressive movements. Mr. Grosscup is an activist folk musician and Executive Director of the People's Music Network


Held in a private residence on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, near West 98th Street & Broadway. Seating limited. For reservations and location, please e-mail Steve Suffet at [masked] or call him at[masked]-1533.


Suggested contribution $12. FMSNY or PMN members $10.

****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

Join New York Adventure Club as we explore the oldest subway stations in New York City with transit expert and guide Gary Dennis.

Starting at Bowling Green Station and working our way up to Grand Central Terminal, Gary will give you the secret history and inside story of the creation of the original 1904 subway line, and how it grew into the most extensive transportation system in the world.

After the tour, we'll grab some food and drinks in the Grand Central Terminal Concourse!

results.description:
Here's the winner of our most recent what-to-read poll! It's longer than what we typically read, but that won't stop us.

 "Middlesex" tells the breathtaking story of Calliope Stephanides, and three generations of the Greek-American Stephanides family, who travel from a tiny village overlooking Mount Olympus in Asia Minor to Prohibition-era Detroit, witnessing its glory days as the Motor City and the race riots of 1967 before moving out to the tree-lined streets of suburban Grosse Pointe, Michigan. To understand why Calliope is not like other girls, she has to uncover a guilty family secret, and the astonishing genetic history that turns Callie into Cal, one of the most audacious and wondrous narrators in contemporary fiction. Lyrical and thrilling, "Middlesex" is an exhilarating reinvention of the American epic.
results.name: "Middlesex," by Jeffrey Eugenides

results.description:
Brooklynites and other New Yorkers! Come out to Ange Noir Cafe and play some Magic the Gathering, whether you are new to the game or an experienced player. I bring a bunch of cards and some pre-made decks, so we always have enough stuff for all. Feel free to bring your own decks (Commander aka EDH, Modern, Standard, etc.) along if you want. And invite friends ... the more the merrier.

***The given time-slot can be shifted or extended to fit schedules or we want to play longer but please let me know a little in advance so we can schedule properly.*** 

*UPDATE REGARDING FINANCIAL INPUT: we have now gone to a yearly dues format, which if everyone in the group pays, we will have more than enough to cover the cost of being on Meetup. If not everyone pays, it may have to increase, but only slightly (right now at $2/yr.) The real purpose of why this group is here is to provide a non-financially demanding option for learning and playing/practicing the game.

results.description:
Disclosure Network New York

Date: Sunday, Feb. 21, 2016

Location: CAP 21 Studios, 18 West 18th St., (Between 5th Ave. & 6th Ave., South Side of Street), elevator to the 5th Floor, Room 505, NYC

Time: 2pm-4pm,Please arrive in the lobby 10 minutes before the 2pm meeting begins. Ask the Welcome Desk person for “Nick Curto's room assignment” if you need help in finding the room. Please be on time, as late arrivals may disrupt the meeting. Enter the room assigned at 2pm.

Topic: “The Beast Turns a New Leaf”

Featured Guest Speaker: RAY SONGTREE

Program (Live Event): The top of pyramid only exists because we at the bottom support it. Rather than blame the elite, we need to see how they gained so much control. They did not do it with just brute force. They have succeeded by both deceiving and undercutting our intelligence, and they have been doing this for a long long time. To wake up, we have to stop craving another information fix and start applying new choices. We might check if material “progress” and ecologic balance are at odds. If our timeline looks dysfunctional we need to change our values and make health for all life our new goal. This is empowering. Empowerment means we work locally as diverse communities, not under the nefarious leadership of the World Bank or United Nations.

I will be weaving history, celebrities, the Earth, and religion to show how we have been made into sheeple and distracted. Disimpowerment and distraction is what our young people now consider normal. How will we reverse this?

Bio - Ray Songtree is an author on the subject of cultural rejuvenation through deprogramming. He has a degree in Conservation of Natural Resources. Ray worked as a carpenter in Washington State and Hawaii and has reconnected with indigenous cultures in Arizona, the Pacific, Tibet, Australia and Bolivia. His first awakening occurred in Bodh Gaya, India in 1974. Of the many spiritual elders he met, Kobun Chino Roshi, also the sensei of Steve Jobs, was the most important. Ray is 63.

“About ten years ago I became aware that the media was lying to me about almost everything, such as Martin Luther King, 9/11, global warming and autism. This started a new adventure in unraveling what the hell is going on. I was pissed. I discovered there is a documented organization with a global plan, a methodology and an anti-virtue underpinning. I discovered that the secrecy of our puppet leaders is built on shame for behavior that they themselves are tricked into. If talented people are trusted with secrets, they succeed. If they are not trusted, they are defunded, smeared, sabotaged, or worse. Celebrities, business persons and scientists are made famous by the machine that controls publicity.”

“I focus on what has been lost because of colonization which now includes digital artificial intelligence. Our schools now transform kids to become intellectually deficient and below the waist. I discuss how depopulation programs are becoming unglued as people choose organic and non-GM foods. We are very close to a turning point. Cancerous wireless frequencies will be exposed soon.”

“I am not interested in belief systems or theories. I share evidence based coordinates. I am a deprogrammer.”

Note: Ray has very generously sent a box of his books to DNNY Members to be given out for FREE at the DNNY Feb. 7th meetingso we have time to read them before his talk. We have more books to be given out at the Feb. 21 meeting as long as these books hold out!The book series is called, “Lipstick and War Crimes: Ignoring the Future and Looking Fabulous.”The first book has different titles, but the student edition is the most important,“A Thinking Girl’s Guide to Sexual Identity: Navigating Heartbreak, Survival and the Media Matrix.”Men will be as blown away as women will be.There is an Indigenous, Christian and Zen edition of Vol. 1. Most editions are in paperback or e-book at online retail outlets. The first Vol.1 ebook is available free on the KTII website: www.Ktii.org. This is not about money. The series is produced with many color photos in order to be reader-friendly for both old and young. www.lipstick-and-war-crimes.org

________________________________________________________________

Please plan to attend what is bound to be one of the most interesting and important DNNY meetings and invite your interested friends to join us!

Meeting Details: Admission $10 per person. Children 12 and under admitted free. Our treasurer will collect your admission fee in the meeting room door before the program begins.


R.S.V.P. now to guarantee you one (1) reserved seat! (30 seat venue room limit.) Provide your full name, e-mail address and cell phone number.

Contact: Nick Curto, DNNY Director/Co-Founder: E-mail: [masked] Phone:[masked]

3 Important Notes:

1. No food or beverages are allowed in any rooms of the venue except bottled water that may be brought into the venue. You can also purchase chilled bottled water at the Welcome Desk in the Lobby for $1.
2. Please silence your cell phones when entering the meeting room.
3. No photos may be taken or sound recording is ever allowed at any of the DNNY meetings.

Visit: www.dnny.info

results.description:
Please Register HERE

The human eye is the best camera ever created. Even in the lowest light, our eyes perform flawlessly where our man-made versions may fall a little flat. Have you ever seen a beautiful indoor or nighttime scene that seems well-lit, only to take a shot with your camera and then wonder what went wrong? Understanding how your camera “sees” and functions in low-light is the key to reproducing the same great scene you saw with your eyes. 

In this Workshop, we will examine the following topics: 

● Which camera modes work best in low-light situations
● Keys to creating properly exposed low-light photographs
● Solutions for gaining additional “stops” of light
● What equipment and gear you want to have with you during a low-light shoot 

A basic understanding of these key principles along with how to use the tools of the trade to overcome common hurdles of shooting in low-light is critical to setting yourself up for success in available and low-light photography. About the Instructor: 


Ron Jautz is a professional corporate and editorial shooter with over 30 years of experience. He specializes in photographing people and travels extensively for clients such as Pfizer, Bank of New York, Time Warner, Inc., Walgreens, Canon USA, Seton Hall University, Duke University, Forbes Magazine and Conde Nast. Over the years Ron has photographed presidents and prime ministers, members of Congress and supreme court justices, celebrities, athletes and CEOs. In addition to his commercial work, Ron also shoots fine art, having shown work in Galleries up and down the east coast. Ron now serves as the Co-Chairman of the New York Chapter of the American Photographic Artists (APANY - <a>www.apany.com)</a> To learn more about Ron and his work, please visit his website at <a>www.jautzphoto.com.</a>
________________ 

NYC Digital Photography Workshops is the premiere leader in affordable, personalized and hands-on photography education helping novices and experts hone their craft in the NYC area since 2011. Whether you are new to photography or you know your way around a camera but your skills just need some fine tuning, the experts at NYCDPW can help guide you through the process - both creative and technical - in exceptional image-making. NYCDPW instructors, also working photographers, have walked in your shoes. They speak your language and understand your challenges. Join their elite community of photographers today at <a>www.nycdpw.com.</a>
results.name: Seminar: Introduction to Available & Low-Light Photography With Ron Jautz

results.description:
This month's book is Updraft by Fran Wilde.

Kirit Densira cannot wait to pass her wingtest and begin flying as a trader by her mother's side, being in service to her beloved home tower and exploring the skies beyond. When Kirit inadvertently breaks Tower Law, the city's secretive governing body, the Singers, demand that she become one of them instead. In an attempt to save her family from greater censure, Kirit must give up her dreams to throw herself into the dangerous training at the Spire, the tallest, most forbidding tower, deep at the heart of the City.

As she grows in knowledge and power, she starts to uncover the depths of Spire secrets. Kirit begins to doubt her world and its unassailable Laws, setting in motion a chain of events that will lead to a haunting choice, and may well change the city forever - if it isn't destroyed outright.

This book is available from various sellers, via Goodreads.

* * *


IMPORTANT RSVP POLICY

If you RSVP and find you cannot make it, please change your RSVP so that we are not waiting for you. Please change it no less than two hours before the scheduled meeting time. If you RSVP and do not show, you will have to pay $10 when you attend your next event. This is to prevent those on the waiting list from missing out on an event.

The RSVP policy is the same as for the general meetup. Please see the entire policy here:
http://www.meetup.com/NYSciFi-Fantasy/pages/Membership_Policy/


* * *


Questions and answers!

Where will we be meeting?

We will be meeting at the Citigroup Atrium.

There's an entrance at 53rd and Lexington Avenue off the 53rd and Lex subway stop. You have to go down the steps; the subway station will be on your right and the Atrium will be straight in front of you. The doors are labeled.

There is a Barnes and Noble (with a Starbucks inside) on the next level up at 54th and 3rd. If you enter through the B&N, you will need to go through B&N (up a few steps from the entrance), past the NOOK display to the glass doors and down the escalator to the atrium.

There is a lift down the stairs on the right side of the corridor as you're coming from the fountain.

There's also free wi-fi and restrooms if you need them.

How will I recognize the group when I get there?

We're generally pretty easy for newcomers to recognize--if in doubt, look for paper copies of the book on tables, or a group of excited-looking people with lots of electronic reading devices. We'll try to recognize you from your picture; if in doubt, feel free to walk up and ask people!

Do I need to finish the whole book?

Nope! You're welcome to come either way. However, the whole book is fair game for discussion, including the ending!

How are the books chosen?

We try to select the next book and date of the meetup after we're finished discussing the book. We sometimes do this by poll, selected from the attendees' suggestions -- if so, the attendees will be invited to vote on the website by email. Sometimes we'll all jump on an appealing suggestion, or sometimes I'll get bored of posting polls and just pick one by fiat.

What books has the club read in the past?

We've compiled a list. (Thanks to Sarah for compiling this for us!)

I have another question!

You're welcome to message me through the website, or comment here. 

Thanks for signing up, and I hope to see you there!

Also, join our Goodreads group!

http://www.goodreads.com/group/show/57070.NY_Fantasy_Book_Club
results.name: Fantasy Book Club: Updraft by Fran Wilde
